story:
@EaseJournal is for you to

  • understand your journey more deeply;
  • love yourself more kindly;
  • embrace your life with a mindful vision and concrete actions. 

 

@EaseJournal is printed journal on high quality, environmentally-friendly paper with a faux leather hardcover for years of durability.

The journal serves as a perfect bi-monthly complement to your daily journal.

 

 

Daily journals help you accomplish tasks and gain productivity;  @Ease helps you to stop to rest and be still.

 

 

Daily journals help you take care of daily activities; @Ease shows you where you are in the journey; and brings you back to your holistic vision . 

 

 

Daily journals help you move towards to your future goals; @Ease reminds you how the "here and now" can be fulfilling and enjoyable.

 

 

​

Supporting your daily journals, planners or to-do lists, @Ease helps you to mindfully observe your life and keep on track with the changes needed to achieve your long-term visions. And especially if you are navigating through a lot challenges and opportunities in life, discovering your life and yourself, @Ease is for you to embrace that wonderful journey, the journey of coming back to who you truly and beautifully are. 

 

The uniqueness 

 

 

 

@EaseJournal was crafted as a long-term visioning method with an open and mindful spirit. The journal is for you to be at ease with who you are, slow down to enjoy the present moment, and still take actions with a mindful and clear vision.

Just like the Zen circle in the ‘at’ (@) of 'at ease', the journal wants to help you be still and calm in this rapidly changing digital world.

 

Every @EaseJournal can be used up to the lifetime of 3 to 5 daily journals.  

 

 

 

The journal is crafted like a tree.

It has roots, flowers, branches, leaves and the surroundings.

 

 

1. The Deep Roots

The Deep Roots reminds you of the happiness seeds found deep in your life. Thinking of this as a daily gratitude practice but in a more general form. For example, I have a picture of my family and my father’s words as near the base of my deep roots. So, when a storm comes, just like a tree, these deep roots anchor us.

 

2. The Fresh Circle

The Fresh Circle brings to mind fresh flowers. It is for resolving your priorities by focusing on what you consider to be important now as guiding principals in your life. Just like we experience and deal with our priority tasks in our daily journal, in the larger seasons of our lives, we can see clear patterns of priorities that may change with time. Through being aware, you are in touch with your life more deeply, and you benefit through insights about yourself that develop over time.  

 

3. The Solid Year

The Solid Year is like the strong nourishing branches, helping you to form a holistic picture of your progress.The Solid Year is presented as a 12-month calendar so that you can reflect on your monthly goals. Every new month, you may create a new month's calendar in your daily planner/ bullet journal. @Ease Journal wants to help you keep everything in one place holistically, so you will also be able to see where you are in the journey.

 

4. The Clear 24 Hours

Hours are like glossy green leaves, handful but fragile. Every single leaf contributes its best to the larger tree. The Clear 24 Hours is a plan of an ideal day, one that is guided by your feelings, as if you have everything you want. It helps you to clarify the images and imagination of how a perfect and happy day looks like when you achieve all the goals you want. It motivates you to go forwards but also reminds you that by actively being present with every living day, you can immediately make those positive feelings happen right now. 

 

5. The Free Space

The Free Space is where air, sunlight, wind, butterflies, and all other living conditions interact with the tree. It is also where the tree gives back with its oxygen, beauty and fruit. It is the same in @EaseJournal, where you record all lessons you have along the journey, comprising such questions about life as:

  • What do you believe?
  • What do you value?
  • What brings you joy?
  • What is your life mission?

And also

  • Your "bucket lists"
  • A random happy corner
  • Your 5-year template

 

 

Differences between  EaseJournal and daily journals.

Many daily journals start with a clear intention: “What do you want to do with your life?”, and then daily actions are based on that. And it is a perfectly suitable approach when you know what you want and commit to it.

However, this was not my case years ago. Every day passed by without feeling meaningful and contented. I have found another approach, where I can become aware of what I want to do with my life, in the long-term, yet remain mindfully aware and actively enjoy the "here and now."

Neither is better. The most important thing is the one that suits you better.

How does daily journal obscure the long-term vision? 

  • Daily journals focus on small details, and so it might hard to see the big picture; 
  • Certain changes only happen after a period of time.

 

 

It looks SIMPLE and STILL.

 

The modern and minimal design allows the maximum space for you to draw, doodle, or write anything you want to. It reflects the enormous space deep inside of you.

The faux leather hardcover is simple yet durable so the journal can stay with you years. 

Thick and environmentally-friendly papers for a pleasant writing experience.

Sewn-binding helps the journal open flat. And there also is a white bookmark ribbon.

Full A4 size.  Scale comparison with a Macbook Air 13' and an Iphone 6Plus

Not much thicker than an Iphone 6Plus.

 Scale comparison with a Macbook Air 13'

 

 

 

The truth is that I did not intentionally create it!

It's started with my own story, in which an (almost) twenty-something girl felt unfulfilled and restless with life. A lot of options and opportunities materialised, but I did not know how to resolve ideas about what I want. So, I created a 5-year plan with the hope for better life navigation.

After 5 years, my plan didn't work out! I fell into a severe depressive stage, which confirmed to me that a lot of the criticism on long-term planning is true. I was depressed because I was unable to achieve my career and financial goals. Actually I was unable to form the images I needed to form. However, it was also the moment where I realised that I have learned so much about myself along the journey.

It was when I realised, step-by-step, that I learned to let go of the ideal image of "having-it-all", and to be more compassionate towards myself. Breaking down my goals for each month, I have learned most not when achieving them but when looking back at the whole picture of how my goals, and myself, have changed over time. 

And the most important lesson was, “My life is much bigger than my thoughts.” Just being there, and kindly embrace all the expectations for myself, I have been able to accept who am I, and so now I treat myself more kindly. Slowly, I encouraged myself to follow the answer I have found for the question, “What do I truly and happily want to do with my life?” 

 

 

Along the journey of self-understanding and self-loving, I have been so lucky and blessed to receive so much kindness, support, caring, and wisdom in the hardest and toughest moments of my life. So that is why I want to share back, to express my gratitude for what I have received.

Maybe it will help somebody, especially others young people who are exploring life and themselves, and suddenly feel lost.  

So, I have crafted all the lessons in @EaseJournal

GO FOR A PREVIEW OF SOME PAGES HERE

I truly want to share to everyone, so here is the templates for the three most critical parts, which I have explained how to use above. You can print and keep them in one place and observe how you have changed over time.  

A small tip from me: Do it with the people you love if it’s possible. The ultimate goal we have in life is to be happy. And we’re happy and feel loved most when our loved ones can understand and accept us as who we are. Share it with your loved ones, so you both can understand each other’s wishes and dreams,

CLICK HERE FOR FREE PDF DOWNLOAD OF THE TEMPLATE OF "THE FRESH CIRCLE", "THE SOLID YEAR" AND "THE CLEAR 24 HOURS"

  • And if you think they are helpful, please support me by getting the word out to your friends! Thank you very much!

 

 

 

 

References:

Fogg, B. J. 2018. Tiny habits. Available at: http://tinyhabits.com [Fogg working at Stanford University: Persuasive Tech Lab.]

Martin, S. 2011. How to Keep Those New Year’s Resolutions. Harvard Business Review. Available at: https://hbr.org/2011/01/how-to-keep-those 

Neff, K. 2003. Self-Compassion: An Alternative Conceptualization of a Healthy Attitude Toward Oneself. Self and Identity, 2: 85–101. Available at: http://self-compassion.org/wp-content/uploads/p... [Neff working at University of Texas at Austin]

Seppälä, E. 2014. The scientific benefits of Self Compassion Infographic. Available at: https://emmaseppala.com/scientific-benefits-sel... [Seppälä working at Stanford Center For Compassion And Altruism Research And Education].

Statistic Brain. N.d. New Years Resolution Statistics. California: Statistic Brain. Available at: https://www.statisticbrain.com/new-years-resolu...

 

 

 

Where are you now?

At the moment, I have finished prototype printing for the final version. 

Additionally, I am collaborating with a lecturer to integrate @EaseJournal into the content of a course with the aim of reducing self-conflict. 

 

 

All the money is used for the first batch production and further development of @Ease to integrate into schools and education systems, as I believe self-compassion is one of the most important skills for young people to learn.

Even if I won't reach my entire goal, I still continue this path I have chosen. All the money will still be targeted to further develop @Ease Journal and the journaling system. 

-------------------------

You will receive your @EaseJournal by July, so you will have a cup of summer tea with the journal!

 

 

Why is the shipping cost so high?

Because it’s from the Santa Claus. Well, it’s only joking but partly true. I am based in Finland, which makes the transportation more expensive. (Btw, Finland is the happiest country in the world this year). So we are also sending Finnish nature and happy energy to wherever you are. :”)

Back to the point, I do not take anything from the shipping cost. Here you can overview the shipping rate from the Finnish post office + 8% contributing to Indiegogo platform and fee charge. There is also the limited option of shipping (2kg and 5kg). Therefore, a package of three journals has the same shipping price as six journals (Each journal weight approximately 0.7kg). However, this journal is not designed on yearly basis, but rather to be used for 3-5 years. So, the total cost divides by three, I hope it feels more reasonable to you.

 

What?! So, I can use @EaseJournal up to lifetime of 3 to 5 daily journals?

Yes, which actually means 3-5 years. Because @EaseJournal focuses on the big picture. Daily journals/ to-do lists concentrate on short-term planning and actions. @EaseJournal wants to help you have a long-term vision, but in a kind and calm way, with self-compassion, not pushing or forcing your way.  

 

Why is the journal so heavy (and more expensive than average journals too)?

I understand in this fast and rapid world, things should be more convenient, compact and light. But I guess the most important that should be light is our mind and soul. Therefore, the journal was designed with hardcover, full A4 size, and 120gsm papers (1.5 thicker than the standard paper), with the aim helping you solidly and comfortably to stop and be still. As the consequence, the price is a bit higher.     

 

How is the long-term vision with your approach different from other self-help, self-development books?

Well, I don’t think I fully have the answer to the question. But based on my experiences and my mindfulness practice, I have learned the difference in self-development which increases self-esteem; and self-compassion. A Dharma teacher in the Plum Village tradition has put it in this way “But the problem with high self-esteem is you’re still comparing yourself to other people. In fact, sometimes you’re competing with them and secretly hoping they do worse than you do. It’s not a very good way to live a spiritual life. With self-compassion, we’re learning how to bring not just empathy to ourselves but goodwill to ourselves, in a phenomenal way.”

 

When you said you practiced mindfulness training, what does that mean?

It means I practice mindful breathing and smiling to be in touch deeply with life. :”) Practically, I have started the journey since 2013. I spent a couple times (2 weeks to 1 month) in the Plum Village Meditation Center retreats. Plum Village, found by Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Nhat, is a meditation centre based in France. The centre focuses on mindfulness practices. Every year, I always try to spend a minimal amount of time in a retreat. I am now joining in a mindfulness practice group in Helsinki every week. It is an ongoing process. My negative or criticizing thoughts still ‘visit’ me here and there, but I am happy where I am now.  

 

Are you sure it will work? I will love myself more by using your journal?

No, I’m not sure. I have been through the journey and I know how hard it is to love oneself properly. And self-love totally depends on personal commitment. Many people can have self-acceptance and self-compassion without @Ease. @Ease has helped me so I just want to share. Maybe it can provide a simple journaling system that makes things more easily for you to start caring for yourself.

 

Why don’t you offer a PDF perk?

Because I do not think it’s worth it. If you go through the flip, you can see the key contents of @Ease. It’s pretty simple. And I have offered all the key templates and the instructions. You can definitely use the @Ease journaling system in your own way without difficulties. I don’t think it’s fair to charge for the same thing I have shared publicly.

 

Then, why should I buy @Ease Journal?

I don’t really have the answer for this except because you want it and you think it might be helpful for you or your loved ones.

 

I can do all this same thing in my bullet journal? Why I need another journal?

Yes, definitely you are welcome to execute all the ideas I suggest here. You don’t need @Ease. It’s just if you want and think it might be helpful and make your life better. But it’s just based on my experience that when we separate short-term, daily activities, and the passion to achieve goals, complete tasks (daily journal/ bullet journal) with a long-term view, a calm mind, a stop to rest (@Ease), it reduces distraction, and helps our minds to learn and understand better. It’s like the kitchen is for cooking and eating, and the bedroom is for sleeping. :) Talking about bullet journals, the size of @Ease is A4, which gives you more space. @Ease gathers all your thoughts and wishes about the big picture, and it might be easier to see clearly.

 

I am too lazy to have another journal?

It’s not for carrying around l like your daily journal. It’s for a weekend at the end of every month, and you start to check “Ah, what I need to do next”. It encourages you to have time to listen to your self talks, dreams, which is one of the fundamental way to increase self-compassion.

 

What do you mean by doing this journal with my loved ones? I mean isn't a journal very private thing?

I totally understand that journaling is pretty private. I just mean if it’s possible. You don’t need to do it if you’re not comfortable. And self-compassion starts with ourselves first. Please do what you feel is best and most comfortable for you. After that, you might want to share it with your loved ones, so you both can understand each other’s wishes and dreams more.

 

Why on earth you created this journal?

I didn’t intentionally do it. I did it because I couldn’t find anything like it. And it has helped me, so I just think maybe it will help others too.

 

I can’t find the questions I want to ask!!!

Please don’t hesitate to contact me directly via email daukimngan@gmail.com.

 

 

 

The simplified version of the design journey (with pictures)

 

This is my own journal, so called the very first version of @Ease. I'm a bit of pinky type. :")
 
 

This is my Deep Roots! <3 

 

This is my first attempt to navigate my life. Using common sense, creating a mind map!

 

After the mind map, I tried to use 'scenario imagination'!

 

And so, I had my first "Fresh Circle" in 20.11.2013!

 

I originally used the yearly calendar to map out all the plans and steps but it did not quite turn out that way.

 

My wireframe for the first concept.

 

This is the first prototype of the first concept. And credit goes to one of my good friends.

 

When I calmed myself, my first intention was to create a notebook and give all of my lessons to my brother. So that his new journey will be a bit easier on the go.

 

The very first version of 'The Fresh Circle' to my dear brother! I didn't name it back then. I just simply put what I thought most important to him.

 

Then, my drawing and the first draft of @EaseJournal.

 

The first prototype of @Ease. We made a mistake with cover, so it was kind of... reverse. :D Mistakes are a part of every journey. 

 

This is how many versions it takes to get to this!

@EaseJournal to you!

 

Risks & Challenges

This is the first time I am running a large publication project. Although I am quite new and inexperienced, I am trying my best to ensure everything is under my control. I will oversee every step of the process, and hand check every single package before sending it out to your hands.
story_txt:
@EaseJournal is for you to

understand your journey more deeply;

love yourself more kindly;

embrace your life with a mindful vision and concrete actions. 
 @EaseJournal is printed journal on high quality, environmentally-friendly paper with a faux leather hardcover for years of durability.The journal serves as a perfect bi-monthly complement to your daily journal.  Daily journals help you accomplish tasks and gain productivity;  @Ease helps you to stop to rest and be still.  Daily journals help you take care of daily activities; @Ease shows you where you are in the journey; and brings you back to your holistic vision .   Daily journals help you move towards to your future goals; @Ease reminds you how the "here and now" can be fulfilling and enjoyable.  ​Supporting your daily journals, planners or to-do lists, @Ease helps you to mindfully observe your life and keep on track with the changes needed to achieve your long-term visions. And especially if you are navigating through a lot challenges and opportunities in life, discovering your life and yourself, @Ease is for you to embrace that wonderful journey, the journey of coming back to who you truly and beautifully are.  The uniqueness    @EaseJournal was crafted as a long-term visioning method with an open and mindful spirit. The journal is for you to be at ease with who you are, slow down to enjoy the present moment, and still take actions with a mindful and clear vision.Just like the Zen circle in the ‘at’ (@) of 'at ease', the journal wants to help you be still and calm in this rapidly changing digital world. Every @EaseJournal can be used up to the lifetime of 3 to 5 daily journals.    

 
The journal is crafted like a tree.
It has roots, flowers, branches, leaves and the surroundings.
 

 
1. The Deep Roots
The Deep Roots reminds you of the happiness seeds found deep in your life. Thinking of this as a daily gratitude practice but in a more general form. For example, I have a picture of my family and my father’s words as near the base of my deep roots. So, when a storm comes, just like a tree, these deep roots anchor us.

 
2. The Fresh Circle
The Fresh Circle brings to mind fresh flowers. It is for resolving your priorities by focusing on what you consider to be important now as guiding principals in your life. Just like we experience and deal with our priority tasks in our daily journal, in the larger seasons of our lives, we can see clear patterns of priorities that may change with time. Through being aware, you are in touch with your life more deeply, and you benefit through insights about yourself that develop over time.  

 
3. The Solid Year
The Solid Year is like the strong nourishing branches, helping you to form a holistic picture of your progress.The Solid Year is presented as a 12-month calendar so that you can reflect on your monthly goals. Every new month, you may create a new month's calendar in your daily planner/ bullet journal. @Ease Journal wants to help you keep everything in one place holistically, so you will also be able to see where you are in the journey.


 
4. The Clear 24 Hours
Hours are like glossy green leaves, handful but fragile. Every single leaf contributes its best to the larger tree. The Clear 24 Hours is a plan of an ideal day, one that is guided by your feelings, as if you have everything you want. It helps you to clarify the images and imagination of how a perfect and happy day looks like when you achieve all the goals you want. It motivates you to go forwards but also reminds you that by actively being present with every living day, you can immediately make those positive feelings happen right now. 


 
5. The Free Space
The Free Space is where air, sunlight, wind, butterflies, and all other living conditions interact with the tree. It is also where the tree gives back with its oxygen, beauty and fruit. It is the same in @EaseJournal, where you record all lessons you have along the journey, comprising such questions about life as:

What do you believe?
What do you value?
What brings you joy?
What is your life mission?

And also

Your "bucket lists"
A random happy corner
Your 5-year template


 
 

Differences between  EaseJournal and daily journals.
Many daily journals start with a clear intention: “What do you want to do with your life?”, and then daily actions are based on that. And it is a perfectly suitable approach when you know what you want and commit to it.

However, this was not my case years ago. Every day passed by without feeling meaningful and contented. I have found another approach, where I can become aware of what I want to do with my life, in the long-term, yet remain mindfully aware and actively enjoy the "here and now."
Neither is better. The most important thing is the one that suits you better.



How does daily journal obscure the long-term vision? 

Daily journals focus on small details, and so it might hard to see the big picture; 
Certain changes only happen after a period of time.

 



 
It looks SIMPLE and STILL.
 
The modern and minimal design allows the maximum space for you to draw, doodle, or write anything you want to. It reflects the enormous space deep inside of you.

The faux leather hardcover is simple yet durable so the journal can stay with you years. 

Thick and environmentally-friendly papers for a pleasant writing experience.

Sewn-binding helps the journal open flat. And there also is a white bookmark ribbon.

Full A4 size.  Scale comparison with a Macbook Air 13' and an Iphone 6Plus

Not much thicker than an Iphone 6Plus.

 Scale comparison with a Macbook Air 13'


 
 



 
The truth is that I did not intentionally create it!
It's started with my own story, in which an (almost) twenty-something girl felt unfulfilled and restless with life. A lot of options and opportunities materialised, but I did not know how to resolve ideas about what I want. So, I created a 5-year plan with the hope for better life navigation.
After 5 years, my plan didn't work out! I fell into a severe depressive stage, which confirmed to me that a lot of the criticism on long-term planning is true. I was depressed because I was unable to achieve my career and financial goals. Actually I was unable to form the images I needed to form. However, it was also the moment where I realised that I have learned so much about myself along the journey.
It was when I realised, step-by-step, that I learned to let go of the ideal image of "having-it-all", and to be more compassionate towards myself. Breaking down my goals for each month, I have learned most not when achieving them but when looking back at the whole picture of how my goals, and myself, have changed over time. 

And the most important lesson was, “My life is much bigger than my thoughts.” Just being there, and kindly embrace all the expectations for myself, I have been able to accept who am I, and so now I treat myself more kindly. Slowly, I encouraged myself to follow the answer I have found for the question, “What do I truly and happily want to do with my life?” 
 

 
Along the journey of self-understanding and self-loving, I have been so lucky and blessed to receive so much kindness, support, caring, and wisdom in the hardest and toughest moments of my life. So that is why I want to share back, to express my gratitude for what I have received.
Maybe it will help somebody, especially others young people who are exploring life and themselves, and suddenly feel lost.  
So, I have crafted all the lessons in @EaseJournal
GO FOR A PREVIEW OF SOME PAGES HERE
I truly want to share to everyone, so here is the templates for the three most critical parts, which I have explained how to use above. You can print and keep them in one place and observe how you have changed over time.  
A small tip from me: Do it with the people you love if it’s possible. The ultimate goal we have in life is to be happy. And we’re happy and feel loved most when our loved ones can understand and accept us as who we are. Share it with your loved ones, so you both can understand each other’s wishes and dreams,
CLICK HERE FOR FREE PDF DOWNLOAD OF THE TEMPLATE OF "THE FRESH CIRCLE", "THE SOLID YEAR" AND "THE CLEAR 24 HOURS"

And if you think they are helpful, please support me by getting the word out to your friends! Thank you very much!

story:
* Feel free to follow Jeremie on Instagram for all of the latest updates on this project.

Story of My Book

In the Shadow of Big Tech is a collection of short stories from my childhood in Silicon Valley. These stories serve as a window to illuminate the origins of core features of the cultural ethos here.

My upbringing was dwarfed by the powerful entrepreneurial culture and technocratic mentality that thrives in Northern California. This book project was sparked by a concern about the impact of technology on people's interpersonal relationships, emotional well-being, and the ability to engage in civic life. Upon moving back to the Bay Area from China I embarked on a quest to get involved in my city's local government. When mentoring youths, I discovered that depression and anxiety were high amongst children and teens in town. This brought back memories of my childhood.

My name is Jeremie Gluckman Picard and I'm the author of In the Shadow of Big Tech a book where I reflect on my formative years in Silicon Valley and unpack core assumptions about innovation, equity, and productivity that originate here. These assumptions are affecting individuals and communities worldwide.

I hope that reading this book will serve as a platform for critical dialogue about the on-the-ground impact of Silicon Valley mindsets and development models. The stories from my childhood, expert interviews, research, knowledge, and interactive modules provide the scaffolding for open and honest conversations about core assumptions that permeate the Valley.

You'll love this book if you're looking to humanize a region that has brought you many of the scaled technologies you use daily both at work and at home. In the Shadow of Big Tech is a nonfiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs, movement starters, and change-makers. Both the hard-headed realists and mission-driven idealists are invited to participate. The goal is to provide a common language and dispel false dichotomies to unlock the promise that technology can decentralize access to wealth and power. I'm excited to explore what lies in these shadows together. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I am raising the publishing funds myself to own the book's creative rights and to invite readers on my journey, and I have set up various pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for final publication. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling before publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish it.
  • Any amount raised beyond this and subsequent book royalties will be donated to charitable causes selected by the #shadowoftech community of beta readers and experts.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish,
  • A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book,
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”),
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback,
  • The opportunity to help me select my cover,
  • A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book,

And more!

About the Author 

Jeremie Gluckman believes that technology drives human connection. They're a marketing professional who helps companies unlock the networked value of their customer base by humanizing products and making them accessible to all. Their passion is delivering excellent digital experiences. 

In their spare time, they volunteer as an Arts Commissioner in the City of Sunnyvale and will most likely be found in the studio refining their skills as a contemporary dancer. Jeremie served with the Peace Corps in China and has a degree in Economics and Dance from Sarah Lawrence College. 

Please feel free to keep in touch with Jeremie on Instagram and Linkedin.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up to date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes it. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ShadowOfTech and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of this page
  • Share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for your support. The process of being vulnerable, sharing my values, and revealing my perspectives has been a journey and I feel fortunate to have such a strong community here to help amplify my voice.  

Thanks again,

Jeremie
story_txt:
* Feel free to follow Jeremie on Instagram for all of the latest updates on this project.
Story of My Book
In the Shadow of Big Tech is a collection of short stories from my childhood in Silicon Valley. These stories serve as a window to illuminate the origins of core features of the cultural ethos here.
My upbringing was dwarfed by the powerful entrepreneurial culture and technocratic mentality that thrives in Northern California. This book project was sparked by a concern about the impact of technology on people's interpersonal relationships, emotional well-being, and the ability to engage in civic life. Upon moving back to the Bay Area from China I embarked on a quest to get involved in my city's local government. When mentoring youths, I discovered that depression and anxiety were high amongst children and teens in town. This brought back memories of my childhood.
My name is Jeremie Gluckman Picard and I'm the author of In the Shadow of Big Tech a book where I reflect on my formative years in Silicon Valley and unpack core assumptions about innovation, equity, and productivity that originate here. These assumptions are affecting individuals and communities worldwide.
I hope that reading this book will serve as a platform for critical dialogue about the on-the-ground impact of Silicon Valley mindsets and development models. The stories from my childhood, expert interviews, research, knowledge, and interactive modules provide the scaffolding for open and honest conversations about core assumptions that permeate the Valley.
You'll love this book if you're looking to humanize a region that has brought you many of the scaled technologies you use daily both at work and at home. In the Shadow of Big Tech is a nonfiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs, movement starters, and change-makers. Both the hard-headed realists and mission-driven idealists are invited to participate. The goal is to provide a common language and dispel false dichotomies to unlock the promise that technology can decentralize access to wealth and power. I'm excited to explore what lies in these shadows together. 

What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I am raising the publishing funds myself to own the book's creative rights and to invite readers on my journey, and I have set up various pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for final publication. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling before publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish it.
Any amount raised beyond this and subsequent book royalties will be donated to charitable causes selected by the #shadowoftech community of beta readers and experts.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish,
A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book,
Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”),
Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback,
The opportunity to help me select my cover,
A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book,

And more!

About the Author 
Jeremie Gluckman believes that technology drives human connection. They're a marketing professional who helps companies unlock the networked value of their customer base by humanizing products and making them accessible to all. Their passion is delivering excellent digital experiences. 
In their spare time, they volunteer as an Arts Commissioner in the City of Sunnyvale and will most likely be found in the studio refining their skills as a contemporary dancer. Jeremie served with the Peace Corps in China and has a degree in Economics and Dance from Sarah Lawrence College. 
Please feel free to keep in touch with Jeremie on Instagram and Linkedin.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.
The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up to date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes it. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ShadowOfTech and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of this page
Share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for your support. The process of being vulnerable, sharing my values, and revealing my perspectives has been a journey and I feel fortunate to have such a strong community here to help amplify my voice.  
Thanks again,
Jeremie

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Kate Owens and I am the author of Rootless. I wrote this book because I am incredibly passionate about helping people make lifestyle changes, yet I understand the complex barriers that often stand in the way preventing achievement of long term success.

My hope is that from reading this book you will discover the need for new solutions to help someone increase physical activity and change diet-it is not a simple process. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for living a healthy life and ensuring others receive the support to do so. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you tackle your own health behavior change journey!

In this book, you'll learn about the four essential themes, ROOTS, I uncovered that are required for changing a consequential health behavior:

The power of Reflection

The importance of taking steps One at a time

The strength of Others

The necessity for Tailoring help to the individual

You will love this book if you are looking to make a lifestyle change, wanting to support a loved one on a health change journey, or curious about the future of our medical system. Rootless is a non-fiction book that speaks to health promoters and Americans alike who are looking for foundational support and lasting success for the first time.

 

The Book - Rootless

The book is written in 6 Parts:

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional background chapters. This part lays the foundation for the rest of the book. It explores what the problem is and why it is necessary to be addressed. The reader will learn the story that sparked my inspiration to tackle a large problem our country faces today.

Part 2 Reflection contains Chapters 1-4. The reader will learn the art of reflection and how it can be a powerful tool in tackling challenging health behaviors such as losing weight or consistently incorporating physical activity into a daily routine. Rick Miner shares his story on how introspection, both within himself and of his past, helped him lose over 200 pounds.

Part 3 One Thing at a Time contains Chapters 5-8. Part 3 explores the theme of breaking tasks into manageable chunks so as to smoothly help with health behavior transitions. The research of Sean Young, PhD, a behavioral psychologist and medical school professor at UCLA, demonstrates this critical piece when changing health habits.

Part 4 Others contains Chapters 9-13. Part 4 teaches the incredible power of community support and why it is so beneficial for health behavior changes. It looks at already existing communities that support healthy lifestyles and what enables them to have success. The Cost of Loneliness project is a movement that seeks to combat loneliness and its resounding detrimental health effects.

Part 5 Tailoring contains Chapters 14-17. This section dictates the importance of acknowledging the individual. Whether it is as simple as determining specific preferences or as complex as recognizing large personal, familial, and societal influences, there are many factors that affect an individual's health status. Dr. White Perkins walks me through her incredibly important work in Detroit working to fight social determinants of health to allow for more tailored care.

Part 6 A Way Forward contains Chapters 18-20. The concluding section ties together the extensive research and lays out a path that may hold a potential solution. It examines the two different fields of workplace wellness and preventative care in which this approach may feasibly be implemented.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
  • When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Kate Owens is the head Exercise Specialist at the St. Joseph Mercy Ann Arbor branch of the nation's leading weight management program for children and adolescents, ShapeDown.

She wrote Rootless because she is incredibly passionate about helping people find and live a life full of wellness. Through her education and professional experiences, however, she understands the many barriers that people may face along the way to eating healthy and engaging in physical activity. She hopes to shed light on a way to to support patients in making these necessary lifestyle changes.

A student-athlete at the University of Michigan studying movement science and public health, she consistently seeks out ways to engage in the health and wellness field including volunteering as a health coach and becoming a research assistant on a project aiming to understand the effects of an elevated heart rate in an individual exercising on insulin levels. She is also a member of the University of Michigan's chapter of the National Initiative of Exercise is Medicine. 

For more information you can connect with Kate at kateowns@umich.edu.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. 
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Kate Owens

story:
SPECS!

 

-6” x 9”
-40-45 pages
-Full Color
-Hard cover
-Matte finish

       Actual cover appearance may vary

 

 

Where are the funds going?

 

Printing & Distributing! The book is complete, all that’s left to do is send it over to the printer. However, this requires a relatively large one-time payment so that’s where this campaign comes in.

-$1000 is roughly the cost it will take to print 100 hard-cover books
-$300-$400 is for shipping costs
-And the rest is for the combined smaller fees such as an ISBN no. for the book, fulfilling perks, IndieGoGo’s platform fee, market place fees for listing the book and selling through sites like Amazon and Storenvy… etc.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

This would be my first time getting a book made! Everything is new to me and I’m still learning a lot about the process. I’ve already faced many obstacles just to get this campaign up and running, and I’m sure there will be more along the way. But this is something I really want to do, so I’m going to give it my all and find ways to overcome any challenges that will be thrown my way. I will also be sure to be as transparent as I can during the process, providing updates to backers on how the process is going during and after the campaign is over. So be sure to check the comments and update tabs if you wanna know what’s up!

-This campaign is funded on a fixed basis, meaning if the goal isn’t reached by the campaign deadline then IndieGoGo will automatically refund any money raised back to doners. So, if in the unfortunate case this campaign doesn’t reach its goal, there is no risk to people who have already backed the project.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Let’s face it, sometimes people just simply can’t donate, but that doesn’t mean you can’t make a difference!

A huge way anyone can help out this project is by spreading the word. Tell your friends, your family, that guy who always beats you in line for your morning coffee, you get it. Sharing this page with people who may be interested in supporting would help me out big time.

At the top of the page there are share buttons that you can use to easily send this project around!

 

Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to read and consider this project. You are beautiful <3

 

About the creator - Zaccura

 

I’m some gal who started doodling one day 4 ½ years ago out of boredom and hasn’t been able to stop since (I still suspect my pencil must have possessed me… I am notorious for losing pencils so the fact I’ve been using the same one for over four years is HIGHLY SUSPICIOUS O,o).

Like anyone who tries to draw “seriously” for the first time, I uh… well… *cough*… was not very good at first. Like… VERY not very good. You might even say “bad”. BUT! I think that was one of the reasons I became obsessed to get better. I’m the kind’a person that if you give me something to do that I’m not great at, I simply MUST keep doing it until I’m at least decent. You know, the stubborn type.

And so began my journey to not be very-not-very-good at drawing. (Let that sentence bake your noodle for a while).

Soon after starting my art quest, I also started writing. My first works were fan stories based off of pre-existing shows and worlds. Yeah, VERY cringy. But that caused the writer’s bug to bite me; there was something incredibly fulfilling about creating characters, figuring out their lives, and fitting them into a world. And when drawing could be combined into this creation, and suddenly characters could have faces and expressions (and of course swaggin’ outfits), it was like discovering -- as cheesy at it sounds-- magic.

An illustrator/writer has the ability, on their own, to create life that never existed before, make worlds and situations that are seemingly impossible, possible. They can make people cry, laugh, THINK, all with nothing more than a wave of their pencil and pen. If that isn’t the closest thing to magic in the world then I don’t know what is.

Writing and drawing quickly became more than something I was stubbornly trying to get better at “just cuz”. It became my passion, and from it bred dreams.
“Just cuz” will only get ya so far when it comes to improving, but dreams will whip your work ethic into shape like nothing else (well maybe necessity triumphs in that department, but still). If you’re gonna achieve a dream then you gotta put in the grind work of improving your craft, something I’ve been working on ever since I picked up my pencil in 2014.

Long story short: Me like drawing. Me like writing. Me love put two together. And me hope you like.

(Ya’ll better not quote that XD )

                                                                                              -Zaccura 

 

                           Contact

 

                                      Have a question? Feel free to contact me any time!

                                      My Twitter and Instagram handle is: @zaccura_art
                                      And my e-mail is: zaccurabusiness@gmail.com

                              Also you can find me on YouTube where I post weekly videos: 
                                                          youtube.com/c/zaccura

                                      Have a question? Feel free to contact me any time!
                                      My Twitter and Instagram handle is: @zaccura_art                                      And my e-mail is: zaccurabusiness@gmail.com
                              Also you can find me on YouTube where I post weekly videos:                                                           youtube.com/c/zaccura

story:
Story of My Book

Our Exclusive Society explores a diverse range of topics that fall under the category of inclusive design through stories that range from accessibility, sexism, and culturalization.

My name is Rachel Rodney and I am the author of Our Exclusive Society. I wrote this book because inclusive design is a really interesting space - first I was interested in accessible design, then universal design, then realized the broader issue in itself was the exclusion embedded in society. When I realized this space of inclusive design was still largely unexplored, I embarked on my own journey to see what else I could learn through talking to people involved in forming more inclusive experiences.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that many people are excluded by what others put out every day - and that with more thorough understanding and creativity, these people don’t have to be excluded. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for inclusive design in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you open your mind and consider who you aren’t considering now, whether it be in your designs or the way that you treat people in your workplace.

In this book, we'll explore culturalization and accessibility:

  • The need to customize games by culture.
  • The imperative of personal independence through design.

Makers and creators will love this book as a guide to start sharing your work with everyone!

My first non-fiction book, Our Exclusive Society, speaks to designers and creatives who look to inclusive design for help opening their work to a more diverse audience.

 

The Book - Our Exclusive Society

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. This will include a background in inclusive design, such as what is going on in this space today. Another important part of this is defining what inclusive design is! 

Part 2 goes in depth about some different populations that are impacted by exclusion, aligned with stories I heard about from primary interviews with people that have in some way been involved in inclusion.

Part 3 looks at more theoretical aspects of inclusion, such as the crossroads of inclusive design and empathy.
 

What I Need, What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer!
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies, I will publish a hardcover edition. So back me up! 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Rachel Rodney is a UX student who has researched the experience of people using 3D printed prosthetics, and studied abroad in South Africa learning about the experience people have with disability in resource limited communities. She has also been to many toy adaption events, adapting circuitry in electronic toys so that they can be attached to switches or buttons, making the interactions a child might have with the toy accessible. Rachel has also recently been studying in India, designing the idea for an application which would make job searching more inclusive to migrant workers and work to decrease their chances of being exploited. This included many interviews with migrant workers and local employers, to design for the needs that set migrant workers apart from locals.

At first Rachel was interested in accessibility, after realizing how accessibility may have impacted her mom’s life, and also getting involved in a club where she did research about topics in accessibility. However, her experience studying abroad in South Africa, where she learned about compounded disparities and how that applied to disability in communities with limited resources, really made her more aware of how there are so many different factors in people lives that lead to exclusive experiences in our societies. Rachel’s interest in this space of inclusion and passion and belief that design can change the world has led her to write this book about inclusive design.

Outside of this book, Rachel is a Human Centered Design and Engineering student at the University of Washington. She loves learning about the research that fuels designs, and working in coffee shops. 

For more information you can connect with Rachel at rachhanrodney@gmail.com and LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/rachelrodney/).

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ourexclusivesociety and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page using Twitter, Facebook, and email link buttons at the top of this page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Rachel Rodney
story_txt:
Story of My Book
Our Exclusive Society explores a diverse range of topics that fall under the category of inclusive design through stories that range from accessibility, sexism, and culturalization.My name is Rachel Rodney and I am the author of Our Exclusive Society. I wrote this book because inclusive design is a really interesting space - first I was interested in accessible design, then universal design, then realized the broader issue in itself was the exclusion embedded in society. When I realized this space of inclusive design was still largely unexplored, I embarked on my own journey to see what else I could learn through talking to people involved in forming more inclusive experiences.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that many people are excluded by what others put out every day - and that with more thorough understanding and creativity, these people don’t have to be excluded. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for inclusive design in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you open your mind and consider who you aren’t considering now, whether it be in your designs or the way that you treat people in your workplace.In this book, we'll explore culturalization and accessibility:

The need to customize games by culture.
The imperative of personal independence through design.

Makers and creators will love this book as a guide to start sharing your work with everyone!
My first non-fiction book, Our Exclusive Society, speaks to designers and creatives who look to inclusive design for help opening their work to a more diverse audience.

story:
Rethinking Justice: Inside America’s Movement for Prosecution Reform


My name is Vincenzo Guido and I am the author of Rethinking Justice: Inside America’s Movement for Prosecution Reform. Leading the world in the number of known incarcerated persons — well over two million people — it’s no wonder the U.S. stands at the epicenter of impassioned political debate. Prosecution reform observers have validly decried our current approach to criminal justice as perilously broken and in dire need of reform.

While the hydra that is reform has many heads, my book focuses on one area that often goes overlooked in serious conversations of reform: the prosecutor. From beginning to end, the prosecutor wields considerable power and influence in the enforcement of our laws and how we as a society respond.


Historically, run-of-the-mill district attorneys (oftentimes regardless of political stripe) have virulently pursued a zealous, tough-on-crime approach to prosecution. Today, in major cities across the country, a newly minted generation of prosecutors is redefining the role of the district attorney. Will this shift effect meaningful criminal justice reform? Is this ostensible political paradox — loosely dubbed “progressive prosecution” — even possible?


In this book, we’ll explore the current state of American prosecution and its connection to mass incarceration. We will consider how prosecution occupies an uniquely important and powerful role in protecting their local communities. However, we will also examine how those who come into contact with the criminal justice system often have the trajectory of their lives forever impacted. Most importantly, we will take a look at some of the brand new prosecutors who are among those leading the charge to change the way we handle crime in America. These civil servants seek to go beyond filling our jails and prisons and instead seek a different approach to justice.


Full disclosure: I am a soon-to-be recent college graduate. I am not a criminal justice expert, prosecutor, nor attorney. To this point, I have no experiences as an incarcerated individual, nor as an officer of the state tasked with maintaining safety in our communities. I am, however, a citizen who calls upon fellow students, voters, and community members to intensively study the issues affecting our criminal justice system that have had immeasurably damaging effects for virtually all stakeholders. I do not aim to decisively solve these challenges with this book; instead, it is my hope that you will join me in considering the problems that face our current state of prosecution in America and work to contribute to dialogue and debate regarding how to remedy those challenges.

 

A Road Map of the Book



Rethinking Justice is written in 3 Parts....


Part [1] dives right into the current state of the American criminal justice system. We consider how prosecution and our historical approach to addressing crime fits into our broader narrative of law enforcement in the United States.


Part [2] introduces you to some of the newly minted generation of prosecutors — dubbed “progressive prosecutors” — and the work they are doing to try and upend antiquated approaches to criminal prosecution. We will look at a few key figures — committed civil servants leading the way for reform — and how they are attempting (or failing, or succeeding, or considering) to facilitate change in their local communities.


Part [3] takes us to the present moment. Are these progressive prosecution tactics working? Is reform in prosecution just getting started or are these movements outliers? Ultimately, time will tell, and what we explore will prove to be critical areas of focus for future study.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get



Rethinking Justice will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this July.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of Rethinking Justice, I’ll publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I’ll also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I’ll publish a hardcover edition.




I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

And more...

About the Author



Vincenzo Guido is a graduating senior at Cornell University studying Industrial & Labor Relations, with a minor in Law & Society and Crimes, Prisons, Education, and Justice (CPEJ). He is interested in the evolution of American criminal justice policy and working toward solutions to address mass incarceration.


Vincenzo is writing this book to contribute to ongoing conversations regarding meaningful reform to the American criminal justice system. He specifically aims to focus on how prosecution in particular is among the most significant areas in need of reform in order to seriously address systemic injustices in American criminal justice.


When Vincenzo is not working on this project or taking classes, he enjoys spending time with his five other siblings, eating too much pasta, and failing to clean up after his two English Mastiffs.


For more information you can connect with Vincenzo at vlg28@cornell.edu

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.


The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #RethinkingJustice and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Vincenzo Guido

story:
¿Qué?

Negro es, según palabras de su autora, una novela para lectores avisados que aborrecen los caminos muy marcados y que están deseosos de usar todos sus sentidos en dirección, o no, de las pistas que irán descubriendo.

Desde Burdeos, Ofelia tiene una pesadilla del futuro y un pasado que necesita reencontrar; desde Valladolid, Diana no consigue vivir en el presente y deberá hacer frente a algún reto de lo más inusual. Los pasos de Ofelia tomarán las riendas de la historia a través de un camino un poco turbulento en el que no faltarán momentos para recordar.

Romance, amistad, familia… son los ingredientes esenciales de la aventura que vivirán los personajes, a un nivel más onírico que real, con los pies ligeramente sobre la Tierra.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Noemí Mendarozqueta.

Cuando naces entre libros y tus primeros recuerdos proceden de cuentos fastásticos sobre leones que acaban entablando amistad con pequeñas bolitas de pelo que maúllan, sabes hacia dónde vas a dar tus primeros pasos; de padre español y madre francesa, mi mundo giró desde el principio e indudablemente alrededor de las letras y de las diferentes culturas. Filóloga de inglés y estudiante en ruso e italiano, esta es mi primera novela como tal, escrita en mi lengua paterna.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Hasta entonces me creía hija única. Sí, hasta el momento en que me presentaron a aquella niña; aquella niña de pelo negro, largo y descuidado, vestida de un rostro amorfo, que se me acercó, inesperadamente, a darme el más inocente y mortal de los abrazos. Estaba fría. No recuerdo haber oído salir nada de su boca, pero creo que agradeció recibir aquel abrazo que ella misma había ofrecido.
          Irreconocibles voces poblaban el ambiente… me dijeron que esa niña era mi hermana; hermanastra, siendo más precisa. Cómo pudo mi madre haber callado cosa igual, tal detalle de su vida, esa otra vida, tanto tiempo, y contármelo con tanta naturalidad, como si debiera saberlo antes incluso de serme anunciado.
          Me dijeron que aquella niña necesitaba de mi calor. Aquel abrazo quizás fuese el primer paso de su vida. No me cuesta creerlo… creo que sonrió. Pero sonrió con el alma, con el corazón, porque su cara permaneció neutra. Creo que le vi la cara.
          Para mi gran sorpresa, un último detalle me revelaron acerca de aquella niña. “Y no sabes los sueños que tiene”, me decían. Vi palidecer el rostro de mi interlocutor. Creo que no se trataba exactamente de sueños. “No sabes lo que sueña esa niña”. Me asusté. ¡Me asustaron! ¡Demonios! ¡Qué era eso! ¡Quién es esa niña! ¡Qué le ha pasado a mi hermana! ¿Mi hermana? ¡Está muerta!»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Negro que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Noemí Mendarozqueta vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

Sí, hasta el momento en que me presentaron a aquella niña; aquella niña de pelo negro, largo y descuidado, vestida de un rostro amorfo, que se me acercó, inesperadamente, a darme el más inocente y mortal de los abrazos. Estaba fría. No recuerdo haber oído salir nada de su boca, pero creo que agradeció recibir aquel abrazo que ella misma había ofrecido.          Irreconocibles voces poblaban el ambiente… me dijeron que esa niña era mi hermana; hermanastra, siendo más precisa. Cómo pudo mi madre haber callado cosa igual, tal detalle de su vida, esa otra vida, tanto tiempo, y contármelo con tanta naturalidad, como si debiera saberlo antes incluso de serme anunciado.          Me dijeron que aquella niña necesitaba de mi calor. Aquel abrazo quizás fuese el primer paso de su vida. No me cuesta creerlo… creo que sonrió. Pero sonrió con el alma, con el corazón, porque su cara permaneció neutra. Creo que le vi la cara.          Para mi gran sorpresa, un último detalle me revelaron acerca de aquella niña. “Y no sabes los sueños que tiene”, me decían. Vi palidecer el rostro de mi interlocutor. Creo que no se trataba exactamente de sueños. “No sabes lo que sueña esa niña”. Me asusté. ¡Me asustaron! ¡Demonios! ¡Qué era eso! ¡Quién es esa niña! ¡Qué le ha pasado a mi hermana! ¿Mi hermana? ¡Está muerta!»
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Negro que saldría después a la venta.
Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.
Además...
Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Noemí Mendarozqueta vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
Política de Privacidad

story:
The 'Whibbits!' storybook

'Whibbits!', a story about making the most of what we have around us; recycling, imagination, friendship.... and the brilliance of dogs!

(A mock-up page showing the style direction and sample text)

 

Project aims

  • I need to reach pre-orders of 50 books and 15 models in order to create the book
  • The 38 page book will be suitable for all ages, particularly appropriate as a 'level one reader' children's book for ages 5-8, but can be read to younger children and enjoyed by adults.
  • It will be around 500 words long and told in verse.
  • The story will feature photos of real models and props, with added illustrative elements.
  • The book will also have an interactive 'activity' section, where readers will be encouraged to get creative. 

 

Story and characters

(Bits, a posable dog puppet/model made from recycled and repurposed objects)

Bits is a 'whibbit', a little dog made from an old shoe, pencils, lolly sticks, bike chain and other everyday objects.  She lives on a desktop, helping her creator with his jobs - fetching things and cheering him up. They are best friends, and Bits loves her job, but her owner can't help thinking it'd be nice if she had more friends and more fun. We'll explore the house with Bits as she meets different little critters and searches for useful objects for the artists next project... 

(3 of each 'critter' designs will appear in the book and are available to buy) 

(The other whibbit is based on a classic design that is available to buy from my shop)

 

Background and inspiration

(My little home studio where I design, build  and animate... and hopefully create a book)

Hi! I'm James. I am an art tutor for learning disabled artists (www.venturearts.com) and an illustrator working in medical textbooks and self published children's books.  For the past few years I have also been an experimental animator and model maker, self-funding and crowd-funding my projects along the way...

(My whippets Penny and Eric, the source of inspiration for the whibbits)

This began in 2014 when I was inspired by the innovative and resourceful approach used in classic stop-motion animation such as The Clangers. I set myself the challenge to make my first stop-motion puppet - a dog inspired by my two whippets made using only what I had in my tool box...  This developed into an ongoing project called 'Whibbits!'  in which I make animations, design merchandise and sell replica models. You can see and read more about my work on my website (www.whibbits.com).

'The Whibbits Storybook' is a development of this idea, focusing on new characters to tell a fun, heartfelt story that celebrates the ethos of my work - making the most of what we have around us... and the joy that dogs bring to our lives.  And I'm looking for your help to fund this project 

 

Current stages of development

  • The main character puppet is complete. Bits is a newer, larger and more detailed whibbit, made using recycled items. 
  • The second character puppet is also complete. He is based on the whibbit classic design, but with its own funky colours. 
  • Six new 'critter' prototypes have been developed. I have the blueprints and instructions I will need to make the final versions. 
  • The 500 word story has been drafted and re-drafted over the last few months. It is now at a good working stage. 
  • The plans for the 19 double-page spreads have been drawn, along with notes for how to develop these drawings into becoming real sets.  

 

What I need to do next

If funded I will;

  • Create the sets & props needed for each page. Each has its own logistics - testing and experimenting will be necessary.
  • Develop the visual style of the book, using photoshop to edit, manipulate and add other illustrative elements. 
  • Make three of each critter model. These will be neat, refined models in different poses
  • Adapt and reconfigure my studio for the specific demands of each photoshoot
  • Send the writing to be reviewed by a professional copy editor. A final draft will be developed alongside the production of the visual design. 
  • Design the interactive activity pages 

 

Risks & Challenges

I love to take a risk and set myself challenges. I have pushed myself with every project I have  crowdfunded in the past and always delivered a result. I use the pressures of these challenges and deadlines to drive me forward. I can rise to this challenge because: 

  • I have the ground work (model design and story) in place. 
  • I have the studio space and equipment
  • I have the cameras, hardware and programs 
  • I have done the research into production costs
  • I have experience in getting artwork ready for publishing 
  • I have the passion and drive 
  • I hope to have further backing from my wonderful whibbit supporters! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to ordering a book, adopting a critter model or donating you can help by spreading the word! Share the project with any parents, dog owners, or fans of up-cycled projects.

You can also buy whibbits merchandise and models from my shop (www.whibbits.com/shop) . All proceeds will also help fund this project.

Selling 50 books and 15 models is a massive task, and I can only reach the target with your help!
