story:
Story of My Book

The Third Culture Teen: In Between Cultures, In Between Life Stages is a memoir/non-fiction book featuring stories from the author and various Third Culture Kids of different backgrounds getting by in this world as an expat.

My name is Jiwon Lee, and I am the author of The Third Culture Teen: In Between Cultures, In Between Life Stages. I wrote this book because I wanted to give a name to all the teenage Third Culture Kids out there who felt misunderstood and uncategorized.

My whole life I have struggled, and still struggle, with the question of my identity. Having spent more than half of my lifetime outside of Korea, where I was born, I never had the confidence to call myself a true Korean — or really a true anything. I was a mish-mash of all the cultures that lived within me, and I’ve been insecure about my unfinished, incomplete self for a long time.

The term Third Culture Kid gives a name to what I am and the community of people like me around the world who share the same experience. I wanted other confused teens like myself to know that they belong somewhere.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what being a “Third Culture Teen” entails, of all the struggles and excitement of growing up stuck between cultures and stuck between being a kid and an adult all at the same time! In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the Third Culture Kid community in you. And then, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help teenage Third Culture Kids and Cross-Cultural Kids (immigrant kids/international adoptees/biracial kids, etc) adjust into adulthood, and for non-TCKs, or CCKs, to understand the life of those who grew up between cultures.

In this book, you'll hear stories about the lives of various Third Culture Teen and the ways in which they have overcome their difficulties and used them for their advantage:

  • Different TCKs’ takes on the word “home” and the various categories in which their definitions of “home” fall into
  • Discussions of Third Culture Teen specific issues such as the role of technology or adjustments to college
  • Life stories and advice from adult TCKs in various sectors of society, ranging from Grace Lee, an international school teacher, to Lindie Botes, a polyglot YouTuber

The Book - The Third Culture Teen: In Between Cultures, In Between Life Stages

The book is written in 5 Parts.

Part 0 contains the introduction to the book, in addition to the introduction of the concept of the Third Culture Kid and, more importantly, the Third Culture Teen.

Part 1: The Issues We Face contains Chapters 3-4. I first talk about the concept of home, and the various ways Third Culture Teens might define home. I also discuss the issue of technology and how it can both be helpful yet detrimental to the formation of our identity. I have also included a mini-chapter of my interview with Grace Lee, an adult TCK English teacher in China.

Part 2: The Lives We Live contains Chapters 5-8. I discuss the different struggles Third Culture Teens face in their daily lives, including learning to “adult” in a foreign country, or dealing with differences while interacting with monocultural teens. I have also dedicated a chapter to ways in which we can maximize our advantages as Third Culture Kids.

Part 3: The Life We Will Live contains Chapters 9 and 10. Chapter 9 includes stories from Adult TCKs who have already overcome the struggles of being a “Third Culture Teen,” providing an insight into the lives Third Culture Teens will be facing as an adult. Chapter 10 is dedicated to the importance of sharing our stories as a Third Culture Kid. Because the term TCK is not as widely known yet, it is our responsibility to normalize the term and in turn, normalize our lives in society.

Part 4 is the concluding chapter of the book, including additional resources Third Culture Teens can refer to, and a Conclusion/Epilogue from the author.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
When I publish, you will receive the following:
 
  • A personally signed copy of my book
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • Access to a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Jiwon Lee (or 이지원 or 李知原) is a sophomore majoring in Cinema & Media Studies with a minor in Screenwriting at the University of Southern California in Los Angeles. She is an aspiring filmmaker, serving board positions at USC’s Women of Cinematic Arts and Asian Pacific Cinema Association.

Jiwon is a Third Culture Kid born in Korea, raised in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia for three years (where she learned her English), then in Qingdao, China for around seven years (where she learned some Chinese). She realized the importance of her identity as a TCK when she moved to Los Angeles for college, which inspired her to write this book for other Third Culture Teens struggling to find a place in this world.

When she is not procrastinating on assignments or working on a film set, Jiwon hosts her weekly radio show The Tenth Culture Kid USC’s radio station, KXSC (online at kxsc.org/listen).
She can also be found dog-watching at parks or playing Animal Crossing on her Nintendo Switch.

For more information, you can connect with Jiwon at leejiwon@usc.edu and @ssk05032 on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ThirdCultureTeen and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jiwon :)

story:
While countless texts have explored their ideas and ideologies, which in turn have been studied repeatedly by activists worldwide, this book wishes to put light to other aspects of their ordeal and historical contributions to the National Democratic movement in the Philippines. 

Sison and De lima hold a wealth of knowledge of the history of the revolutionary struggle and were indeed a part of many key moments. 

Moments that can be brought to greater light and imagery. A more vivid account of people who lived history and how they maintain their charge for a better future of their homeland despite being barred from entering the country. 

We all call for your support in this project that will document the lives of two of the Philippines' most important  and contemporary heroes in the struggle for national liberation and genuine democracy.

A more vivid account of people who lived history and how they maintain their charge for a better future of their homeland despite being barred from entering the country. We all call for your support in this project that will document the lives of two of the Philippines' most important  and contemporary heroes in the struggle for national liberation and genuine democracy.

story:
Short Summary

I researched and wrote the first draft of my novel in Thailand at the beginning of 2012, and I now need your help so that I can return to finish it.

With just a little bit of your funding I can realise my dream and make it happen, finish my book and get it out there. Even $10 will make a massive difference between achieving my goal, or having to delay the process indefinitely.

Synopsis

A girl gives up her misguided corporate world in Blighty to write a book in Thailand. On her arrival on a small, knackers-yard of an island she blocks. Then she flows. Into a world where only interbred animals exist, worshipping the pizza-making King and the only pure-breed on the island, a ginger ridgeback hound named Spiney.

Only life is what happens to her when she’s making other books, and the real events and escapades of her time spiral into a mystical whiskey-fuelled adventure of real love, betrayal, Thai boxing, chicken-men and other animals. And onto the page.

Think Cannery Row with a dose of Vonnegut, Spark and Gibran, and you’re not even half-way there. Action, disaster, misdemeanour, humility and survival with a hefty whiff of humour and a tantalising dash of raunch. Not for the faint-hearted, completely for the full. And totally real.

What I Need & What You Get

What I need is just a little bit of cash to get me out to Thailand and stop me from going under. I have, of course, been working and raising funds myself, but they’re not sufficient enough to fly me to the moon, nor keep me in noodle soup.

I am asking for $3200 which would mean I could rent a bungalow at reduced monthly rates, and have enough for a humble existence, whilst concentrating on finishing my book. Costs of living aren’t that high, and I fully intend to use the money discreetly and wisely.

Your small contribution can make a massive difference to my happiness, and of course, in return I will reward you with perks.

The Impact

When I’ve finished the novel I intend to go down the traditional publishing route. I have meetings set up with agents before I intend to depart (beginning of December), and anticipate a lot of interest.

For those of you who aren’t familiar with my style, examples of my writing can be found on my website and various blog sites, just contact me if you want to know more here.

When I’m out in the jungle I will fill your days with joy and let you know how happy you have made me. This project is something I feel I absolutely need to do at this present moment. You really will be helping to contribute to a fulfilling life path for me, and getting my first novel published.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are screwed for cash, you can still help me by spreading the word about my project to more lubricated benefactors! Share on social networks, use the share tools on this site, and let your friends and family know what a worthwhile project this is. It will be so exciting to watch the campaign be a success and reach my target.
story_txt:
Short Summary
I researched and wrote the first draft of my novel in Thailand at the beginning of 2012, and I now need your help so that I can return to finish it.
With just a little bit of your funding I can realise my dream and make it happen, finish my book and get it out there. Even $10 will make a massive difference between achieving my goal, or having to delay the process indefinitely.
Synopsis
A girl gives up her misguided corporate world in Blighty to write a book in Thailand. On her arrival on a small, knackers-yard of an island she blocks. Then she flows. Into a world where only interbred animals exist, worshipping the pizza-making King and the only pure-breed on the island, a ginger ridgeback hound named Spiney.
Only life is what happens to her when she’s making other books, and the real events and escapades of her time spiral into a mystical whiskey-fuelled adventure of real love, betrayal, Thai boxing, chicken-men and other animals. And onto the page.
Think Cannery Row with a dose of Vonnegut, Spark and Gibran, and you’re not even half-way there. Action, disaster, misdemeanour, humility and survival with a hefty whiff of humour and a tantalising dash of raunch. Not for the faint-hearted, completely for the full. And totally real.


What I Need & What You Get
What I need is just a little bit of cash to get me out to Thailand and stop me from going under. I have, of course, been working and raising funds myself, but they’re not sufficient enough to fly me to the moon, nor keep me in noodle soup.
I am asking for $3200 which would mean I could rent a bungalow at reduced monthly rates, and have enough for a humble existence, whilst concentrating on finishing my book. Costs of living aren’t that high, and I fully intend to use the money discreetly and wisely.
Your small contribution can make a massive difference to my happiness, and of course, in return I will reward you with perks.


The Impact
When I’ve finished the novel I intend to go down the traditional publishing route. I have meetings set up with agents before I intend to depart (beginning of December), and anticipate a lot of interest.
For those of you who aren’t familiar with my style, examples of my writing can be found on my website and various blog sites, just contact me if you want to know more here.
When I’m out in the jungle I will fill your days with joy and let you know how happy you have made me. This project is something I feel I absolutely need to do at this present moment. You really will be helping to contribute to a fulfilling life path for me, and getting my first novel published.

If you are screwed for cash, you can still help me by spreading the word about my project to more lubricated benefactors! Share on social networks, use the share tools on this site, and let your friends and family know what a worthwhile project this is. It will be so exciting to watch the campaign be a success and reach my target.

story:
Book Blurb

It was a chance meeting
That changed everything

Before one man loved me
Now two do

One is my husband
The other a lover

I didn't cheat
We had a threesome

But the problem was what followed
My lover wanted more than one night

My husband got angry
My lover got dirty

And I got overwhelmed


The Book's Short Summary

Overwhelmed is a story about Kelly Hamlin, a thirty-seven-year-old self-published author, who is dealing with some serious family issues, including problems in her marriage. In an attempt to inject more spice into their relationship, her husband, Tom Hamlin, suggests going to a sex club, which he later regrets after they meet Eric Firth, the owner of a British publishing company. Unlike Tom’s down-to-earth character, Eric is suave and lives a rich lifestyle, and what he wants, he usually gets. He sets his sights on Kelly and uses his publishing business to draw her in. By the end of the book, you will find out whether Eric’s manipulations bring Tom and Kelly closer together or tear them apart.

The story is mostly set in the present, although at certain points it goes back in time to show how Kelly and Tom met and fell in love. It is set in Auckland, New Zealand.

If this book gains success there will be an OVERWHELMED 2.

Genres: Romance, realism, erotica, drama.
Topics: Marriage, love-triangles, relationships, family drama.

Background

I became interested in writing from a young age and have published my teenage diaries under the title Don't Peek. In my twenties I went to Auckland University, where I concentrated on non-fiction, mainly in the fields of Art History and Italian Studies. In my thirties I veered towards writing fiction, in particular young adult fantasy, which I later dropped for realism, such as seen in my Behind the Lives series and an edgy young adult spin-off called Graffiti Heaven. In addition, I have written a book serial called My Masters’ Nightmare. However, since none of the above projects were mainstream enough to make a living from, I set out to write a story that would gather more public attention. Part way through writing the draft for Overwhelmed, I realized I had finally found the story that could achieve this. Not only did it flow faster than all my other books, the story captivated me, which is hard to do as I’m very critical of my own writing. In saying this, I think it will also captivate other women. Novels like Fifty Shades of Grey and other erotica books are popular for the fantasy they build for women, but they don't focus on the reality of everyday life. Whereas, Overwhelmed has the same female fantasy of being chased by a wealthy man, but is placed in a realistic situation, where the woman has other more important priorities, such as her husband and children. This creates more of a dilemma for the main character, and makes the reader think: "Would I really choose this 'seemingly' idealistic man over my husband?" You will see by the end of the book who Kelly chooses.

In addition to writing, I’m also an artist, although I have put that career on hold in my endeavor on becoming a full-time writer. Because of this, I have decided to give some of my paintings away to people who have donated more than the usual amount. One of the paintings “To the Point” won an art award, while "Tahuna Torea" was picked to be in an exclusive exhibition. Some of my other artworks have won a number of awards, the most prestigious being for a painting of two military officers talking to Afghanistan refugees. In addition, another of my award winning paintings was bought by a previous mayor of Auckland while my largest work which took several months to complete was unveiled by the current prime minister of New Zealand, John Key. If the artworks I have made available go quick, I am open to giving more of my paintings away.

Why Indiegogo?

My daughter came across Indiegogo, and mentioned it to me since she knew I was having trouble funding my writing. I had a look and was instantly captivated. I have financed all of my previous books, which was far too financially draining on my family. There are many expenses involved in self-publishing a book, such as hiring an editor (a significant cost), paying for the cover design, proofs, review giveaways, advertising, etc. Advertising in particular can be a huge expense and is often why many self-published authors wallow in anonymity, mainly due to not having the budget of a traditional publisher. This is another reason why Indiegogo is very important. Through the funding attained from the Indiegogo campaign I will be able to get more people to notice my book. And I do want Overwhelmed to be noticed, because I am very confident it will have a good readership as I have researched the genre to make sure I wasn't jumping head first without knowing the book's audience.

Also, in going on Indiegogo, this project will be noticed by more people. In essence, it’s an advertisement in itself, a platform where I can talk about the project and get people excited about it.

Halfway through the campaign, I will put up another video to show you different aspects about myself and Overwhelmed. People can also ask me questions via the comment section.

I want to assure you that I take my writing very serious and I'm determined be a success in it, so I can help support my family as well as write stories that people enjoy.


Stretch Goals

While I have set the goal at $5000, as it will cover all basic expenses for me to be able to complete Overwhelmed, there are various others costs to further the novel.

Second Goal: $10,000

Translations to Spanish, along with additional costs.

Third Goal: $13,000

Translations to German & Mandarin, along with additional costs.

Fourth Goal: $16,000

Translations to Japanese & French, along with additional costs.

Fifth Goal: $22,000

Translations to Italian & Portuguese, printing, extra marketing and additional costs.

Final Words

I understand that some people may not be able to contribute to my campaign due to financial reasons. However, that doesn’t mean you can't help in other ways.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!


ARTWORKS AVAILABLE FOR HIGHER LEVEL DONATIONS


To the Point


Perun and Veles


Tahuna Torea

story:
Let's make history

Stewart McDonald is the SNP candidate for the Glasgow South constituency, and with your help we can elect him as the first ever SNP MP for this seat.

In order to fight a good, smart campaign we need the funds to do it.  Your donation will help fund a grassroots, local campaign across the communities that make up Glasgow South. It will help pay for campaign literature, telephone canvassing, a campaign base and much more. If we have the resources to win, then you will have helped elect an SNP MP to stand up for the communities of Glasgow South and stand up for Scotland. 

Stewart's campaign

Stewart has 5 key points to communicate to the electorate of Glasgow South. If elected, Stewart will: 

  1. Seek the maximum amount of powers for Scotland
  2. Offer an alternative to austerity
  3. Be restless in tackling inequality and poverty
  4. Work to regenerate the Southside of Glasgow
  5. Pledge to be a visible and accessible MP

Other Ways You Can Help

As well as contributing financially to the campaign there are lots of other ways you can help elect an SNP MP in Glasgow South. To get involved in the campaign and help out with canvassing, leafleting and much more, email glasgowsouthsnp@gmail.com 

You can follow Stewart's campaign on Facebook here 

And on Twitter here

story:
Short Summary

There’s no book-length treatment of the history of filk, the folk music of science fiction fandom. There should be. I’ve started writing one, with the working title Tomorrow’s Songs Today. It will cover the history of filk from the early SF conventions to today. If this campaign is successful, it will be available as a free e-book. It will be available by the end of 2014.

Helping me out will be the same team that supported me on my previous crowdfunded e-book, Files that Last. Terri Wells has agreed in principle to do copy editing, and Matt Leger to provide cover art. 

I've been around filk since 1989. In that time, I've chaired two ConCertino filk conventions and am currently chairing a third, run filk programming for Boskone for about two decades, and been indicted inducted into the Filk Hall of Fame in 2004. I've been an officer of MASSFILC continuously since 1991. A number of filk songbooks have been edited by me, including some for Worldcons.

Filk goes back long before my involvement in it, and I'll be spending lots of time talking with people who can fill in the earlier history, people whose names are legendary in filk.

This is a book which I'd love to see, and the best way I know to see it is to make it happen, with the support of filk and SF fandom.

What We Need & What You Get

You might ask why an e-book needs money. Isn't it just a matter of writing it and putting it up on the Web? Well, not if we want it to be good.

A book needs copy editing. Even the best writers need another pair of eyeballs to keep their blunders from getting into print. This is where Terri comes in, and it's time-consuming work, less fun than actually writing the book. She saved me from a lot of embarrassment in Files that Last.

Even a free book ought to look good, with a professional-looking cover. That's what I've asked Matt to provide. He does really good work.

The book will be available for free. There will probably be a payment-optional outlet for those who want to contribute, and there will be a limited hard-copy run, but essentially all the money I'll make from the book will be the income from this campaign. 

What if the campaign falls short? There will still be something. A shorter book without cover art. 

But let's not think of running short, let's think of stretch goals! If we can hit $3500, I'll bump Terri's role from copy editing to ongoing editorial review, working with me not just on whether I'm writing coherent sentences but on what I'm writing, telling me to do it over if it isn't good enough.

New stretch goals! As long as the campaign reaches its basic goal, I'll donate one signed and numbered print copy to Interfilk. At $2600, I'll donate a copy to the Cushing Library at Texas A&M, which has an active filk collection. At $2700, I'll make it two copies to Interfilk, and at $3000, three copies (plus the copy to Cushing in both cases). More than that would flood the auction market. All signed and numbered books, including perks, will be in "perfect" (paperback) binding with a color cover.

What do you get if you contribute? For $10 or more, you'll get listed in the book as a contributor. Higher contributions will get you a souvenir. And would you like me to put together your own songbook for you? I'll do that. 

    The Impact

    In a way, this book is like Files that Last. It's an effort to make knowledge permanent. A free e-book can be passed on from computer to computer without wearing out or becoming inaccessible. You'll be able to give it to your grandchildren and let them know what crazy stuff you did at filk cons and where it came from. And you'll learn more about filk than you know now. At least I will, by the time I'm done! I've already put together what I think is the biggest list of past filk conventions ever compiled, and of course that will be in the book. (Did you know that the first filk con was called FilkCon? Eminently logical.)

    I delivered Files that Last on time and expect to do the same with this.

      Risks & Challenges

      Any personal project carries some risk. There could be changes in my life that would make me fall behind schedule or even make the book impossible. If I find myself with other work that sucks up all my time and energy, the book will take longer. As long as I'm physically and mentally able to, I will produce the book, and there's no reason to believe I won't. 

      I'm the only person making that promise. I've got full confidence in my team members, but they could also run into issues forcing them to change their plans. If they do, I'll find the best help I can elsewhere.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        The key to making this campaign work is to make sure people know about it and want to support it. Whether you're in a position to contribute or not, you can let your friends know about it and post links to it. Please don't spam or post in inappropriate places, but any filk or fannish discussion channel that allows fundraising to be mentioned should be fine. 

        Let's get the word out and make the book happen!

        Follow hashtag #tst2500 on Twitter.

story:
My Story

Remember when...Elizabeth’s personality changed after she was in the motorcycle accident....when Jessica blacklisted Robin Wilson from joining the Pi Beta Alphas because she was overweight...and when Bruce untied Jessica’s bathing suit top in the pool?

If you were a child/young teen and avid reader in the eighties and nineties, you have the images of the beautiful, blond, blue-eyed, perfect sized-6 Wakefield twins of the Sweet Valley High book series burned into your memory.


I am embarking on a book to serve as a companion to the Sweet Valley High books. Through humor, creative writing, and nostalgia, I will be writing a companion book to the beloved series.


In 2007, I launched the blog The Dairi Burger on a whim. As a pre-teen I devoured the entire Sweet Valley High series. Even as a child, I found them overwrought and campy.  In the blog, I chronicled my thoughts and reactions. as I reread them as an adult.

Sure, they were badly written. But reading them in my adult feminist critical lens, I saw themes and messages in the books that made me think about its impact on my psyche and that of young girls.

Others saw it too. The blog, thanks to promotion from other sites and word of mouth, amassed about 10,000 hits per week. Through the comments and communication with my readers, I built a community of smart, well-read women (and yes, some men) who were all connected by their shared love for the books and the shared laughter of how bad they were.

In 2009, I had completed recapping the original 100 books in the series. I felt like it was a natural time to end, and I had said all I needed to with the blog.

Last year, the long-awaited new Sweet Valley High book, Sweet Valley Confidential, was released. Diablo Cody, screenwriter of the hip, announced she was working on a draft of a Sweet Valley High script. The power of Sweet Valley High, whether we like it or not, still captivates us. Even in the two years since I officially stopped updating the blog, I have still kept in communication with those I have formed relationships with through my shared love of Sweet Valley High. 


I can read all your recaps on the blog. Why are you publishing a book?

I hope to attract many readers who have not read my blog. There is a lot of material on the blog, and reading it in book form may be more enjoyable. Plus, I plan to add additional, new material including:

*New, never before published recaps of the last 30 books in the series
*A Sweet Valley High glossary, covering all the places, people, and ridiculous plotlines and themes
*New essays reflecting on the series.

What I Need & What You Get

Since I plan on self-publishing, aside from actually writing this thing, I'll likely hire an editor and someone to help me format everything. I also plan to do some traveling to promote the book.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Buy a copy when it is released! If you have a blog or are a freelance writer, please consider featuring this project. All publicity is good publicity. 


Follow my updates on Twitter, Facebook and on The Dairi Burger!


[drawing by the lovely and talented Bee Buehring]

But reading them in my adult feminist critical lens, I saw themes and messages in the books that made me think about its impact on my psyche and that of young girls.Others saw it too. The blog, thanks to promotion from other sites and word of mouth, amassed about 10,000 hits per week. Through the comments and communication with my readers, I built a community of smart, well-read women (and yes, some men) who were all connected by their shared love for the books and the shared laughter of how bad they were.In 2009, I had completed recapping the original 100 books in the series. I felt like it was a natural time to end, and I had said all I needed to with the blog. Last year, the long-awaited new Sweet Valley High book, Sweet Valley Confidential, was released. Diablo Cody, screenwriter of the hip, announced she was working on a draft of a Sweet Valley High script. The power of Sweet Valley High, whether we like it or not, still captivates us. Even in the two years since I officially stopped updating the blog, I have still kept in communication with those I have formed relationships with through my shared love of Sweet Valley High. 





I can read all your recaps on the blog. Why are you publishing a book?I hope to attract many readers who have not read my blog. There is a lot of material on the blog, and reading it in book form may be more enjoyable. Plus, I plan to add additional, new material including:*New, never before published recaps of the last 30 books in the series*A Sweet Valley High glossary, covering all the places, people, and ridiculous plotlines and themes*New essays reflecting on the series.



What I Need & What You Get


Since I plan on self-publishing, aside from actually writing this thing, I'll likely hire an editor and someone to help me format everything. I also plan to do some traveling to promote the book.


Other Ways You Can Help
Tell your friends! Buy a copy when it is released! If you have a blog or are a freelance writer, please consider featuring this project. All publicity is good publicity. 

Follow my updates on Twitter, Facebook and on The Dairi Burger!

[drawing by the lovely and talented Bee Buehring]

story:
Setting A Precedent

A teacher, a motivator and an enthusiast for peace. These are just a few of the words attributable to the makings of Starmel Allah. He uses knowledge of self which he has had for over 18years to bring to fruition the altruistic words and teachings that he has inherently garnered through the prophetic words of Allah’s Five Percent Nation.  A catalyst for change, he lives his life for the good of spreading the need for greater responsibility and accountability throughout the lives of himself and others.

In his debut release “The Righteous Way” Starmel hopes to bring to light that The Five Percent Nation is not just an old methodical organization standing in the shadows of history, but that it is a permanent component of historical teachings that still flourishes today with the premise of saving youth from regression, ignorance, violence, self-destruction and powerlessness. He shares his commitment to documenting the meaningful aspects of a teaching that can be traced back to some of the earliest known civilizations of mankind. A commitment that he personally has fought for the right to embrace and practice as a culture not only at the state court level, but at the federal government level of court as well.

With the words penned in “The Righteous Way”, Starmel hopes to materialize a light to the dimmed premise of need for change, the position for accepting only whole truths that are  supported by scientific backing as well as, keeping people informed and connected on what the current state of the community possesses. The goal of his works are simple, to produce knowledge of self, achieve universal consciousness, community empowerment and peace!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The Righteous Way offers readers an inside look into the history and methods of the Nation of Gods and Earths. It also offers:

  • In depth insight into the conditions impacting the Black and Brown communities. 
  • Practical solutions to to the issues facing Original People

In an ever changing world, The Righteious Way keeps the True and Living Gods and Earths as well as the Black and Latino community at large, on point and informed. The need for greater responsibility and accountability in this day and age is addressed in a timely and timeless fashion. The Righteous Way offers practical solutions to common issues instead of the same old non-productive rhetoric.

story:
Soutenez un engagement sportif

Les 18 et 19 mai prochains, nous serons 5 étudiants à participer aux 24H de RACE, la plus grande course étudiante de karting en Europe, pour le compte de la Ligue contre le Cancer. L'idée est de récolter des fonds pour la Ligue, de communiquer autour de ses très nombreuses actions et de sensibiliser les gens au dépistage du cancer. 

Soutenez une association qui oeuvre chaque jour contre le cancer

La Ligue contre le Cancer est aujourd'hui la première ONG de financement de la recherche médicale contre le cancer en France. Outre ce rôle de financement, la Ligue mène chaque jour, au sein de ses 101 comités départementaux, des actions pour venir en aide aux patients atteints du cancer. Nous en connaissons tous autour de nous. En ces temps de repli sur soi et de réduction des subventions publiques, ils ont plus que jamais besoin de nous!

Soutenez une nouvelle manière d'aider les associations caritatives

Avec votre participation et votre engagement moral et financier, nous pouvons montrer que le crowdfunding (financement collectif par individus) est une manière efficace d'aider les associations caritatives. L'idée est que chacun fasse un don, même symbolique, et qu'il transmette le message à ses contacts. Les deux actions nécessitent 5 clics et 3 minutes, faisant ainsi sauter toutes les barrières techniques aux dons. 

 

Les patients, la Ligue, notre équipe, tous comptent sur vous. Peu importe votre don, peu importe vos contacts, seul compte votre engagement!

 

Merci d'avance pour votre générosité!

story:
Do you love a good wedding? If so, you can be involved in the biggest wedding party ever printed to paper!

Hey good lookin' - I've got a story to tell. I'm Tom the traveller, blogger and Global Wedding Crasher. I have a great idea for a travel book. You can help me get some to far away nuptials... hell why don't you come along?

 

The Flirt

Have I told you look beautiful today? Let me share a universal truth with you. No matter where we live on this blue rotating sphere, we share a common goal: to find our special someone. 

Many cultures have unique wedding customs and traditions for instance In Gansu China a Yughar groom will shoot his betrothed with a bow and arrow three times! They're blunt arrow heads, of course, but it’s still going to smart! After this casual maiming the groom will then collect the arrows and with a gusty flourish, snap them across his knee thus symbolically ensuring his undying love. Now that’s the kind of romance I want to see! After a little research I have found so many unique traditions and quirks. i have seen Thai Zombie weddings, fish slapping stag do's in korea, Jedi weddings, lottery group weddings in India and so many more.

 

The First impression

I am dedicated to observing matrimonial union in many cultures. My goal is to celebrate love all over the planet and to journal my adventures in a book, part humorous travelogue part anthropological study.

The book is pitched at travellers and romantics I want to write to book that is bought at the airport and finished when you land, leaving you feeling optomistic about humanity and inspired.  A rough draught of the first few pages are posted on my blogsite www.tombassgastrodude.com so you can get an idea of what the plan is.

The Engagement

I think it is time for me and you to get serious! I have had interest from a few jounalists about my adventures and my viral internet campaign is flying. I already have invites to weddings in Indonesia, Bulgaria, Israel, China and South Korea but I need you help to get further dear reader.

I want to get my campaign truly global, for this I need a network of people and experts so please if you don’t want to contribute financially to my cause please share, tweet or forward this message. If you are reading this on the subway right now nudge the guy next to you and tell him about my Idea. If you are feeling naughty why not climb into your neighbour’s bedroom and whisper ‘Tom’s got a great idea for a book’ from inside his closet. Or you could simply skywrite ‘globalweddingcrasher’ over a sporting venue of your choice.

The Big day

With this pledge I thee wed. If you feel like like making a donation to this joyous project your money will simply go towards travel expenses. I am currently a volunteer teacher at a charity school in Guizhou, China.  I have very low living expenses and time on my hands to apply myself to the Global wedding crasher project. I have some savings to get me though the proposed Asia leg of the trip but will need financial assistance to get to Africa and the Americas.

I seek to do this for NO financial gain, I do it for adventure, I pledge to use any cash generated by my efforts to help regenerate a small orphanage I visited last year in Tamil Nada called Hosanna Children’s home. they need new beds and a school equipment and a consistant stream of revenue, on completion of this project I will help them achieve this.

‘So what do I get out of it’ I hear you ask, well I have a few ideas for fun perks so keep scrolling..... 

 Hosanna Children's Home

 

I met Mr Balasamy and the children who reside in the Hosanna children's home in Poonjeri Village, Tamil Nadu last year. The Children under Mr Balasmay's and care are aged between five and ten and are all rescued street kids from Chennai and Vellore they all have terrifying stories to tell, One of the smaller children was saved from the street after her drunk father poisoned her mother and imprisoned  she taken to the Hosanna Home 3 months ago and is the happiest child I have ever seen. 

I had expected to see a dirty slum and scruffy urchins and ragamuffins, but to my delight we were greeted by 19 beautiful face in bright white pressed clothes and the smaller girls in shiny sarees. Mr Balasamy was thrilled to see me I think a few tourists make promises and never show up.

This Project is small and underfunded , it is a registered charity with no government support, corporate donations or international aid, there are no sponsorship schemes, no websites,  no charity boxes on fish and chip shop counters, nada ,nothing, zip. Its up to a dedicated man and his moped to collect the 36,000 rupees it cost to keep these children warm clothed, fed and educated.

The small school in the village has a teacher his staff consist of a cook a helper and cleaner. the kids keep their belongings in tin chests and sleep on worn out mats, they get three meals a day and live to a rigid regime of school, study, play and prayer these happy kids are in great hands.

When a child reaches ten he/she will be sent to a college to study further and at fifteen the charity stops and the youths are sent into the world with hopefully enough skills to survive.

After a couple of hours at Hosanna Home for Orphans I felt like I really had found a charity I could care for, not a big brand save the children were eighty pence of every pound goes on adverts and admin, but a real struggle that goes on every month.

I was touched by the passion and energy of the project and i vowed to help, the Global Wedding Project is the first step in building a Safe and reliable institution for these Children.

story:
WHY WE WANTED TO DO THIS

Ok, so first of all I wanted to thank you again for taking the time to hear about our story. There has been a massive amount of work that has gone in to it, and WE ARE SO CLOSE! We just need YOUR HELP. We have big dreams for this story. The truth is that we want this book eventually to be released worldwide in many different countries and languages. Right now we just need to get these illustrations complete and to have it self published. 

I am honored to work alongside the world renowned artist J.E. Larson. We have put a lot of time, energy, and money into creating this story and making these characters come to life. 

With your help this book will be FULLY illustrated with extreme attention to detail and lively images that children of all ages will enjoy. 

This book will include 30 full color illustrations done without the use of any computers. The cover, binding, and the back of the book will also be created by J.E. Larson. 

ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE PAGE YOU WILL FIND SOME STUFF WE WANT TO GIVE BACK TO YOU!

This book will become a reality because of YOU. We are so thankful for all your help and support and it's only fair that we give back to you as you are the ones that will make this a dream come true. We want to be very generous with you all and want you to be a part of this books future Because you are it's future! 

PLEASE "LIKE" THE FROG AND HIS FRIENDS ON FACEBOOK IF YOU CAN!

CLICK HERE: https://www.facebook.com/FrogInTheTree?ref=hl

Anything you can give will get us that much closer to getting this into the hands of kids all over the world.

HOW DO I GET A COPY OF THE PRINTED BOOK? 

 

A PLEDGE OF $25 OR MORE GETS YOU  A PHYSICAL COPY OF THE BOOK!

EVERYONE that pledges $25 or more will get a professionally printed PHYSICAL COPY of THE FROG IN THE TREE BOOK.

TO BE DELIVERED AFTER CAMPAIGN FUNDING IS COMPLETE "Times may vary depending on the time of print press production" however, we will get it to as fast as we possibly can!

This is a LIMITED edition Copy. (NOTE: It will not include the full illustrations because we cannot pay the illustrator to draw them until our funding goal is met. However, it includes a full color cover, binding, and back.)  This is a realy great opportunity to get a printed copy before its actual release date. 

WHY DIDN'T YOU USE COMPUTER ILLUSTRATIONS?

That is a good question. Now, we have nothing against computer created art at all, there are tons of books out there that look fantastic in this form, however, we wanted to create a children's book done in the old world style, using the same techniques that our favorite illustrators used dating all the way back to the 15th century. 

It takes a MASSIVE amount of time and hard work to create these illustrations when working with physical tools, and if you screw up an illustration while creating it, there is no erase tool, so, you throw it away and start again. It takes countless hours of tedious work to create each one of these hand drawn illustrations, and we think it pays off in the finished product. 

I grew up on an old farm in upper Michigan, we didnt have computers, cell phones, or video games. I spent my childhood reading the old classical children's stories  that were done in real pen and ink, wood cuts, hand coloring, and meticulously created. 

There is just something special about any piece of art that is created by the hand of the artist, each piece is unique, and one of a kind.

WHAT THE STORY IS ABOUT

Obviously the title will give you some insight as to what the story is about, however, there is a lot more to it then just a frog who lives in a tree. 

I will keep it brief as I do not want to give the story away just yet.  It is written like a poem, a fable you could say. It is a story about a frog who runs away from home as he is teased for being very different than everyone else. He feels lonely, sad, and an outcast and so he shelters himself atop the branches of an old magical oak tree. But something happens to the frog while he is hiding up so high away from the world. 

With the help of a small crow that had fallen from her nest the two embark on a wild, adventurous, and magical journey. 

This story was written to help children understand that it is ok to be yourself. We all look different, feel different, have different ideas, and it's ok to accept the differences of ourselves and of others. 

I wanted to make the book because I haven't seen anything like it out there, but most importantly for it to be used as a tool by parents to enlighten, entertain, and inspire their children. 

To teach kids to be courageous, kind, and to know we are not perfect, but we can achieve whatever we want in this life as long as we follow our hearts.

OVER 100 PRELIMINARY SKETCHES AND DESIGNS JUST TO CREATE THE COVER

WHAT WE PLAN TO DO WITH THIS BOOK.

Our plan for this book is HUGE. We want to start with the release of the book in the United States & Canada, however, we don't want to stop there. Our goal within 1 year is to have it released World Wide. 

We are also going to have it submitted as soon as the Illustrations are complete to the following Competitions:

The Independent Publishers Book Awards

Benjamin Franklin Awards™

Children’s Book Award Contests for Self-published Authors

The Golden Kite Awards

The Moonbeam Children’s Book Awards

The Mom’s Choice Awards® 

The Royal Dragonfly Book Awards

IF WE ARE SUCCESSFUL WE WILL BEGIN WORK ON ILLUSTRATING  THREE OTHER UNRELEASED NOVELS "1200 PAGES WORTH"

Ok, so we are new to Indiegogo and this is our first campaign here, however, if this goes well it will OPEN UP MANY NEW OPPORTUNITIES TO GIVE YOU EVEN MORE ! I have FOUR OTHER NOVELS that are unreleased, and if we do well here today, then we will begin work on the others as soon as we get the Illustrations completed for this one.

WE HAVE EVERYTHING RIDING ON THIS CAMPAIGN AND NEED YOUR UTMOST SUPPORT TO ENABLE US TO KEEP CREATING FOR YOU.

CHOOSING THE ILLUSTRATOR 

This was a VERY TEDIOUS PROCESS!! As I stated in the video I had over 300 Illustrators contact me to be a part of this project. I had to go through each individuals portfolios to narrow it down, I do not know how many countless hours I spent reviewing all the submissions, but lets just say it was a lot! 

Around 70% of the 300 Illustrators who contacted me were digital artists, and for this project I wanted it to have a classical feel to it. Now, some of the digital artists works were mind blowing, some were even very well known and had worked on multi-million dollar projects, however, it just didn't fit this kind of a story.

I was lucky enough to receive a submission from J.E. Larson. I saw something very special and unique in his work. His art was like no one else that submitted and truly stood alone. 

**********UPDATE: ANY PLEDGE OF $20 OR MORE WILL GET YOU EVERYTHING INCLUDED IN THE PERTAINING PACKAGE PLUS AN ENTIRE DIGITAL MUSIC ALBUM FROM MY WEBSITE www.paulwatersmusic.com  ********

ABOUT THE ILLUSTRATOR 

J.E Larson is an internationally known artist with an extensive range of capabilities. He has worked on Published Alice in Wonderland Works, Work for Wired Magazine, and countless other successful authors. He is also one of the NICEST guys I have ever met in my life. We are absolutely honored to have him on board for this project and many others to comes. 

J.E. Larson is host to numerous unrelated titles, some of which include barbering, burying and broomstick-watching – and on occasion, chimney-sweeping, crayoning, and hiding in bell towers – but most notably, illustrating. When not confined to the shadows of an ivy embraced abbey or the attic of a confectionery, he attempts to compose to paper visuals of a nonsensical nature with a disposition of mystery, monstrosity, and the macabre. Other times he pretends he is a pirate. An interest in the visual arts was instigated many years ago when he was visiting a rookery while abroad in Romania. It so happened that during this time one of the birds engaged him in conversation, and he having penned a quick sketch of the Parachute Jump – for a visual representation was politely requested – was told by the fowl that the depiction had been very fine. This gracious bit of praise influenced further experimentation and has continued to the present.

HUNDREDS OF HOURS IN CHARACTER DESIGN 

We went back and forth so many times on these characters to refine them to what they are now because we were striving to capture the image and colors of them to a "t" and this consisted of hundreds of emails, phone calls, meetings, etc. Changing the look of the frog, the bird, the trees, the forest, the colors, different mediums, styles.... needless to say it was a lot of work! 

THE FROG IN THE TREE SEQUEL !

We don't just want to stop here with this book, our goal is to create numerous stories with the Frog and his little Crow friend. All of these will focus on different aspects of what we need the little ones of the world to learn at an early age. We would LOVE to make this into a series, and with your help today we will be able to begin another book soon for you.

 

 

SOME OF THE GIFTS YOU CAN RECEIVE FOR YOUR PLEDGE!!!

 

$25 GETS YOU THE PHYSICAL COPY OF THE BOOK 

 

Frog in the tree Coffee Mug

"Goes Great with Frog Juice!"

Custom White Shirt 

Choose Kids or Adult "Any Size" 

Womens Cap Sleeve Shirt

"ALL SIZES AVAILABLE "ALSO COMES IN RED & WHITE"

CUSTOM WOMENS TANK TOP

"Available in many different sizes"

Your very own "Feeling Froggy"

Underwear Boxer Shorts!

I mean who wouldn't want these! 

"Available in all sizes"

A Frog in the Tree Custom hat in all sizes. 

"Save a Frog eat a Chicken" Cooking Apron NEVER BEFORE SEEN!

Custom Made Infant Body Suit

"Available in Green, White, Blue, or Pink"

 

*** SUBSTITUTE ANY FROG IN THE TREE HAND SIGNED PRINT FOR ONE OF J.E. LARSONS OTHER PRINTS BELOW "Included with pertaining packages"***

 

PLEASE "LIKE" THE FROG AND HIS FRIENDS ON FACEBOOK IF YOU CAN!

https://www.facebook.com/FrogInTheTree?ref=hl
 
 

AGAIN THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 

Risks and challenges

 

I know the genre, the audience and am confident that we "along with your help" will make this a success.

I have been writing for a decade and have faced many challenges along the way, however, there is always a solution to any issue that may arise.

With any project or idea there are always challenges, believe me we have had many along the way, however, we have found that there is ALWAYS a way to fix something. 

When dealing with any printing house there is always the risk of it taking a bit more time to get the full amount of copies produced. We have thought of as much as we can prior to creating this project so we can be prepared for whatever the world throws at it.

I am honored to work alongside the world renowned artist J.E. Larson. We have put a lot of time, energy, and money into creating this story and making these characters come to life. 
With your help this book will be FULLY illustrated with extreme attention to detail and lively images that children of all ages will enjoy. 
This book will include 30 full color illustrations done without the use of any computers. The cover, binding, and the back of the book will also be created by J.E. Larson. 

ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE PAGE YOU WILL FIND SOME STUFF WE WANT TO GIVE BACK TO YOU!
This book will become a reality because of YOU. We are so thankful for all your help and support and it's only fair that we give back to you as you are the ones that will make this a dream come true. We want to be very generous with you all and want you to be a part of this books future Because you are it's future! 
PLEASE "LIKE" THE FROG AND HIS FRIENDS ON FACEBOOK IF YOU CAN!
CLICK HERE: https://www.facebook.com/FrogInTheTree?ref=hl

Anything you can give will get us that much closer to getting this into the hands of kids all over the world.
HOW DO I GET A COPY OF THE PRINTED BOOK? 
 
A PLEDGE OF $25 OR MORE GETS YOU  A PHYSICAL COPY OF THE BOOK!
EVERYONE that pledges $25 or more will get a professionally printed PHYSICAL COPY of THE FROG IN THE TREE BOOK.
TO BE DELIVERED AFTER CAMPAIGN FUNDING IS COMPLETE "Times may vary depending on the time of print press production" however, we will get it to as fast as we possibly can!
This is a LIMITED edition Copy. (NOTE: It will not include the full illustrations because we cannot pay the illustrator to draw them until our funding goal is met. However, it includes a full color cover, binding, and back.)  This is a realy great opportunity to get a printed copy before its actual release date. 
WHY DIDN'T YOU USE COMPUTER ILLUSTRATIONS?
That is a good question. Now, we have nothing against computer created art at all, there are tons of books out there that look fantastic in this form, however, we wanted to create a children's book done in the old world style, using the same techniques that our favorite illustrators used dating all the way back to the 15th century. 
It takes a MASSIVE amount of time and hard work to create these illustrations when working with physical tools, and if you screw up an illustration while creating it, there is no erase tool, so, you throw it away and start again. It takes countless hours of tedious work to create each one of these hand drawn illustrations, and we think it pays off in the finished product. 
I grew up on an old farm in upper Michigan, we didnt have computers, cell phones, or video games. I spent my childhood reading the old classical children's stories  that were done in real pen and ink, wood cuts, hand coloring, and meticulously created. 

There is just something special about any piece of art that is created by the hand of the artist, each piece is unique, and one of a kind.




WHAT THE STORY IS ABOUT
Obviously the title will give you some insight as to what the story is about, however, there is a lot more to it then just a frog who lives in a tree. 
I will keep it brief as I do not want to give the story away just yet.  It is written like a poem, a fable you could say. It is a story about a frog who runs away from home as he is teased for being very different than everyone else. He feels lonely, sad, and an outcast and so he shelters himself atop the branches of an old magical oak tree. But something happens to the frog while he is hiding up so high away from the world. 
With the help of a small crow that had fallen from her nest the two embark on a wild, adventurous, and magical journey. 
This story was written to help children understand that it is ok to be yourself. We all look different, feel different, have different ideas, and it's ok to accept the differences of ourselves and of others. 
I wanted to make the book because I haven't seen anything like it out there, but most importantly for it to be used as a tool by parents to enlighten, entertain, and inspire their children. 
To teach kids to be courageous, kind, and to know we are not perfect, but we can achieve whatever we want in this life as long as we follow our hearts.
OVER 100 PRELIMINARY SKETCHES AND DESIGNS JUST TO CREATE THE COVER

WHAT WE PLAN TO DO WITH THIS BOOK.
Our plan for this book is HUGE. We want to start with the release of the book in the United States & Canada, however, we don't want to stop there. Our goal within 1 year is to have it released World Wide. 
We are also going to have it submitted as soon as the Illustrations are complete to the following Competitions:
The Independent Publishers Book Awards
Benjamin Franklin Awards™
Children’s Book Award Contests for Self-published Authors
The Golden Kite Awards
The Moonbeam Children’s Book Awards
The Mom’s Choice Awards® 
The Royal Dragonfly Book Awards
IF WE ARE SUCCESSFUL WE WILL BEGIN WORK ON ILLUSTRATING  THREE OTHER UNRELEASED NOVELS "1200 PAGES WORTH"
Ok, so we are new to Indiegogo and this is our first campaign here, however, if this goes well it will OPEN UP MANY NEW OPPORTUNITIES TO GIVE YOU EVEN MORE ! I have FOUR OTHER NOVELS that are unreleased, and if we do well here today, then we will begin work on the others as soon as we get the Illustrations completed for this one.
WE HAVE EVERYTHING RIDING ON THIS CAMPAIGN AND NEED YOUR UTMOST SUPPORT TO ENABLE US TO KEEP CREATING FOR YOU.
CHOOSING THE ILLUSTRATOR 
This was a VERY TEDIOUS PROCESS!! As I stated in the video I had over 300 Illustrators contact me to be a part of this project. I had to go through each individuals portfolios to narrow it down, I do not know how many countless hours I spent reviewing all the submissions, but lets just say it was a lot! 
Around 70% of the 300 Illustrators who contacted me were digital artists, and for this project I wanted it to have a classical feel to it. Now, some of the digital artists works were mind blowing, some were even very well known and had worked on multi-million dollar projects, however, it just didn't fit this kind of a story.
I was lucky enough to receive a submission from J.E. Larson. I saw something very special and unique in his work. His art was like no one else that submitted and truly stood alone. 
**********UPDATE: ANY PLEDGE OF $20 OR MORE WILL GET YOU EVERYTHING INCLUDED IN THE PERTAINING PACKAGE PLUS AN ENTIRE DIGITAL MUSIC ALBUM FROM MY WEBSITE www.paulwatersmusic.com  ********
ABOUT THE ILLUSTRATOR 

J.E Larson is an internationally known artist with an extensive range of capabilities. He has worked on Published Alice in Wonderland Works, Work for Wired Magazine, and countless other successful authors. He is also one of the NICEST guys I have ever met in my life. We are absolutely honored to have him on board for this project and many others to comes. 
J.E. Larson is host to numerous unrelated titles, some of which include barbering, burying and broomstick-watching – and on occasion, chimney-sweeping, crayoning, and hiding in bell towers – but most notably, illustrating. When not confined to the shadows of an ivy embraced abbey or the attic of a confectionery, he attempts to compose to paper visuals of a nonsensical nature with a disposition of mystery, monstrosity, and the macabre. Other times he pretends he is a pirate. An interest in the visual arts was instigated many years ago when he was visiting a rookery while abroad in Romania. It so happened that during this time one of the birds engaged him in conversation, and he having penned a quick sketch of the Parachute Jump – for a visual representation was politely requested – was told by the fowl that the depiction had been very fine. This gracious bit of praise influenced further experimentation and has continued to the present.
HUNDREDS OF HOURS IN CHARACTER DESIGN 

We went back and forth so many times on these characters to refine them to what they are now because we were striving to capture the image and colors of them to a "t" and this consisted of hundreds of emails, phone calls, meetings, etc. Changing the look of the frog, the bird, the trees, the forest, the colors, different mediums, styles.... needless to say it was a lot of work! 
THE FROG IN THE TREE SEQUEL !
We don't just want to stop here with this book, our goal is to create numerous stories with the Frog and his little Crow friend. All of these will focus on different aspects of what we need the little ones of the world to learn at an early age. We would LOVE to make this into a series, and with your help today we will be able to begin another book soon for you.
 
 
SOME OF THE GIFTS YOU CAN RECEIVE FOR YOUR PLEDGE!!!
 
$25 GETS YOU THE PHYSICAL COPY OF THE BOOK 
 
Frog in the tree Coffee Mug
"Goes Great with Frog Juice!"


Custom White Shirt 
Choose Kids or Adult "Any Size" 

Womens Cap Sleeve Shirt
"ALL SIZES AVAILABLE "ALSO COMES IN RED & WHITE"

CUSTOM WOMENS TANK TOP
"Available in many different sizes"

Your very own "Feeling Froggy"
Underwear Boxer Shorts!
I mean who wouldn't want these! 
"Available in all sizes"

A Frog in the Tree Custom hat in all sizes. 

"Save a Frog eat a Chicken" Cooking Apron NEVER BEFORE SEEN!

Custom Made Infant Body Suit
"Available in Green, White, Blue, or Pink"

 
*** SUBSTITUTE ANY FROG IN THE TREE HAND SIGNED PRINT FOR ONE OF J.E. LARSONS OTHER PRINTS BELOW "Included with pertaining packages"***
 












PLEASE "LIKE" THE FROG AND HIS FRIENDS ON FACEBOOK IF YOU CAN!
https://www.facebook.com/FrogInTheTree?ref=hl
 
 
AGAIN THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 



Risks and challenges

 
I know the genre, the audience and am confident that we "along with your help" will make this a success.
I have been writing for a decade and have faced many challenges along the way, however, there is always a solution to any issue that may arise.
With any project or idea there are always challenges, believe me we have had many along the way, however, we have found that there is ALWAYS a way to fix something. 
When dealing with any printing house there is always the risk of it taking a bit more time to get the full amount of copies produced. We have thought of as much as we can prior to creating this project so we can be prepared for whatever the world throws at it.

story:
WHO:

My name is Tabatha and among many things I am an ambitious and dedicated writer. I am the proud life supporter of two amazing young boys.  Life as a single mother is rife with sacrifice, struggles and difficult decisions.  Many can spend their entire life searching for their purpose while a busy parent rarely has time for free-forming independent thoughts.  Thankfully, I’ve always known what my life’s purpose has been.  Writing, for me, is the ultimate way to connect with the world and the people that inhabit its space.  I have been accepted into City University London’s MA in writing programme for Fall 2013.  I am looking to raise funds to help with the pre-arrival costs of attending this competitive writing programme.

WHY:

When I first moved to London, I was introduced to the struggles and triumphs of one of the strongest and influential female authors, Doris Lessing.  Like Lessing, I too fled to London, foregoing tradition and family to chase down my future.  The first time I stepped out of the black cab’s door into the distinctly aged smell of London I knew that I had found home.  While relating to a troubled childhood, Lessing described the need for creative and physical freedom, "Yes, I think that is true. Though it wasn't apparent to me then. Of course, I wasn't thinking in terms of being a writer then - I was just thinking about how to escape, all the time."  London brought me the promise of a new start to life and as a writer.  In reference to her decision to leave behind two young children, Lessing described motherhood in these terms, “There is a whole generation of women," she has said, speaking of her mother's era, "and it was as if their lives came to a stop when they had children. Most of them got pretty neurotic - because, I think, of the contrast between what they were taught at school they were capable of being and what actually happened to them."  Sixty years since she made her great ‘escape’ I am attempting to follow in her iconic footsteps.  At each intersection and every hurdle, I remind myself of Doris Lessing’s journey and lifelong achievements.  “Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible.” – Doris Lessing

WHAT:

My acceptance into City University London’s MA in Writing has been one of my greatest and proudest accomplishments.  Like all worthwhile goals there are some obstacles along the way.  Getting to this point has been a long and at times challenging process.  The vision of boarding the Boeing 747 at Logan International Airport with my youngest son plays in a Technicolor and surround sound loop in my mind; I am still faced with one last obstacle before the visions become a tangible reality.  The initial cost of obtaining Student Visas and the cost of the flight stands in the way of my life purpose.

The estimated cost for my youngest son and I to travel to London this Fall is $2500.  The required Visa’s to enter the UK, combined is $984.  The cost to renew our US Passports is $361.  Flights to the UK range from $400 - $700 per person round trip, bringing a total flight cost to approximately $800 - $1400.  Putting the total cost of getting to London between $2145 and $2745.

WHEN:

My plans will go forward regardless of my funding success.  If I cannot raise the funds by the given time than I will defer the start date with City University London for one year. The money I raise will go directly to the expenses associated with arriving and moving to London for this MA in Writing programme.

While applying for the MA programmes, I have encountered and observed the unmet need for traditional support and funding opportunities for single parents interested in pursuing careers in the Arts.  The challenges and hardships I have experienced have strengthened my commitment to helping other single parents follow their passions and talents.  After I finish my Master’s degree I want to find ways to support other single parents with resources and funding to pursue an education or career in the Arts.

If you cannot help by donating but feel that my cause is a worthy and noble venture please share this with people you know! All of your generosity and support is much appreciated!  Thank you for supporting my ambitions and life’s purpose!

Here is the link to the short story I wrote for my Master’s application! 

http://inserttab.wordpress.com

 

(Photo by: Robert Appleton, Clockwork Raven Studios.)

story:
Join Me In Creating 

I was pleasantly surprised with the success of my first novel, The Tower of Babel. Now, on November 1, 2013, I'll be publishing the prequel to that book. This time, I want to reach a larger audience: this Indiegogo project will fund, among other things, a web ad campaign that will put the book in front of 400,000 readers. 

A Chair Between The Rails may challenge readers. Suicide is a resonant theme in the novel, and that may prove uncomfortable. However, the book doesn't compromise its message. Through its startling narrative, it claims that self-sacrifice is always the best choice. For that, it is a book that needs to be read.

What You're Supporting

Through lots of research, I've settled on a three-pronged marketing campaign. 

  1. Dedicated posts from indie.kindlenationdaily.com. I had success with this kind of promo with The Tower of Babel. (cost: $308.99) 
  2. Sponsored reviews from The San Francisco Book Review and The Portland Book Review, and entrance into the Indie Reader Discovery Awards. (cost: $344.00) 
  3. Web ads on the sites of three major magazines which are read by a portion of the book's target audience: Image Journal, Relevant Magazine, and World Magazine. This will expose the book to 400,000 potential readers. (cost: $1,984.00)  

Marketing is not the only cost associated with publishing a novel. Producing the books requires another chunk of change. The cost of book production (and distribution to an estimated number of backers) comes to $765.00. 

All of this adds up to $3,401.99. Given Indiegogo's fees (4% for a successful campaign) and payment processing fees (approximately 3%), I've arrived at a total of $3,700.00 for the campaign. 

What You'll Receive 

You'll receive the book, of course. It's a good one--but don't take my word for it; see the reviews of my previous work, The Tower of Babel. You know, novels are like wine: the longer they mature before you pop the cork, the better they taste; and at six years in, this one is ready to be opened. Consider it some of the most curious vintage you'll try this year. 

Several gift levels also include a digital download of an album I recorded, called Come, My Tired Machine. I'll be releasing this work under the artist name The Victorious Airborne. (You can stream some of the album at that link.) The music is a bit different, heading in a noise direction sometimes, generally relying on mournful electric guitars the rest of the time. I won't risk comparing it to any artist you have or haven't heard of. Just listen to the tracks at that link and decide if you like it. However, if you do want it, be advised - this Indiegogo campaign is the only way to obtain the whole album. It is being released privately only to backers who select a donation level including it. 

Why Support This Project?

I have a track record of producing unique, exciting fiction. You are guaranteed to get something excellent in supporting this project. 

Reviewer Anna R. said of The Tower of Babel: "The ending is beautiful in its technique and the final divine love that comes through. Amazing. This book needs to be picked up by a Publisher. Now." (Amazon review) 

Reviewer Michael said of The Tower of Babel: "This book is probably not much like anything else out there. Very fresh. Like going to the garden and picking some kale and putting it in the fridge with water for an hour then eating it. Fresh!" (Amazon review) 

Reviewer Gaele said of The Tower of Babel: "Anders has a way and passion with words..." (Amazon review)
