story:
Story of My Book

PLEASE NOTE THAT THE BOOK HAS A NEW TITLE.


The Ironic Link: How Comedy Overcomes Depression explores the intersection between humor and depression by following the psyche of the comedian. The purpose of this book is to make a compelling argument for comedians as the ultimate tightrope walkers and what we can learn from them. They flourish on the fine line between joy and despair, chaos and order, sanity and madness. A fine line people struggling with mental illnesses find themselves on again and again. This book offers engaging, touching, and eye-opening stories told by famous stand-up comics, renowned psychologists, and myself in an effort to show the critical healing qualities that laughter has on our mental health.


My name is Felix Dey and I am the author of The Ironic Link. I wrote this book because it is my mission to combat the stigma those with mental health issues are often saddled with. I never suffered from that type of malady, which made it difficult for me to fully relate to, and empathize with someone who does. However, I have always loved bringing out the best in people and making them laugh which is how I found a passion for performing stand-up routines. To my surprise, I discovered that comedy offers a unique way to help us fight our inner demons as well as connect with others who are battling psychiatric disorders.


In reading this book, I hope it will bring you closer to understanding mental health and help you realize how professionals filter pain through humor to make it hurt less and less, day after day. I have found stand-up to be a wonderful way to connect, bring people together, and turn around their burdens with entertainment. Using humor, we can confront any tough topic. When we can see tragedy through the lens of the ridiculous, it takes away all of its power.


Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you cope with whatever misery you or a loved one has been put through. We can use fun as a vehicle to make the world less painful. By deconstructing how a comedian’s mind works, you will recognize when you or someone you love is suffering from a mental health condition. This book can help you understand how to laugh through tragedy rather than dying through it. While I can’t guarantee that it will release all your pain, I promise you that it will be a stepping stone along the path to establishing compassion, insight, and an exciting understanding of the world around mental health. Maybe not overnight, but over time.


In this book, you will learn about the science of depression, and its causes, the power of unmasking yourself and facing the fear of the unknown. Furthermore, you will be encouraged to dig deep into the source of creativity, develop your comedic persona, and learn how hilarity plays a vital role in any facet of our lives.


The Ironic Link taps into topics such as...

  • The evolution of controversial and taboo-breaking “blue” comedy throughout history.
  • How comedians are our societal conscious that is pointing out the flaws.
  • The fascinating mind of the comedian as a tortured soul who finds creativity in the darkest places.
  • What health benefits positive energy provides to both your physical and emotional wellbeing.
  • How being a good comedian can make you a better person.

 

You will love this book if you enjoy stand-up comedy and want to learn how to bring more absurdity into every aspect of your life - positive and negative. You will also love this book if you ever wondered what the true nature of depression is and how we can fight its stigma.

 

The Book - The Ironic Link

 

The book is written in 3 parts.


Part 1, The Case for Comedy, contains the introduction + chapters 1-4.
It will take you back to where stand-up comedy has its roots, showcasing how iconic comedians such as Lenny Bruce and Richard Pryor risked their careers as they fought for the freedom of expression. On top of that, to understand how to overcome depression, we have to understand the different reasons you or someone close to you might be miserable. This chapter will show you that there’s more behind it than just a chemical imbalance in our brains. Lastly, I will take you on my personal journey when I experienced mental challenges throughout childhood with an emotionally abusive father and challenging times during college.


Part 2, The Weirdo in the Room, contains chapters 5-8.
This part takes you into the minds of big-name comedians such as Robin Williams, Patton Oswalt, and Sarah Silverman, and different challenges they used comedy to overcome. Comedy can be a lifesaver for many, but it is not a substitute for professional help, according to comedian Chris Gethard. In a brutally honest yet entertaining manner, he tells stories about suicidal thoughts and depressive phases he’s been through, which unveils the dark side of the world of comedy.


Part 3, Comedy is Funny ... and so Much More, contains chapters 9-11.
Learning how to be amusing can be like investigating how to be a good human. Particularly current generations move the standard towards a more compassionate and better-educated society around mental health by being open and vulnerable - characteristics of any high-quality stand-up comic. On top of that, along the way of performing professionally, I became a better entrepreneur. In both worlds, it is about failure, perseverance, and resilience.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this upcoming Spring.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

And much more!

 

About the Author

 

Felix Dey is a stand-up comic, writer, and host of the podcast series "The Deyly Show." Twice a month, he engages in insightful conversations with his guests about transition, finding purpose, and making the most of our lives. He is a naturally curious soul who has no room for close-mindedness and judgment.

 

His enthusiasm for psychology and an early urge to find out what makes people do certain things translated into the entertainer he is today. By creating stand-up routines, he devotes his time and energy to helping people have a good laugh, resolve emotional issues, and increase their well-being.

 

When he’s not getting excited about writing and creating punchlines, you can find Felix hiking California’s fourteeners, competing with friends on the tennis court, and impatiently waiting for the new season of Succession.

 

For more information, you can connect with Felix at felix@felixdey.com, on Instagram @flxdey, and follow his podcast series on http://www.thedeylyshow.com/.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheIronicLink and #TIL and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Stay safe, stay funny!

Thanks again,

Felix Dey
story_txt:
Story of My BookPLEASE NOTE THAT THE BOOK HAS A NEW TITLE.The Ironic Link: How Comedy Overcomes Depression explores the intersection between humor and depression by following the psyche of the comedian. The purpose of this book is to make a compelling argument for comedians as the ultimate tightrope walkers and what we can learn from them. They flourish on the fine line between joy and despair, chaos and order, sanity and madness. A fine line people struggling with mental illnesses find themselves on again and again. This book offers engaging, touching, and eye-opening stories told by famous stand-up comics, renowned psychologists, and myself in an effort to show the critical healing qualities that laughter has on our mental health.My name is Felix Dey and I am the author of The Ironic Link. I wrote this book because it is my mission to combat the stigma those with mental health issues are often saddled with. I never suffered from that type of malady, which made it difficult for me to fully relate to, and empathize with someone who does. However, I have always loved bringing out the best in people and making them laugh which is how I found a passion for performing stand-up routines. To my surprise, I discovered that comedy offers a unique way to help us fight our inner demons as well as connect with others who are battling psychiatric disorders.In reading this book, I hope it will bring you closer to understanding mental health and help you realize how professionals filter pain through humor to make it hurt less and less, day after day. I have found stand-up to be a wonderful way to connect, bring people together, and turn around their burdens with entertainment. Using humor, we can confront any tough topic. When we can see tragedy through the lens of the ridiculous, it takes away all of its power.Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you cope with whatever misery you or a loved one has been put through. We can use fun as a vehicle to make the world less painful. By deconstructing how a comedian’s mind works, you will recognize when you or someone you love is suffering from a mental health condition. This book can help you understand how to laugh through tragedy rather than dying through it. While I can’t guarantee that it will release all your pain, I promise you that it will be a stepping stone along the path to establishing compassion, insight, and an exciting understanding of the world around mental health. Maybe not overnight, but over time.In this book, you will learn about the science of depression, and its causes, the power of unmasking yourself and facing the fear of the unknown. Furthermore, you will be encouraged to dig deep into the source of creativity, develop your comedic persona, and learn how hilarity plays a vital role in any facet of our lives.The Ironic Link taps into topics such as...
The evolution of controversial and taboo-breaking “blue” comedy throughout history.
How comedians are our societal conscious that is pointing out the flaws.
The fascinating mind of the comedian as a tortured soul who finds creativity in the darkest places.
What health benefits positive energy provides to both your physical and emotional wellbeing.
How being a good comedian can make you a better person.
 You will love this book if you enjoy stand-up comedy and want to learn how to bring more absurdity into every aspect of your life - positive and negative. You will also love this book if you ever wondered what the true nature of depression is and how we can fight its stigma. The Book - The Ironic Link The book is written in 3 parts.Part 1, The Case for Comedy, contains the introduction + chapters 1-4.It will take you back to where stand-up comedy has its roots, showcasing how iconic comedians such as Lenny Bruce and Richard Pryor risked their careers as they fought for the freedom of expression. On top of that, to understand how to overcome depression, we have to understand the different reasons you or someone close to you might be miserable. This chapter will show you that there’s more behind it than just a chemical imbalance in our brains. Lastly, I will take you on my personal journey when I experienced mental challenges throughout childhood with an emotionally abusive father and challenging times during college.Part 2, The Weirdo in the Room, contains chapters 5-8.This part takes you into the minds of big-name comedians such as Robin Williams, Patton Oswalt, and Sarah Silverman, and different challenges they used comedy to overcome. Comedy can be a lifesaver for many, but it is not a substitute for professional help, according to comedian Chris Gethard. In a brutally honest yet entertaining manner, he tells stories about suicidal thoughts and depressive phases he’s been through, which unveils the dark side of the world of comedy.Part 3, Comedy is Funny ... and so Much More, contains chapters 9-11.Learning how to be amusing can be like investigating how to be a good human. Particularly current generations move the standard towards a more compassionate and better-educated society around mental health by being open and vulnerable - characteristics of any high-quality stand-up comic. On top of that, along the way of performing professionally, I became a better entrepreneur. In both worlds, it is about failure, perseverance, and resilience. What I Need & What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this upcoming Spring.
 When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
 And much more! About the Author Felix Dey is a stand-up comic, writer, and host of the podcast series "The Deyly Show." Twice a month, he engages in insightful conversations with his guests about transition, finding purpose, and making the most of our lives. He is a naturally curious soul who has no room for close-mindedness and judgment. His enthusiasm for psychology and an early urge to find out what makes people do certain things translated into the entertainer he is today. By creating stand-up routines, he devotes his time and energy to helping people have a good laugh, resolve emotional issues, and increase their well-being. When he’s not getting excited about writing and creating punchlines, you can find Felix hiking California’s fourteeners, competing with friends on the tennis court, and impatiently waiting for the new season of Succession. For more information, you can connect with Felix at felix@felixdey.com, on Instagram @flxdey, and follow his podcast series on http://www.thedeylyshow.com/. Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheIronicLink and #TIL and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

story:
This project was created to:

Give YOU the opportunity to PRE-ORDER a copy of Voodoo Moon (Paranorm World #1) by June Stevens (My penname).  You can order ebook (you have a choice of formats), PRINT book, OR BOTH!  Print books will be SIGNED.

There are also a couple of other packs you can order to get peices from the upcoming Paranorm World Jewelry Collection (handmade by me) and/or Paranorm World Black Blade Guard T-shirts (also designed by me).

 

VOODOO MOON BY JUNE STEVENS 

After a worldwide cataclysm and wars broke down society and changed the landscape of the world, a new society had to take shape.  The magic users and paranormal beings that spent centuries in hiding and were relegated to myth and legend had to come out of hiding to save the world that shunned them.  Now witches, vampires, shifters and normal humans live side by side in a society that was built by merging technology and magic.

In the ruins of old cities new ones formed.  New governments rule.  Within the walls of the autonomous city-states that have risen up  with a City Guard on every corner and the Black Blade Guard, an elite Paranorm law force that dates back centuries before the Cataclysm and hunts down the worst Paranorm criminals, life is relatively safe. Or it should be.

Beyond the walls in the outer-zones is where the real outlaws live.  Right?

Zombies aren’t supposed to exist, yet they are turning up all over Nash City.

As a member of the Elite Black Blade Guard, Fiona Moon is tasked with hunting down the most dangerous Paranorm criminals. Now she must find out who is kidnapping mages and sucking the life energy from their bodies. To make matters worse, she has to work with the one man that embodies everything she despises.

Ian Barroes is the rich founder and head of the Necromancers Guild and a professor of Necromantic Studies at the Academy of Science and Magic. There is one thing he wants more than anything else in the world... Fiona.

They each hold secrets that could destroy them but could also be the key to destroying the evil Voodoo priest, Bokur. They must learn to trust each other track down Bokur before more innocents are taken, and murdered. To make matters worse, when Fiona becomes a target of the evil madman she is lured into his trap. Now she and Ian have to fight for survival and their very souls.

 

CLICK HERE TO READ THE FULL FIRST CHAPTER

 

 CLICK HERE TO CHECK OUT THE VOODOO MOON PAGE ON GOODREADS

NOW ME:

I'm a writer.  Well, yeah, you knew that already.  Okay, backing up.  My name is Danette Westerfield, I go by DJ Westerfield professionally.  I've been writing and working in the publishing industry for 8 years.  I've written gobs of short stories and novella's under various pennames (I won't go into all of those right now.)

I write non-fiction as DJ Westerfield and have two published print books, one is for adult writers and one is for young writers.  I currently write contemporary romances as Delinda Jasper and Paranormal Romance & Urban Fantasy as June Stevens.

My full time job right now is SELF-PUBLISHING CONSULTANT.  I am self-employed and I help other people self-publish their books.  I've worked with dozens of authors to help them publish their own work cheaply and efficiently.  (Not including the years I spent at little online publishing houses editing and doing cover art, or the time I spent as the owner of one such small publishing house). 

 

PLEASE CHECK OUT MY WEBSITES

JUNE STEVENS WEBSITE

PARANORM WORLD WEBSITE (I suggest this because I think it will get you interested in the book!  I am still building and adding to it...but it will give you an idea of what the books will be like.)

CURVYWRITER BLOG (My personal/book review blog)

42 West Creative (My Business Website)

Classy Scribe Publications (The company I self-publish through, along with a couple of friends.)

 

 

CAN'T PRE-ORDER A BOOK?  NO WORRIES! THERE ARE OTHER WAYS TO HELP!

I know everyone can't contribute, I don't get to contribute to projects as much as I would like.  BUT YOU CAN STILL HELP ME OUT!  The easiest and simplest way is to hit the share button.  To do a little more you can join my "Street Team" and help me promote this project and the book on social networking sites and via email to all of your friends and contacts.  To join my street team, THE BLACK BLADE GUARD check out my website.

story:
Our Story

The Summer of Love, Hippies, Dancing in the Streets, Peace, Love and Rock-n-Roll...The stories of the sixties in the USA are familiar to many people but there is something missingâ€”children's stories. What was Janis Joplin like as a six year old? Where was Jerry Garcia when he picked up his first instrument and was it a guitar? Was Jimi Hendrix a quiet kid?  What is the name of that anonymous child with the peace sign painted on her cheek in that famous photo? Flower Children will tell these stories and more as a series of contemporary picture book biographies (an award winning format in the children's literature world). 


The Impact

Our world is in the midst of changes that are far reaching. Telling the stories of children who became artists whose music and art impacted social movements helps everyone have a deeper understanding of children and creativity. Now more than ever we need to be aware of the next generation. Icons were once kids. Stories shape culture. Flower Children will offer a new generation hope at a time when hope may be all we have left. Flower Children will also help stop bullying of the creative "weird" kids.


What We Need & What You Get

Funding for Flower Children will be used for research in order to craft a solid proposal that is ready for submission to an editor who is seeking manuscripts. Funds are needed for ink, paper, library time and miscellaneous fees. Field work is also critical to non-fiction research so some funds will be used to visit relevant locations. In the end, the hope is that the Flower Children series will be published by an established publisher with an excellent track record in the area of non-fiction for young readers.


Other Ways You Can Help

Do you have primary source materials related to icons of the 60s? Were you 'there'? What do your favorite libraries and museums have to offer on the times? Flower Children is open to your input and research support!

campaign_city: San Francisco Bay Area, United States

story:
My name is Tyler Gould. I live in the small town of Truro, Nova Scotia, and am currently a student at the Cobequid Educational Centre High School here in Truro. When I'm not playing video games and drinking too much Pepsi, you can either find me writing or drawing.

Writing and drawing have always been two of my greatest passions. I've been drawing and writing for as long as I can remember, so it only made sense for me to make my own comic, right? Well, that's what I thought, too. I began the comic, and soon found out that it was a lot more difficult than I thought it would be. I was kind of going off of nothing, making it up as I went. So I decided to write myself a kind of "script" for me to follow. The script quickly turned into a full, original novel. 

After working on the novel for months, I eventually thought that maybe it had just enough potential to be published. So that's what this campaign is all about. I've decided to take the route of self-publishing, and that's where I need help. The money that I get working part-time just won't cut it. 

Getting this book published would be a great, inspiring accomplishment for myself. I'm not looking for fame and fortune. I've just always wanted to make something that people can really enjoy. And that is what brought me to writing Colder Weather. After reading countless horror and survival novels, I knew I could write something that was emotional, suspenseful, and action-packed.

 

         

Colder Weather is set in a post-apocalyptic United States. The world has been devastated by an unknown fungal infection that causes those infected to become insane, demented monsters set on the destruction of humanity. Driven by the endless hunger caused by the virus, the infected seek out those who are uninfected - their only goal the warm, fresh flesh on their bones. 

A year after the civilized world was devoured by infection, survivors arose from the ashes of a destroyed cultivation in an attempt to live their lives amongst the infected. But after so much loss, and so much pain, their lives would never be the same. 

Follow the story of Eben Wilson. He is a brutal, ruthless survivor drifting from place to place. His home is gone, his family is, too, and now he's alone. Forced to take on the horrors of the new world all on his own.


To pay for all of the services that go into self-publishing, I'm going to need around 3000-4000 dollars. All the money donated goes straight into the publishing process, and any leftover money will go into making the book as great as it can be. Some of the services that I'd need to pay for are: professional editing, professional cover art and book design, advertising, marketing, website and eBook formatting - with the largest chunk of the money going towards the editing.

If the goal amount is not reached, then that's fine, too. The money raised will still go entirely towards the book, and I'll do my best with what I have. 

Depending on how much you donate, you may be eligible for one of the listed perks. Depending on what you've donated, you may earn a free copy of the book, artwork, and other great extras that can't be found in the book itself. I encourage contributors to only donate what you can - and even then, you don't have to at all.  


                        

Releasing this book would be a huge success for me, and give me something to strive after and replicate again. I've already got sequels and prequels in mind, along with completely new stories. If this is successful, and readers actually enjoy it, then there will be more. 

Not only would this be impacting me, but my girlfriend, as well. For if it wasn't for her, this book would have never reached completion, but it definitely wouldn't have been worth reading. So I cannot give enough thanks. 

This is my first ever book that I've ever tried to publish, and it would be great if I could do that. I believe that the book is worth the time and effort that I've put into it, and readers will really enjoy it.


Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help. There's plenty of other things besides donating that you could do to help. For one, you could share this around, and an interested contributor-to-be could see it. Tell your friends that may be interested in zombies and zombie-like media, since this is a great zombie-like novel - but is a great read for those who are interested in anything post-apocalyptic or emotional, as well. Just spread the word!

The contributors are the ones that are really going to make this book happen.

story:
2012 was the year...

I had just graduated from college, got my first job in Chicago, far away from home where I only knew a few people, oh and to top it all off I was dealing with the end of a 5 year relationship…

I was dealing with a lot of emotions: fear, loneliness, excitement, happiness, anger, and some I still cannot put into words. I turned to my first love. Poetry was the only thing that had always been constant in my life and kept me sane.

Starting on January 1, 2012 I wrote a poem for every day of the year based on my thoughts and experiences that day. About a month into the writing, I got my friends to join in and write some of their thoughts as well. There we were: six, 20 –something, college graduates trying to keep up the tenacity to fulfill our respective dreams in spite of the day-to-day angst that comes with uncertainty. We started to have this dialogue through writing, phone calls, and spending time with each other and talking about everything that was happening in our lives.

The 365 Project became bigger than just me. I realized that I was not alone, and it has become one of the best experiences I have had in my life.

The 365 Project was my healing. There, in the three journals I used, the scraps of paper I found, and within the sacred heart spaces of my friends Casey, Alfred, Markel, Kelundra, and Brittney, I had no inhibitions, no confusion, no fear.

We want to share this project with the world. Writing is the medium through which I found my healing, but I hope to share this as a way to heal others. I want to inspire a movement. What makes you happy? What keeps you sane when you are down? Where are you searching for fulfillment?

Twelve months and many lessons learned later we want to self-publish this work. Please spread the word, give to our campaign and be INSPIRED! 


So about the money?

We are trying to raise $1500 to be able to self-publish the book. The funds raised will go towards self-publishing costs:

- Print copies

- ISBN number

- Copyright

- Publishing package through Amazon.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Just spread the word. This project is more than just about the 6 of us and we need your help!

Share the campaign on all social media, through emails, at your church, at your meetings. Anywhere, everywhere!!


Thank you so much!

Much love
story_txt: 2012 was the year...I had just graduated from college, got my first job in Chicago, far away from home where I only knew a few people, oh and to top it all off I was dealing with the end of a 5 year relationship…I was dealing with a lot of emotions: fear, loneliness, excitement, happiness, anger, and some I still cannot put into words. I turned to my first love. Poetry was the only thing that had always been constant in my life and kept me sane.Starting on January 1, 2012 I wrote a poem for every day of the year based on my thoughts and experiences that day. About a month into the writing, I got my friends to join in and write some of their thoughts as well. There we were: six, 20 –something, college graduates trying to keep up the tenacity to fulfill our respective dreams in spite of the day-to-day angst that comes with uncertainty. story:
The Poona Poems

...are you in it?

 

Funding humbly hoped-for, for a new book of poems written between 1973 and 2004, in Osho's communes in Poona and the Ranch; also some from Goa, the Himalayas, Sri Lanka...

These are poems about romantic love gone good or bad, about discipleship, about the mysteries of being in a Buddhafield. and a few adventures on Enfields.

Seeking 1,200 pounds, for formatting and publicizing, and putting this book (approx. 260 pages) onto Kindle, and Lulu.com.

 

a sample...

 

in silence

 

ten days she did not talk.

but once,

burned thumb in tea

 

the body talked.

 

- 1975

 

Madhuri is the author of Impassioned Cows by Moonlight, Love at Dancing Leaves: a Tantra Memoir, More About the Moon, and A Colourful Dessert of Flowers. 

Born in California, she is a nomad with a few roots in England.

 

Praise for Madhuri's writing:

 

Madhuri is a very good poet.

- Osho

 

You're real. Your poems are real.

- Denise Levertov, in a letter in 1970

 

I can't imagine how you go that far inside to access these precision experience outpourings of reality. ..your work..has that great “welcome disturbing” effect of Pablo Neruda....

FREQUENTLY you are so so new and fresh. It's a REAL POET when their words lead reality. Hard to explain but I know you get it....

- Prem Geet

 

Each word so simply & clearly in the right place at the right time...I get a feeling of profound...wholeness, completion, appreciation, happiness, comprehension...yet I can't express it. Whilst reading this poem...when I got to certain lines... I started weeping...

- Rudra

 

Your magic poetry reaches just underneath the skin and tugs us into reality for a few brief joyous pleasure moments. Yay!

- Prem Geet

 

...Such hidden depths are gently yet vibrantly lit...

- Nidhi Rice

 

What a gift you have to transmit in words!

- Upchara

 

Every once in a while, you come into my consciousness – via Osho News or another look at your website. I always enjoy reading what you write – even though the subject doesn't often interest me.

I think that says something significant – about you.

- Rama Prem

 

It is a great privilege to publish (your poems....) I feel that in discovering your thoughtful, philosophical and sensitive poetry a new light has been shone on the world of nature and the mind for me. Thank you for sharing it.

- Simon Zonnenblick, Caterpillar Poetry magazine

 

 

..This is incredible writing. I cannot believe a teenager wrote it. More poetry than prose.

- Kerina Moorsteen, (about short story, Meralda.)

 

..You have a talent for expressing yourself with absolute clarity, sincerity and groundedness...

- Kavi

 

I have read your poetry, and I like it.

- Kohrogi-sensei

 

We have all felt these things. We who bother to look. But we do not know how to say it. And we feel alone, until we read your words. You unite our insides. ..

- Sandhano Moorsteen

 

Thank you for being so wild and unruly and sensual. And eloquent about it.

- Sandhano Morsteen

 

Deep, wild, fearless, tender, sacred, rebellious, reverent...

- Sandhano Moorsteen

 

About the poem Heroes:

This poem is exquisite!

- Prabha

I was just reading about child predators when I read your poem. How beautifully you tell the story, the overcoming. Through the fire, bringing beauty from ashes.

- Elizabeth Bordeaux

Your AMAZING poem has kicked off the healing of a lifetime. Tears, past lives....

- Prem Geet

Your poem is beautiful. I say it again: Beautiful!

- Kohrogi-sensei

 

...A real presence as a poet.

- Bob Horne, Puzzle Poets open mic. Sowerby Bridge

 

Your voice and imagination sparks something in me which is very nearly like touching a spark of eternity, a transformed myself – so that I can witness consciousness experiencing itself through the life, words and imaginative forms of another human being.

- David Roberts

 

You are a good writer. I am no great critic but I've been enjoying your stories, though I do find myself envying your youthful ventures in Poona – but, in my opinion, your writing is well constructed and easy to read..as well as very well expressed and the content is very interesting to me also.

- Julian

 

You write in such an extraordinary way – your use of words is very agile and stimulating.

- Dawn Golten

 

On the article How Clinging Happens:

I shall read it again and again. Perfect. Addiction...defying one's personal truth in the moment makes one cling. Ahhh finally the solar plexus pain has softened, if only for a moment. Maybe longer. Understanding is good medicine.

- Kerina Moorsteen

 

On the vid of the song Three Years Ago:

So fleshy, heart-y, sweet oh you amazing poet you. Reminds me of William Butler Yeats! Now that's a compliment. Mad, you make me laugh a lot, can't help it.

- Prem Geet

Brave and beautiful. A love song to the earth...Lots of Fun...Yes and the song and the stones made me ache for a walk on the fells.

- Nirguna

 

 

Impassioned Cows by Moonlight:

 

(Katy Akin) is as good as Burroughs. Somebody, looking for a new, raw, original literary talent should snap her up...

- Noel Young, editor, Capra Press, 1977

 

Your youthful poems: quiet descriptive ferocity. So many perfect words...

- Carl Gancher

 

Akin's empathy with others is deep and felt with considerable originality. She has a special way of moving somehow into the skin of those she loves.

Akin's poems are warm, pulsing pieces of warm fur.

The prose pieces are as adept as the poetry..

Akin's is a talent of major proportions. I hope that her life is her writing, and that more work will reach us, spun from the incredible seams of her special living...it doesn't matter if her craft is deliberate or intuitive – her poems work wonderfully well.

Katy Akin is a damned good poet.

Robert Peters, 1975

 

...A young visionary.

- Gene Detro, 1976

 

Love at Dancing Leaves: a Tantra Memoir

 

Just being near your book, I feel inside humming and thrilled...something sacred has arrived!

Reads like a juicy novel with such valuable treasures of profound wisdom and practical instructions, all woven together in your own inimitable, captivating style.

I can only imagine people will love it and be tremendously benefited by it.

..You write so well, so poetic, so articulate, so preserving of the mystery and sacredness of all the experiences you share with us...You put words so well to what is for me unexpressable beauty. It seems so important that all this be shared...

- Deva Vibha

 

I am so completely wrapped up in reading your book I can't put it away. Reading it is like making love in the most exquisite way, like being embraced and cradled in sweet and lovely honey dew...it is a masterpiece – a song, a dance...of words that flow so effortlessly...like pearls pearling out of your deepest source of beingness empowering the reader...You are amazing Madhuri I am in awe.

Every woman needs to read this book and get empowered by it in her own unique womanness...

- Veet Nisarg

 

The more I read, the more I love your book. ..So many words you write touch my heart and remind me of depths within...Your words ring true in my heart...as beautifully sincere and real as you can possibly be.

...I also enjoy and admire your way with using words, but more important for me is the energy that is transmitted...

Even in Sedona, we suffer form intense boring untruthfulness! And watching the news just makes one sick. Which is why each night as I go to sleep, I read a few pages of your book. It is cleansing, refreshing, funny, delightful, warm, human, wonderful! What a treasure you are.

- Leela Lovegarden

 

You did a super job with this book. It is so real, funny, poignant, honest, creative, deep...

- Mary Ann Winiger

 

Just a note to say how delightful I find your writing style. ..I hope many find your book and read it, you are doing a fabulous job of sharing Osho's tantric teachings.

- Shaeri Richards

 

Just finishing your book...it is such a thing of beauty, wanting to thank you again for sharing yourself with such honesty. It is truly awesome and ohhh so well written! How I admire your litheness and lightness, your dancing and your bliss and creativity and your not avoiding anything but bravely exploring it ALL, allowing darkness and warts, in depths. Being so slow and earthbound myself...it is truly revealing that a life like yours can be had.

I laughed out loud, felt innerly touched and much mouth watering happend as your lovely descriptions of food rolled by...what a wonderful story and unfolding love between the two of you, how magic clean and true.

- Leena Danoe

 

This warm and wooly memoir is as sassy, quirky and tender as its author – one of Osho's earliest Western disciples, intrepid witness, incurable artist, devotee...

This book could only be written by one who comes to life with a simple, grateful Yes.

- Prartho Sereno

 

You are a great story teller, very imaginative and perceptive, wickedly intelligent....You are the real deal.

- Robert Banker

 

Love it, gripped. A beautiful book. Its beauty and intimacy and truth are what hit you.

I want to say that after reading sections of your book, generally about 30 or so pages at a time, I would feel so loving! It also somehow made me appreciate Purushottama (also a Missouri lad) even more.... It helps a kind of relaxation happen and that wonderful sense of merging and not being a separate being. So thank you. You are so open in this book but nothing feels exaggerated. It has a kind of muted respectful feel. ...Understated. And so much acceptance...

To read this book is to be exposed to an intimacy and depth of truth that few writers have the courage to explore. It is a love story but there is no hiding from reality, no losing oneself in fantasy and creating an unreal image of the other. The writer reveals herself and in so doing hidden parts of the reader come to light. At times I laughed deliciously, in other places tears streamed, sometimes from sadness but often from the beauty expressed. It reveals the evolution of love of self, and other, with an undercurrent of acceptance of what is, an exploration of what is, and it leaves you with many tools for your own journey.

- Amido Goodnight

 

I started to read your book last night and was instantly engrossed!...What I am enjoying is just savouring how you put the words on the page. That is my favourite kind of reading.

I will be astonished if your book does not find its way into the valued literature of the world.

- Kumud

 

I've read so many hundreds of books classic or otherwise, and I see that yours is so unique that it will instigate a whole new movement, not only in literature, but in life!

Almost halfway through...So beautiful fun interesting captivating mysterious. So detailed yet inclusive & integrative, insights into pulsations betwixt regular mundane doings & subtle esoteric energies!

And so satisfyingly fat!

...True abundance! I'm sure a plenitude of others will feel the same.

- Rudra

 

Reading and very much enjoying...You are a great descriptive writer.

- Celest Brown

 

This book is so amazingly beautiful...I just started it last night and couldn't put it down, which totally surprised me because it's only really good thrillers that catch me that way.

You have so beautifully caught the exquisite crazyness of our lives I think, those of us who lived with him...totally ORDINARY, and totally totally mystical, and we take it all for granted somehow, or not for granted, but dissolving into the great something as an ordinary part of life, which most people don't experience in a imillion lifetimes.

Your book has shown me so much, what we carry and can open others to...

That is the first thing – know what you are carrying – it is HUGE.

...Anyway this book is incredible. It is just freaking incredible...

- Peggy Sands

 

I'm reading your book, an adventure unto itself...How to say: it is surprising, confronting, and delightful. SO straightforward about things hardly anyone talks about, let alone writes down in detailed descriptions...You also describe very well the places, situations, people, and the food too! As I read I grow to know all of those, and to love them..and the depth from which you come, whether shopping or meditating or tantra-ing, is marvellous..and above all inspiring..I'm printing a chapter, “Music,” to send to my 34-year-old daughter.

- Brahmani

 

I'm slowly making my way through Dancing Leaves, reading it with the care it deserves. I think about the depths of your explorations, reflect on my own dealings in these matters and make some notes. Your words are so descriptive, your exercises so necessary and your narrative so close to real human experiences – warts and all. It teases a part of my brain and my heart that has rarely been touched. I am thrilled by that and grateful too.

...Reading about your early years...such graphic images, teeth, filth, dryness, sex, loneliness, the positive poles of the breasts, hurt, glee, mischief, and luminosity of a soul on fire. Yes I'm still caressing the leaves of your life – holding them for a moment and scattering them as the fall from my hand...I want you to know I did listen. I learned too.

...Reading Dancing Leaves has left me spellbound with your ability to linger with a difficult atmosphere between you and Neil when you tried to speak but faced the experience alone...Maybe there is no other way. We have to face these small deaths alone. Things do pop because of it!

I read your experiences and I grow calm thinking I'm not alone dying when my partner is mute. Thank you for sharing your journey (in all the ways that you do) you will never know how much it means to me.

- Yuri Zelez

 

Best Tantra book ever. (I'm) much more interested in people and personal stories, and how to sometimes step out of them, than just theory and technique.

- Kerina Moorsteen

 

I finished your book. It was so honest and funny and sweet and really feel like I know you now. My favourite bit was when you were trying to do laughing meditation in the church, it had me in fits of laughter myself. ..

- Bria

 

I am so impressed in how you describe (in) words – they are so rich with liveliness and so visual – the reader is really pulled in, this is the type of writing I love. Your descriptions are really genius! It inspires me to write as well.

- Megan Pacetti

 

I agree with all your other fans. Your writing is really compelling, delightful to read, and so far very intriguing – and although I have no idea where the story goes....so far you've got my attention.

- Krishna Priya

 

It is pretty wild for a slightly stuffy Midwestern man to be with a wild witchy beauty like you – and love it! The book is absolutely mindblowingly engaging...Darling, the book is fascinating. You have really done something wonderful.

- Elizabeth Bordeaux

 

It's so rich and real...I don't ever feel preached at or being convinced...it's an extraordinary thing in a not-very-dramatic way and you get to watch it all unfold...If a cynical, mystically challenged person like me can take sweet refreshing draws from your book...the rest of the world should be swimming in it!

- Dalayna Williams

 

I joined your workshop yesterday at the Tantric Festival in Rotterdam ...It was sublime and had a deepness and intensity that is rare in the workshops in Holland that I have joined over the last years.

I am still a bit shaken at this moment – since I just found out you are the author of Love at Dancing Leaves...one of my 2 most cherished 'tantric' books – the other being Daniel Odier's story about his personal journey.

Therefore – a deep bow and thank you!...

- Rudolf Eeken

 

Engaging...I like the way you use words and phrasings. ..Craftsmanship...sweetness of the language, and when it demands you become devastatingly clinical. But the poetry of the prose dominates the cascading flow of the writing, and which is why I like it...I just felt I wished I were a tiny part of that journey.

- Samuel Dani

 

Just finished reading your book! Wow! What a book! I'm truly amazed, delighted, touched, and grateful.

When I first started it I whizzed through the first 50 pages or so totally enthralled with it and wondered, “Is she going to be able to keep this up for 500 pages?” And you did ! Amazing!

I most love your honesty and openness. It's very difficult for me to perceive a woman's world and I sense I got a good glimpse of it because of you. ..

- Ansula

 

Beautiful! Congratulations!

- Deva and Miten

 

The book is so magical I never want it to end. When does the sequel come out?

- Kerina Moorsteen

 

Love at at Dancing Leaves arrived in my life a few days ago...such a joy to peruse, feel, bathe in...thank you so much for your beauty, love and vitality...and also so sweet of you to acknowledge me in your book...I must say I found it really intriguing, full of zest and heart. I really enjoyed reading your Tantric cameos – such a sweetness and playfulness, lightness and innocence...

- Satya Puja

 

I feel like I am frolicking through a leafy forest...You write with transcendent clarity which seems to add an additional dimension – not the 3rd, perhaps, but maybe the 51/2th.

- Huck Akin

 

I started reading Love at Dancing Leaves late last night and only got as far as page 8, the reason being that I found myself re-reading nearly every sentence to savor every word and phrase.

I have bachelor degrees in Literature and History...I think, or like to think, I know good writing when I see it....Until last night, I considered you to be a somewhat talented, but more so deluded writer...I was expecting a sappy, sophomoric romance novel...I was Wrong...Have you read Black Lamb and Gray Falcon by Rebecca West or Bury Me Standing by a female author named Fonseca? Those two books left me in awe of the authors' range and talent, and if your book holds up for the next 497 pages, I'll be adding you to that list.

- Robert Banker

 

Like sipping nectar from acorn cups.

- Dalayna Williams

 

What a pleasure it is to read you: such beautiful writing, with lovely images, lyrical metaphors. The often-musical rhythm and flow spill over and through it. You write with so many felcitious phrases and words coined along the way!

You're definitely a wordsmith – a high compliment in my book.

- Nanette McGuinness, editor

 

More About the Moon

 

I'm just knocked sideways by the majestic language and clarity of More About the Moon and your poetry in general! Everything, from the feel of the book to its sylvan illustrations...and the magnificent words within, has warmed my heart.

- Simon Zonnenblick, editor, Caterpillar Poetry

 

...Alive with deep personal insights from someone who has experienced the world in ways which many of us can only dream of.

Glorious reflections of life shining like jewels in time.

Between two beautiful cover pictures Madhuri's book of poetry offers a vibrant glimpse of life reflected with focus and clarity....I really enjoyed the broad range of experience and vivid connection with each poem and could not put her book down.

Wonderful value.

- Keith Fielder

 

Madhuri's (book of) poetry arrived...what a wonderful gift! I had no idea she could write like that...so beautiful.

- Anupam

 

The book is absolutely magical. When I need a bit of magic, whimsy and fairy wings! - I get it out and treat myself, really like opening candy.

- Kerina Moorsteen

 

I bought 5 or 6 More About the Moon and gifted them to friends and family...You are so talented and it is inspiring to see your continued blossoming.

- Jim Chambers

 

Leave your mind at the door, with your shoes. Madhuri will take you on a journey that will leave you quiet, centered, and enriched. She takes a lifetime of searching, putting pen to paper in the most intense and enlightening moments, sharing those moments to the universe. For anyone who can tune in, and let them take them with her on her path..it's a profound and moving life;s journal...of one remarkable woman's spiritual footsteps.

- William Shepherd (Guru)

 

Your book is beautiful! It's like a song with so much feeling – like you're one with everything.

Thank you for the poem about our childhood.....

- Diana Drake Gall

 

Just about to read more of the poems before bed. They have a soothing effect. I love More About the Moon.

- Alison Darmbrough

 

Just reading the first poem in the book, written when she could not have been more than sixteen, I am delighted by the maturity of the voice – the haiku-like observation of the world around her....and then she takes us on a marvellous journey through her life, across continents and worlds, through love and pain and sorrow and joy, coming and going, learning, and leaving. And in that journey the voice matures, becomes more precise, and takes on that quality, which is perhaps beyond the ken of the very young, where “I” dissolves and the poet really does become the poetry:

 

And one is leaning out the window

over the light lichens crusted on the roof tiles

and the air is clean and cool as water,

and one is so gently full of joy.

 

(from leaning Out a Window in Tuscany, 2009.)

Read this small book. It is a true gift.

- Krishna Gopa

 

..Your book is an amazing treasure. I enjoy reading it and often hear your voice while reading in it...sometimes becoming part of the night-walk or moon-gazing party. Thanks..for this amazing present.

- Ramya

 

Your poems are magnificent...true and wise and innocent. Non-cliche purity...

- Prartho Sereno, Poet Laureate, Marin Co, Calif.

 

Madhuri, you are truly a gifted writer. Your words dance right into my heart...so rich, so sensual and poetic all at once.

- Shaeri Richards

 

Very deep and joyfull – rarely poetry can hold my attention but yours I read every word. Thank you.

- Kamala

 

Deeply felt.

Beautifully said.

A flowering is emerging...

Lovely.

- Devageet.

 

The other day I was reading my beloved Osho! who speaks about how history is really only half of the human story and that the feminine side is missing because the way we experience is so impossible to language. This is where your poetry pours into that empty book of who we are and how we are. I am reminded of the cathedral builders who for 4 or 5 generations cut stone, hauled rock, sanded stone, laid stone, but never saw the cathedral at all or their impact across centuries and cultures. This is you! Sure, you write for you but you write for generations down the line and you open more doors for expression to pour out of women, giving them permission!

- Prem Geet

 

I read More About the Moon voraciously cover to cover...It came at just the right moment...Your poems are magnificent..true and wise and innocent....None of that fancy mental footwork that abounds these days, but non-cliche purity, as clear and mysterious as the moon herself.

- Prartho Sereno

 

Madhuri is the most creative person I know. She is an excellent visual artist, producing watercolors, line drawings, and greeting cards. But, to me, she is above and beyond, a master of words, way beyond being a “word smith.” ...The words line up..they beguile me, invite me in. Many of her poems are spare, but they are larger on the inside...

She has a robust toolbox of (these) phrase turns, a cadence choreograophy, and emotional influxes..called on to sculpt each poem. This toolbox has been evident throughout her time line. The voice is comfortably consistent, but displayed perfectly for each poem, in each content. And there is the Moon in each one this time.

- Carl Gancher

 

...This poet sits at the hem of the Divine moon's illumined gown and takes notes...

Osho speaks about the wholeness of higher mathematics versus ordinary mathematics and says, “The same is true about all the higher values. A beautiful poem is not just the words that compose it; it is something more. Otherwise anybody who can put words together in a rhythmical form will become a Shakespeare, a Kalidas, a Milton, a Shelley. Then any linguist, grammarian will become a great poet. That does not happen. You may know the whole grammar of language, you may be acquainted with all the words of the language, still to be a poet is a totally different phenomenon. Poetry comes first, then come the words, not vice versa – it is not that you arrange the words and the poetry arises.

- Osho, I Am That, ch 9

 

I really like More About the Moon. To my eyes and ears you have an authentic voice.

- Satyam

 

...Tremendous appreciation for your imagery, ability to write rhythmically and the passion for life, love and getting to the bottom of it all that permeates your creativity.

- Amido Goodnight

 

Madhuri's primal poetry is one beautiful individualistic example of how poetry comes first, across a lifetime, as a way of relating to life, mining a relationship to Self...A mo-n-mad mystical trek over four decades...

Throughout recorded history, it seems that poets would have depleted the Moon's imagery by now, but Madhuri's latest moon-licious book proves that the Cool She is inexhaustible, rich beyond imagining, as many-faced as we are....Her amazing book is a rare moon-guided journey from a woman's waxing pubescence to the fullness of her own oceanic presence...the Night Pearl continues to reveal Herself in altogether new ways as long as there is a witnessing, pulsating mystic looking up... Madhuri reveals a rare gift, as if following the best poetic advice from..Ezra Pound who said simply, “Make it new.”

- Prem Geet

 

A Colourful Dessert of Flowers

 

 

(Re audio version:) First of all, there is your voice: it is mellow yet acrobatic in its flexibility. It is soothing and draws me in...I loved the crescendo section...And your rhythms:...prit'neer perfect...It was very musical in its rhythms, driven by your sweet facile voice.

And your thought stream: A thorough and insightful journey through sweet meadows, glades and ponds, bypassing negativity and linking up with the positive cosmic conscious mode..and there were many times I was jolted with the brilliance of the turns of phrase. I made pleased sounds: hoots, guffaws, sighs (with a shake of the head), and many repeats of the spoken word “AMAZING”.

- Carl Gancher

The Armageddon piece is brilliant....the main element was your performance.

Poetry become almost song...

- Nirguna

I listened to your beautiful voice as I tidied my office and did some filing.

Epic poems! ..You are amazing and after a while I became lulled into this place of deep peace with your words gently undulating in the background.

Beautiful and quirky and interesting.

- Dawn Golten

 

My lovely friend and teacher Madhuri who was my door to India and many other experiences has a new book! If you love soaking in mystical girly-womanly imagery...check it out!

Dalayna Williams

 

The truly original poet Madhuri creates a new form of extended poetry that invites you into her unconscious as a trembling participant of some foreign communion...(She) pours her existence into yours. Her words reshape you.

- Prem Geet

 

The book did leave me a bit speechless. Really wonderful. Out of any box I have ever seen.

- Kerina Moorsteen

 

Truly a wonderful poem, filled me with delight!

- Daniela Leardini

 

 

 

 

 

The Poona Poems

 

Wise, witty and honest poems about love, attachment, and detachment for other women to go “Ah ha!” to and curious men to wonder at...and all the others including the clear, clear ones after your op. It's been a privilege to read them.

- Satyam Makoieva

 

It REALLY is a very valuable historical snapshot of soul in time....

- Prem Geet

 

www.madhurijewel.com/books

fb Madhuri Z K Ewing Poetry

and fb Metaphysical Therapy Arts

madhuritourmaline@gmail.com
story_txt:
The Poona Poems
...are you in it?
 
Funding humbly hoped-for, for a new book of poems written between 1973 and 2004, in Osho's communes in Poona and the Ranch; also some from Goa, the Himalayas, Sri Lanka...
These are poems about romantic love gone good or bad, about discipleship, about the mysteries of being in a Buddhafield. and a few adventures on Enfields.
Seeking 1,200 pounds, for formatting and publicizing, and putting this book (approx. 260 pages) onto Kindle, and Lulu.com.
 
a sample...
 
in silence
 
ten days she did not talk.
but once,
burned thumb in tea
 
the body talked.
 
- 1975
 
Madhuri is the author of Impassioned Cows by Moonlight, Love at Dancing Leaves: a Tantra Memoir, More About the Moon, and A Colourful Dessert of Flowers. 
Born in California, she is a nomad with a few roots in England.
 
Praise for Madhuri's writing:
 
Madhuri is a very good poet.
- Osho
 
You're real. Your poems are real.
- Denise Levertov, in a letter in 1970
 
I can't imagine how you go that far inside to access these precision experience outpourings of reality. ..your work..has that great “welcome disturbing” effect of Pablo Neruda....
FREQUENTLY you are so so new and fresh. It's a REAL POET when their words lead reality. Hard to explain but I know you get it....
- Prem Geet
 
Each word so simply & clearly in the right place at the right time...I get a feeling of profound...wholeness, completion, appreciation, happiness, comprehension...yet I can't express it. Whilst reading this poem...when I got to certain lines... I started weeping...
- Rudra
 
Your magic poetry reaches just underneath the skin and tugs us into reality for a few brief joyous pleasure moments. Yay!
- Prem Geet
 
...Such hidden depths are gently yet vibrantly lit...
- Nidhi Rice
 
What a gift you have to transmit in words!
- Upchara
 
Every once in a while, you come into my consciousness – via Osho News or another look at your website. I always enjoy reading what you write – even though the subject doesn't often interest me.
I think that says something significant – about you.
- Rama Prem
 
It is a great privilege to publish (your poems....) I feel that in discovering your thoughtful, philosophical and sensitive poetry a new light has been shone on the world of nature and the mind for me. Thank you for sharing it.
- Simon Zonnenblick, Caterpillar Poetry magazine
 
 
..This is incredible writing. I cannot believe a teenager wrote it. More poetry than prose.
- Kerina Moorsteen, (about short story, Meralda.)
 
..You have a talent for expressing yourself with absolute clarity, sincerity and groundedness...
- Kavi
 
I have read your poetry, and I like it.
- Kohrogi-sensei
 
We have all felt these things. We who bother to look. But we do not know how to say it. And we feel alone, until we read your words. You unite our insides. ..
- Sandhano Moorsteen
 
Thank you for being so wild and unruly and sensual. And eloquent about it.
- Sandhano Morsteen
 
Deep, wild, fearless, tender, sacred, rebellious, reverent...
- Sandhano Moorsteen
 
About the poem Heroes:
This poem is exquisite!
- Prabha
I was just reading about child predators when I read your poem. How beautifully you tell the story, the overcoming. Through the fire, bringing beauty from ashes.
- Elizabeth Bordeaux
Your AMAZING poem has kicked off the healing of a lifetime. Tears, past lives....
- Prem Geet
Your poem is beautiful. I say it again: Beautiful!
- Kohrogi-sensei
 
...A real presence as a poet.
- Bob Horne, Puzzle Poets open mic. Sowerby Bridge
 
Your voice and imagination sparks something in me which is very nearly like touching a spark of eternity, a transformed myself – so that I can witness consciousness experiencing itself through the life, words and imaginative forms of another human being.
- David Roberts
 
You are a good writer. I am no great critic but I've been enjoying your stories, though I do find myself envying your youthful ventures in Poona – but, in my opinion, your writing is well constructed and easy to read..as well as very well expressed and the content is very interesting to me also.
- Julian
 
You write in such an extraordinary way – your use of words is very agile and stimulating.
- Dawn Golten
 
On the article How Clinging Happens:
I shall read it again and again. Perfect. Addiction...defying one's personal truth in the moment makes one cling. Ahhh finally the solar plexus pain has softened, if only for a moment. Maybe longer. Understanding is good medicine.
- Kerina Moorsteen
 
On the vid of the song Three Years Ago:
So fleshy, heart-y, sweet oh you amazing poet you. Reminds me of William Butler Yeats! Now that's a compliment. Mad, you make me laugh a lot, can't help it.
- Prem Geet
Brave and beautiful. A love song to the earth...Lots of Fun...Yes and the song and the stones made me ache for a walk on the fells.
- Nirguna
 
 
Impassioned Cows by Moonlight:
 
(Katy Akin) is as good as Burroughs. Somebody, looking for a new, raw, original literary talent should snap her up...
- Noel Young, editor, Capra Press, 1977
 
Your youthful poems: quiet descriptive ferocity. So many perfect words...
- Carl Gancher
 
Akin's empathy with others is deep and felt with considerable originality. She has a special way of moving somehow into the skin of those she loves.
Akin's poems are warm, pulsing pieces of warm fur.
The prose pieces are as adept as the poetry..
Akin's is a talent of major proportions. I hope that her life is her writing, and that more work will reach us, spun from the incredible seams of her special living...it doesn't matter if her craft is deliberate or intuitive – her poems work wonderfully well.
Katy Akin is a damned good poet.
Robert Peters, 1975
 
...A young visionary.
- Gene Detro, 1976
 
Love at Dancing Leaves: a Tantra Memoir
 
Just being near your book, I feel inside humming and thrilled...something sacred has arrived!
Reads like a juicy novel with such valuable treasures of profound wisdom and practical instructions, all woven together in your own inimitable, captivating style.
I can only imagine people will love it and be tremendously benefited by it.
..You write so well, so poetic, so articulate, so preserving of the mystery and sacredness of all the experiences you share with us...You put words so well to what is for me unexpressable beauty. It seems so important that all this be shared...
- Deva Vibha
 
I am so completely wrapped up in reading your book I can't put it away. Reading it is like making love in the most exquisite way, like being embraced and cradled in sweet and lovely honey dew...it is a masterpiece – a song, a dance...of words that flow so effortlessly...like pearls pearling out of your deepest source of beingness empowering the reader...You are amazing Madhuri I am in awe.
Every woman needs to read this book and get empowered by it in her own unique womanness...
- Veet Nisarg
 
The more I read, the more I love your book. ..So many words you write touch my heart and remind me of depths within...Your words ring true in my heart...as beautifully sincere and real as you can possibly be.
...I also enjoy and admire your way with using words, but more important for me is the energy that is transmitted...
Even in Sedona, we suffer form intense boring untruthfulness! And watching the news just makes one sick. Which is why each night as I go to sleep, I read a few pages of your book. It is cleansing, refreshing, funny, delightful, warm, human, wonderful! What a treasure you are.
- Leela Lovegarden
 
You did a super job with this book. It is so real, funny, poignant, honest, creative, deep...
- Mary Ann Winiger
 
Just a note to say how delightful I find your writing style. ..I hope many find your book and read it, you are doing a fabulous job of sharing Osho's tantric teachings.
- Shaeri Richards
 
Just finishing your book...it is such a thing of beauty, wanting to thank you again for sharing yourself with such honesty. It is truly awesome and ohhh so well written! How I admire your litheness and lightness, your dancing and your bliss and creativity and your not avoiding anything but bravely exploring it ALL, allowing darkness and warts, in depths. Being so slow and earthbound myself...it is truly revealing that a life like yours can be had.
I laughed out loud, felt innerly touched and much mouth watering happend as your lovely descriptions of food rolled by...what a wonderful story and unfolding love between the two of you, how magic clean and true.
- Leena Danoe
 
This warm and wooly memoir is as sassy, quirky and tender as its author – one of Osho's earliest Western disciples, intrepid witness, incurable artist, devotee...
This book could only be written by one who comes to life with a simple, grateful Yes.
- Prartho Sereno
 
You are a great story teller, very imaginative and perceptive, wickedly intelligent....You are the real deal.
- Robert Banker
 
Love it, gripped. A beautiful book. Its beauty and intimacy and truth are what hit you.
I want to say that after reading sections of your book, generally about 30 or so pages at a time, I would feel so loving! It also somehow made me appreciate Purushottama (also a Missouri lad) even more.... It helps a kind of relaxation happen and that wonderful sense of merging and not being a separate being. So thank you. You are so open in this book but nothing feels exaggerated. It has a kind of muted respectful feel. ...Understated. And so much acceptance...
To read this book is to be exposed to an intimacy and depth of truth that few writers have the courage to explore. It is a love story but there is no hiding from reality, no losing oneself in fantasy and creating an unreal image of the other. The writer reveals herself and in so doing hidden parts of the reader come to light. At times I laughed deliciously, in other places tears streamed, sometimes from sadness but often from the beauty expressed. It reveals the evolution of love of self, and other, with an undercurrent of acceptance of what is, an exploration of what is, and it leaves you with many tools for your own journey.
- Amido Goodnight
 
I started to read your book last night and was instantly engrossed!...What I am enjoying is just savouring how you put the words on the page. That is my favourite kind of reading.
I will be astonished if your book does not find its way into the valued literature of the world.
- Kumud
 
I've read so many hundreds of books classic or otherwise, and I see that yours is so unique that it will instigate a whole new movement, not only in literature, but in life!
Almost halfway through...So beautiful fun interesting captivating mysterious. So detailed yet inclusive & integrative, insights into pulsations betwixt regular mundane doings & subtle esoteric energies!
And so satisfyingly fat!
...True abundance! I'm sure a plenitude of others will feel the same.
- Rudra
 
Reading and very much enjoying...You are a great descriptive writer.
- Celest Brown
 
This book is so amazingly beautiful...I just started it last night and couldn't put it down, which totally surprised me because it's only really good thrillers that catch me that way.
You have so beautifully caught the exquisite crazyness of our lives I think, those of us who lived with him...totally ORDINARY, and totally totally mystical, and we take it all for granted somehow, or not for granted, but dissolving into the great something as an ordinary part of life, which most people don't experience in a imillion lifetimes.
Your book has shown me so much, what we carry and can open others to...
That is the first thing – know what you are carrying – it is HUGE.
...Anyway this book is incredible. It is just freaking incredible...
- Peggy Sands
 
I'm reading your book, an adventure unto itself...How to say: it is surprising, confronting, and delightful. SO straightforward about things hardly anyone talks about, let alone writes down in detailed descriptions...You also describe very well the places, situations, people, and the food too! As I read I grow to know all of those, and to love them..and the depth from which you come, whether shopping or meditating or tantra-ing, is marvellous..and above all inspiring..I'm printing a chapter, “Music,” to send to my 34-year-old daughter.
- Brahmani
 
I'm slowly making my way through Dancing Leaves, reading it with the care it deserves. I think about the depths of your explorations, reflect on my own dealings in these matters and make some notes. Your words are so descriptive, your exercises so necessary and your narrative so close to real human experiences – warts and all. It teases a part of my brain and my heart that has rarely been touched. I am thrilled by that and grateful too.
...Reading about your early years...such graphic images, teeth, filth, dryness, sex, loneliness, the positive poles of the breasts, hurt, glee, mischief, and luminosity of a soul on fire. Yes I'm still caressing the leaves of your life – holding them for a moment and scattering them as the fall from my hand...I want you to know I did listen. I learned too.
...Reading Dancing Leaves has left me spellbound with your ability to linger with a difficult atmosphere between you and Neil when you tried to speak but faced the experience alone...Maybe there is no other way. We have to face these small deaths alone. Things do pop because of it!
I read your experiences and I grow calm thinking I'm not alone dying when my partner is mute. Thank you for sharing your journey (in all the ways that you do) you will never know how much it means to me.
- Yuri Zelez
 
Best Tantra book ever. (I'm) much more interested in people and personal stories, and how to sometimes step out of them, than just theory and technique.
- Kerina Moorsteen
 
I finished your book. It was so honest and funny and sweet and really feel like I know you now. My favourite bit was when you were trying to do laughing meditation in the church, it had me in fits of laughter myself. ..
- Bria
 
I am so impressed in how you describe (in) words – they are so rich with liveliness and so visual – the reader is really pulled in, this is the type of writing I love. Your descriptions are really genius! It inspires me to write as well.
- Megan Pacetti
 
I agree with all your other fans. Your writing is really compelling, delightful to read, and so far very intriguing – and although I have no idea where the story goes....so far you've got my attention.
- Krishna Priya
 
It is pretty wild for a slightly stuffy Midwestern man to be with a wild witchy beauty like you – and love it! The book is absolutely mindblowingly engaging...Darling, the book is fascinating. You have really done something wonderful.
- Elizabeth Bordeaux
 
It's so rich and real...I don't ever feel preached at or being convinced...it's an extraordinary thing in a not-very-dramatic way and you get to watch it all unfold...If a cynical, mystically challenged person like me can take sweet refreshing draws from your book...the rest of the world should be swimming in it!

I joined your workshop yesterday at the Tantric Festival in Rotterdam ...It was sublime and had a deepness and intensity that is rare in the workshops in Holland that I have joined over the last years.
I am still a bit shaken at this moment – since I just found out you are the author of Love at Dancing Leaves...one of my 2 most cherished 'tantric' books – the other being Daniel Odier's story about his personal journey.
Therefore – a deep bow and thank you!...

Engaging...I like the way you use words and phrasings. ..Craftsmanship...sweetness of the language, and when it demands you become devastatingly clinical. Beautiful! Congratulations!
- Deva and Miten
 
The book is so magical I never want it to end. When does the sequel come out?

Love at at Dancing Leaves arrived in my life a few days ago...such a joy to peruse, feel, bathe in...thank you so much for your beauty, love and vitality...and also so sweet of you to acknowledge me in your book...I must say I found it really intriguing, full of zest and heart. I really enjoyed reading your Tantric cameos – such a sweetness and playfulness, lightness and innocence...
- Satya Puja
 
I feel like I am frolicking through a leafy forest...You write with transcendent clarity which seems to add an additional dimension – not the 3rd, perhaps, but maybe the 51/2th.
- Huck Akin
 
I started reading Love at Dancing Leaves late last night and only got as far as page 8, the reason being that I found myself re-reading nearly every sentence to savor every word and phrase.
I have bachelor degrees in Literature and History...I think, or like to think, I know good writing when I see it....Until last night, I considered you to be a somewhat talented, but more so deluded writer...I was expecting a sappy, sophomoric romance novel...I was Wrong...Have you read Black Lamb and Gray Falcon by Rebecca West or Bury Me Standing by a female author named Fonseca? Those two books left me in awe of the authors' range and talent, and if your book holds up for the next 497 pages, I'll be adding you to that list.
- Robert Banker
 
Like sipping nectar from acorn cups.
- Dalayna Williams
 
What a pleasure it is to read you: such beautiful writing, with lovely images, lyrical metaphors. The often-musical rhythm and flow spill over and through it. You write with so many felcitious phrases and words coined along the way!
You're definitely a wordsmith – a high compliment in my book.
- Nanette McGuinness, editor
 
More About the Moon
 
I'm just knocked sideways by the majestic language and clarity of More About the Moon and your poetry in general! Everything, from the feel of the book to its sylvan illustrations...and the magnificent words within, has warmed my heart.
- Simon Zonnenblick, editor, Caterpillar Poetry
 
...Alive with deep personal insights from someone who has experienced the world in ways which many of us can only dream of.
Glorious reflections of life shining like jewels in time.

Madhuri's (book of) poetry arrived...what a wonderful gift! I had no idea she could write like that...so beautiful.

I bought 5 or 6 More About the Moon and gifted them to friends and family...You are so talented and it is inspiring to see your continued blossoming.

Leave your mind at the door, with your shoes. Madhuri will take you on a journey that will leave you quiet, centered, and enriched. She takes a lifetime of searching, putting pen to paper in the most intense and enlightening moments, sharing those moments to the universe. For anyone who can tune in, and let them take them with her on her path..it's a profound and moving life;s journal...of one remarkable woman's spiritual footsteps.

Your book is beautiful! It's like a song with so much feeling – like you're one with everything.
Thank you for the poem about our childhood.....
