Just about to read more of the poems before bed. They have a soothing effect. I love More About the Moon.
- Alison Darmbrough
 
Just reading the first poem in the book, written when she could not have been more than sixteen, I am delighted by the maturity of the voice – the haiku-like observation of the world around her....and then she takes us on a marvellous journey through her life, across continents and worlds, through love and pain and sorrow and joy, coming and going, learning, and leaving. And in that journey the voice matures, becomes more precise, and takes on that quality, which is perhaps beyond the ken of the very young, where “I” dissolves and the poet really does become the poetry:
 
And one is leaning out the window
over the light lichens crusted on the roof tiles
and the air is clean and cool as water,
and one is so gently full of joy.
 
(from leaning Out a Window in Tuscany, 2009.)
Read this small book. It is a true gift.
- Krishna Gopa
 
..Your book is an amazing treasure. I enjoy reading it and often hear your voice while reading in it...sometimes becoming part of the night-walk or moon-gazing party. Thanks..for this amazing present.

Your poems are magnificent...true and wise and innocent. Non-cliche purity...
- Prartho Sereno, Poet Laureate, Marin Co, Calif.
 
Madhuri, you are truly a gifted writer. Your words dance right into my heart...so rich, so sensual and poetic all at once.

Very deep and joyfull – rarely poetry can hold my attention but yours I read every word. Thank you.
- Kamala
 
Deeply felt.
Beautifully said.
A flowering is emerging...
Lovely.

The other day I was reading my beloved Osho! who speaks about how history is really only half of the human story and that the feminine side is missing because the way we experience is so impossible to language. This is where your poetry pours into that empty book of who we are and how we are. I am reminded of the cathedral builders who for 4 or 5 generations cut stone, hauled rock, sanded stone, laid stone, but never saw the cathedral at all or their impact across centuries and cultures. This is you! Sure, you write for you but you write for generations down the line and you open more doors for expression to pour out of women, giving them permission!

I read More About the Moon voraciously cover to cover...It came at just the right moment...Your poems are magnificent..true and wise and innocent....None of that fancy mental footwork that abounds these days, but non-cliche purity, as clear and mysterious as the moon herself.

Madhuri is the most creative person I know. She is an excellent visual artist, producing watercolors, line drawings, and greeting cards. But, to me, she is above and beyond, a master of words, way beyond being a “word smith.” ...The words line up..they beguile me, invite me in. Many of her poems are spare, but they are larger on the inside...
She has a robust toolbox of (these) phrase turns, a cadence choreograophy, and emotional influxes..called on to sculpt each poem. This toolbox has been evident throughout her time line. The voice is comfortably consistent, but displayed perfectly for each poem, in each content. And there is the Moon in each one this time.
- Carl Gancher
 
...This poet sits at the hem of the Divine moon's illumined gown and takes notes...
Osho speaks about the wholeness of higher mathematics versus ordinary mathematics and says, “The same is true about all the higher values. A beautiful poem is not just the words that compose it; it is something more. Otherwise anybody who can put words together in a rhythmical form will become a Shakespeare, a Kalidas, a Milton, a Shelley. Then any linguist, grammarian will become a great poet. That does not happen. You may know the whole grammar of language, you may be acquainted with all the words of the language, still to be a poet is a totally different phenomenon. Poetry comes first, then come the words, not vice versa – it is not that you arrange the words and the poetry arises.
- Osho, I Am That, ch 9
 
I really like More About the Moon. To my eyes and ears you have an authentic voice.
- Satyam
 
...Tremendous appreciation for your imagery, ability to write rhythmically and the passion for life, love and getting to the bottom of it all that permeates your creativity.
- Amido Goodnight
 
Madhuri's primal poetry is one beautiful individualistic example of how poetry comes first, across a lifetime, as a way of relating to life, mining a relationship to Self...A mo-n-mad mystical trek over four decades...
Throughout recorded history, it seems that poets would have depleted the Moon's imagery by now, but Madhuri's latest moon-licious book proves that the Cool She is inexhaustible, rich beyond imagining, as many-faced as we are....Her amazing book is a rare moon-guided journey from a woman's waxing pubescence to the fullness of her own oceanic presence...the Night Pearl continues to reveal Herself in altogether new ways as long as there is a witnessing, pulsating mystic looking up... Madhuri reveals a rare gift, as if following the best poetic advice from..Ezra Pound who said simply, “Make it new.”
- Prem Geet
 
A Colourful Dessert of Flowers
 
 
(Re audio version:) First of all, there is your voice: it is mellow yet acrobatic in its flexibility. It is soothing and draws me in...I loved the crescendo section...And your rhythms:...prit'neer perfect...It was very musical in its rhythms, driven by your sweet facile voice.
And your thought stream: A thorough and insightful journey through sweet meadows, glades and ponds, bypassing negativity and linking up with the positive cosmic conscious mode..and there were many times I was jolted with the brilliance of the turns of phrase. I made pleased sounds: hoots, guffaws, sighs (with a shake of the head), and many repeats of the spoken word “AMAZING”.
- Carl Gancher
The Armageddon piece is brilliant....the main element was your performance.
Poetry become almost song...
- Nirguna
I listened to your beautiful voice as I tidied my office and did some filing.
Epic poems! ..You are amazing and after a while I became lulled into this place of deep peace with your words gently undulating in the background.
Beautiful and quirky and interesting.
- Dawn Golten
 
My lovely friend and teacher Madhuri who was my door to India and many other experiences has a new book! If you love soaking in mystical girly-womanly imagery...check it out!
Dalayna Williams
 
The truly original poet Madhuri creates a new form of extended poetry that invites you into her unconscious as a trembling participant of some foreign communion...(She) pours her existence into yours. Her words reshape you.
- Prem Geet
 
The book did leave me a bit speechless. Really wonderful. Out of any box I have ever seen.
- Kerina Moorsteen
 
Truly a wonderful poem, filled me with delight!
- Daniela Leardini
 
 
 
 
 
The Poona Poems
 
Wise, witty and honest poems about love, attachment, and detachment for other women to go “Ah ha!” to and curious men to wonder at...and all the others including the clear, clear ones after your op. It's been a privilege to read them.
- Satyam Makoieva
 
It REALLY is a very valuable historical snapshot of soul in time....
- Prem Geet

story:
I’m Dan Miller, life coach and the author of 48 Days to the Work You Love, No More Dreaded Mondays and The Rudder of the Day. My passion is helping people find – or create – work that is meaningful, fulfilling and profitable.

My publisher, Thomas Nelson, is releasing the trade paperback version of Wisdom Meets Passion on August 28th, but we wanted to give you an opportunity to collaborate with us to spread this powerful message. We have produced a Special Edition Hardback Version of Wisdom meets Passion that won't be sold in stores. We're making it available to you first, here on Indiegogo.

This project is about the power of collaboration. I worked with my son Jared Angaza to write Wisdom Meets Passion - A book that talks about joining generations and philosophies. We also created a medallion that captures the essence of the book. You can wear it around your neck or put it in your pocket as a daily reminder to connect.

What is Wisdom Meets Passion About?

Wisdom meets Passion isn’t a movement or a new philosophy. It’s a reminder. A wakeup call. An outline to engage us in living a more extraordinary life. To help us become the very best of who we are. 

To thrive.

We’ve got a plan that involves collaborating with you.

Ubuntu

There’s an old African philosophy that encapsulates the concept of collaborative living.

It’s called Ubuntu.

It’s the belief that we are all interconnected.

No matter our race, culture, creed or socioeconomic status.

My humanity is tied to yours.

We are each a collective of our personal relationships and experiences.

We’ve created a special medallion as a reminder of this.

 

THE CONCEPT

Many of us are clamoring for a more meaningful and purposeful existence. We want more out of life than the 9 to 5 job and a paycheck. We want to make an impact. We crave the extraordinary.

But we’re busy. More than ever before. It’s easy to forget that there are thousands of other people out there just like us that also want to live a more extraordinary and altruistically founded life. That’s where great little platforms like Indiegogo came from.

Remember when your favorite bands came together to make that epic song? Or that giant corporation came together with a great charity and profoundly impacted a community? 

Powerful things can happen when we collaborate. Big and small. Matter of fact, most of the beautiful things we experience in life are as a result of collaboration. That’s where the magic happens. 

But in a time of information and sensory overload, life happens. We get caught up in the moment and forget to collaborate. We forget that we are all interconnected, and when we work together, beautiful things can happen.

ABOUT THE BOOK

 

Baby boomers have relied primarily on wisdom to pave their way to success. Education, knowledge, investment strategies, 401ks and carefully contrived career paths were expected to lead to success in one’s golden years. 

Seeing the overall failure of that formulaic approach to life, younger generations today have relied on passion as the guiding principle for their version of success.

The concept of “success” has transformed from a focus on financial gain to a focus on living a more extraordinary life, one that benefits humanity. We want to make the world a better, more peaceful place. We want to be “changemakers” and “social entrepreneurs." Security and stability are a lot less compelling than before. There’s more out there and we know it. 

In short, we must foster wisdom, passion and collaboration if we truly want to live an extraordinary life and make a positive impact. 

In Wisdom Meets Passion you’ll find some of these principles:

  • How can I “make a difference” in the world today?
  • Where do I find security?
  • Is a college degree necessary for success today?
  • How do I find – or create – work that matters?
  • Can I be a social entrepreneur and do good while doing well?
  • Why am I here?
  • What if I’m ready for retirement and still haven’t lived my dream – is it too late?

Our goal is to get this book and medallion into your hands.  We want you be able to inspire those in your center of influence – children, spouses, co-workers and those you meet on the street.  

ABOUT THE MEDALLION

The medallion was designed as a collaboration between Jared Angaza and Hannah Woodard at KEZA, an ethical fashion label owned by Jared that operates in East Africa. You can visit the KEZA website at www.keza.com for more information.

The necklace itself is made from a durable, black nylon cord, randomly knotted and looped around itself, as a representation of humanity. The cord loops through the center of the Ubuntu Medallion, representing the core of our ethos as a united society.

The necklace was assembled by Nepali refugees through Hope Rise, a Nashville, TN based charity assisting refugees integrating into Nashville. Every medallion sold affords them more income, dignity and options.

You can wear it on your neck, carry it in your pocket, pay it forward or hang it from your rearview mirror. Go wild with it. 

We’ve put together some killer packages that aren’t just for you to read the book and open your head to the possibilities, but for you to share it with others – the true message of Wisdom meets Passion.  Join us on our journey.  

Official Book Release of Wisdom Meets Passion: August 28rd, 2012.

What others are saying

"Too often we think success means only making money.  But financial abundance in the absence of wisdom and passion will be meaningless." - Darren Hardy, Publisher SUCCESS Magazine, New York Times bestselling author The Compound Effect

“This book will inspire you to live with more authenticity.  Buckle up and get ready to release your own unique wisdom and passion. You might be surprised by what you end up doing.”- Bob Goff, Jesus Leaker and author of Love Does

“It's not just about wisdom and passion—this inspiring book redefines security for multiple generations, offering clear steps, surprising examples, and hope. This book will change the world!”  - Chris Guillebeau, Author, The $100 Startup

“When you combine Dan’s old-school wisdom with Jared’s cutting-edge passion, you get a solid, comprehensive plan for attacking your life and career goals!”  - Dave Ramsey, New York Times best-selling author and nationally syndicated radio show host

 “None of us wants to live a mediocre life.  In this book Dan and Jared shine light on the exciting process of blending wisdom and passion for a Born to Win life.  If you are ready to really live the life you were born to have, then this book is a must for you!”  - Tom  Ziglar, CEO of Ziglar Inc.

New to Indiegogo?

You can become a backer in just three easy steps:

Step 1: Read through the pledge levels and rewards we're offering in the right sidebar of this page.

Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page. 

Step 3: Enter your pledge amount - and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds!

That's it! You’ve just made your first installment in living a more extraordinary life.

Special note: Your pledges aren't actually processed by Indiegogo unless the campaign is 100% successful. We meet our goal or we get nothing. Don't worry. With your collaboration we know we can spread this important reminder around the world! 

HOW TO SHARE THIS WITH THE WORLD!

Facebook

By far, our best tool for sharing this message is through Facebook.  What is even more powerful than simply hitting the like button is to copy the URL above and post the link on your Facebook page – tell people WHY you like this and for them to check it out!

Twitter

Tweet about the project and/or vide by click the button under the video or simply sharing our direct URL for this page.

Email

Think of the people in your life that may benefit from this message or appreciate helping to spread it. Write them a note or just send a link to this page.

Old fashioned word-of-mouth

Talk about it to everyone you see. Nothing beats a genuine, face-to-face conversation! 

Thanks again for all your support!

We'll leave you with one of the team's favorite quotations...

The master in the art of living makes little distinction between his work and his play, his labor and his leisure, his mind and his body, his information and his recreation, his love and his religion. He hardly knows which is which. He simply pursues his vision of excellence at whatever he does, leaving others to decide whether he is working or playing. To him he is always doing both.     James Michener
story_txt:
I’m Dan Miller, life coach and the author of 48 Days to the Work You Love, No More Dreaded Mondays and The Rudder of the Day. My passion is helping people find – or create – work that is meaningful, fulfilling and profitable.
My publisher, Thomas Nelson, is releasing the trade paperback version of Wisdom Meets Passion on August 28th, but we wanted to give you an opportunity to collaborate with us to spread this powerful message. We have produced a Special Edition Hardback Version of Wisdom meets Passion that won't be sold in stores. We're making it available to you first, here on Indiegogo.
This project is about the power of collaboration. I worked with my son Jared Angaza to write Wisdom Meets Passion - A book that talks about joining generations and philosophies. We also created a medallion that captures the essence of the book. You can wear it around your neck or put it in your pocket as a daily reminder to connect.

What is Wisdom Meets Passion About?
Wisdom meets Passion isn’t a movement or a new philosophy. It’s a reminder. A wakeup call. An outline to engage us in living a more extraordinary life. To help us become the very best of who we are. 
To thrive.
We’ve got a plan that involves collaborating with you.
Ubuntu
There’s an old African philosophy that encapsulates the concept of collaborative living.
It’s called Ubuntu.
It’s the belief that we are all interconnected.
No matter our race, culture, creed or socioeconomic status.
My humanity is tied to yours.
We are each a collective of our personal relationships and experiences.
We’ve created a special medallion as a reminder of this.
 
THE CONCEPT

Many of us are clamoring for a more meaningful and purposeful existence. We want more out of life than the 9 to 5 job and a paycheck. We want to make an impact. We crave the extraordinary.
But we’re busy. More than ever before. It’s easy to forget that there are thousands of other people out there just like us that also want to live a more extraordinary and altruistically founded life. That’s where great little platforms like Indiegogo came from.
Remember when your favorite bands came together to make that epic song? Or that giant corporation came together with a great charity and profoundly impacted a community? 
Powerful things can happen when we collaborate. Big and small. Matter of fact, most of the beautiful things we experience in life are as a result of collaboration. That’s where the magic happens. 
But in a time of information and sensory overload, life happens. We get caught up in the moment and forget to collaborate. We forget that we are all interconnected, and when we work together, beautiful things can happen.
ABOUT THE BOOK
 

Baby boomers have relied primarily on wisdom to pave their way to success. Education, knowledge, investment strategies, 401ks and carefully contrived career paths were expected to lead to success in one’s golden years. 
Seeing the overall failure of that formulaic approach to life, younger generations today have relied on passion as the guiding principle for their version of success.
The concept of “success” has transformed from a focus on financial gain to a focus on living a more extraordinary life, one that benefits humanity. We want to make the world a better, more peaceful place. We want to be “changemakers” and “social entrepreneurs." Security and stability are a lot less compelling than before. There’s more out there and we know it. 
In short, we must foster wisdom, passion and collaboration if we truly want to live an extraordinary life and make a positive impact. 
In Wisdom Meets Passion you’ll find some of these principles:

How can I “make a difference” in the world today?
Where do I find security?
Is a college degree necessary for success today?
How do I find – or create – work that matters?
Can I be a social entrepreneur and do good while doing well?
Why am I here?
What if I’m ready for retirement and still haven’t lived my dream – is it too late?


Our goal is to get this book and medallion into your hands.  We want you be able to inspire those in your center of influence – children, spouses, co-workers and those you meet on the street.  
ABOUT THE MEDALLION

The medallion was designed as a collaboration between Jared Angaza and Hannah Woodard at KEZA, an ethical fashion label owned by Jared that operates in East Africa. You can visit the KEZA website at www.keza.com for more information.



The necklace itself is made from a durable, black nylon cord, randomly knotted and looped around itself, as a representation of humanity. The cord loops through the center of the Ubuntu Medallion, representing the core of our ethos as a united society.
The necklace was assembled by Nepali refugees through Hope Rise, a Nashville, TN based charity assisting refugees integrating into Nashville. Every medallion sold affords them more income, dignity and options.
You can wear it on your neck, carry it in your pocket, pay it forward or hang it from your rearview mirror. Go wild with it. 
We’ve put together some killer packages that aren’t just for you to read the book and open your head to the possibilities, but for you to share it with others – the true message of Wisdom meets Passion.  Join us on our journey.  
Official Book Release of Wisdom Meets Passion: August 28rd, 2012.

"Too often we think success means only making money.  But financial abundance in the absence of wisdom and passion will be meaningless." - Darren Hardy, Publisher SUCCESS Magazine, New York Times bestselling author The Compound Effect
“This book will inspire you to live with more authenticity.  Buckle up and get ready to release your own unique wisdom and passion. You might be surprised by what you end up doing.”- Bob Goff, Jesus Leaker and author of Love Does
“It's not just about wisdom and passion—this inspiring book redefines security for multiple generations, offering clear steps, surprising examples, and hope. This book will change the world!”  - Chris Guillebeau, Author, The $100 Startup
“When you combine Dan’s old-school wisdom with Jared’s cutting-edge passion, you get a solid, comprehensive plan for attacking your life and career goals!”  - Dave Ramsey, New York Times best-selling author and nationally syndicated radio show host
 “None of us wants to live a mediocre life.  In this book Dan and Jared shine light on the exciting process of blending wisdom and passion for a Born to Win life.  If you are ready to really live the life you were born to have, then this book is a must for you!”  - Tom  Ziglar, CEO of Ziglar Inc.

story:
Cine "El Ñuro"

Cine "El Ñuro" es un cine comunitario al aire libre que se creó en Noviembre de 2013 en la caleta de pescadores de El Ñuro (Piura, Perú) gracias al apoyo de empresas y de La Combi-arte rodante, una asociación cultural peruana que trabaja para la implementación de cines al aire libre en pueblos y comunidades del país.
El cine está gestionado por Miguel, Victoria y un grupo de jóvenes que fueron capacitados por La Combi para organizar proyecciones de cine en el patio del colegio y en el parque de esta localidad pesquera de forma periódica con los equipos de cine que una empresa les proporcionaba en calidad de préstamo.
El apoyo de la empresa se ha terminado pero los jóvenes están buscando apoyo para seguir proyectando cine en su comunidad. Lo que necesitan son los equipos básicos de un cine al aire libre: 1 pantalla, 1 proyector, 2 parlantes, 1 amplificador-mezcladora y 1 megáfono.

Desde que se inició el proyecto el pasado año se han organizado funciones de cine todos los meses. Niños, niñas, jóvenes y adultos se acercaban a ver las películas y dusfrutar de la magia del cine en su propia comunidad. Miguel y Victoria, los coordinadores locales, están buscando la manera de seguir organizando cine en su pueblo, que apenas cuenta con espacios para la cultura y el entretenimiento.

El Cine "El Ñuro" forma parte de la red de cines al aire libre de La Combi-arte rodante, una asociación peruana que busca crear espacios culturales nuevos en las diferentes poblaciones del país a través del cine y del audiovisual. Los cines de la Red son todos de ingreso libre y gestionados por la misma población. Las películas que se proyectan cuentan con los permisos y derechos de exhibición gracias al apoyo de distribuidoras, productoras, Embajadas e instituciones culturales.


Los coordinadores del cine

El grupo de jóvenes locales encargados del cine son: Juan Miguel Paiva, Victoria Ruiz, Pedro Arismendis, Guillermo Paiva, Maria del Carmen Ruiz, Juan Miguel Pingo, Juan Carlos Maza y Ericka Estrada.

Ellos tienen entre 17 y 24 años y pertenecen a la caleta de El Ñuro, una pequeña localidad del norte del Perú donde viven alrededor de 3,000 personas. La mayoría de la población se dedica a la pesca artesanal y únicamente tienen estudios de primaria. Nunca antes hubo un cine en esta comunidad y para la mayoría de la población era la primera vez que veían una película en pantalla grande.


Lo que necesitamos

Para poder continuar con el proyecto, los jóvenes de El Ñuro necesitan los equipos para la organización de las proyecciones:
  • 1 Pantalla Inflable de 7 metros: 1,800 US$
  • 1 Proyector multimedia: 1,000 US$
  • Equipo de sonido (Parlantes, mezcladora y amplificador): 1,500 US$
  • Cables, conectores y caja de herramientas: 200 US$
  • Transporte de los equipos hasta El Ñuro: 400 US$
  • Taller de capacitación para los jóvenes y visitas de coordinación: 1,000 US$

Lo que obtienes

Apoyando esta campaña podrás:
  • Formar parte de la RED de cines comunitarios de La Combi-arte rodante como colaborador especial en nuestra página web.
  • Obtener un vídeo de los avances del Cine comunitario de El Ñuro o un polo del proyecto.
  • Adquirir un calendario del 2015 con fotografías de las tortugas marinas que habitan en la costa de este pueblo pesquero y con fotos del proyecto.
  • Además, tenemos una recompensa exclusiva que consiste en un viaje de fin de semana para 01 persona desde Lima a El Ñuro donde podrás asistir a una función especial del cine comunitario y nadar con las tortugas marinas.

El impacto del proyecto

Con esta campaña queremos conseguir que este grupo de jóvenes puedan seguir gestionando su propio cine comunitario, convirtiéndose en gestores y transmisores de la cultura y beneficiando a toda la población de esta caleta de pescadores que nunca antes había tenido cine.

El cine se ha convertido en un nuevo espacio para la cultura y el entretenimiento entre los vecinos. En cada función de cine asisten una media de 300 espectadores que tienen la oportunidad de ver películas con contenidos educativos, culturales y entretenidos.

Tu apoyo a esta campaña hará posible que los niños, niñas, jóvenes y adultos de El Ñuro tengan la posibilidad de continuar teniendo un cine para ver películas en pantalla grande y conjuntamente en una población que vive aislada de las nuevas tecnologíaas y del acceso al arte y la cultura.

Riesgos y desafíos

Uno de nuestros desafíos es conseguir la sostenibilidad del proyecto. Los jóvenes no siempre serán jóvenes y en algún momento dejarán de tener el tiempo disponible para gestionar el cine comunitario. Para ello, buscamos siempre el efecto multitplicador del proyecto a través de la constante capacitación de los jóvenes que, a su vez, enseñan a las futuras generaciones.

Por otro lado uno de los riesgos del proyecto es el mantenimiento y la vida de los equipos. Constantemente el equipo gestor del cine se encargará del mantenimiento de los equipos y en el caso de tener algún desperfecto, se buscarán alternativas locales para cubrir los costos, como por ejemplo la venta de canchita (pop corn) o bebidas durante las funciones.

Cómo colaborar

Si quieres colaborar en esta campaña puedes hacerlo a través de nuestras recompensas o también ayudándonos a difundir el proyecto entre tus redes sociales, de amigos, del trabajo, etc. Toda la ayuda será beneficiosa para poder conseguir los equipos que Juan, Victoria y el resto de chicos de El Ñuro necesitan para seguir llevando la magia del cine a su pueblo.

story:
Refund

It's been almost three years since the campaign closed on this and every step since then has been past the deadline and barely finished. The idea had seemed exciting and very possible but after a while, especially as I stopped playing music, it felt like a vanity project and one that I wasn't particularly good at.

Rather than extending the deadline over and over, only to end up with something that didn't have any motivation behind it, I decided to leave it where it's at and refund everyone. I wanted to make this decision only a little while after the campaign even completed but stuck with it and felt less confident with every step in the process. Thank you to everyone who pledged and supported - I'm sorry that it took this long only to fall short.

Emails will go out over the next few weeks to people who pledged, you can also email ofstarrefund@gmail.com from the email you contributed with and provide paypal, venmo or squarecash info to receive a refund.

- Thank you to everyone again

story:
Welcome all Life Lovers!

Since December 2013, I have been investing a great deal of time, energy, and emotion into my life’s passion .... writing.  I am very proud to announce that I have completed the first draft of Cuban Kisses and am now working on the edit for the manuscript. 

Cuban Kisses is my true life story of a Caribbean vacation turned into a lustful and amorous affair with a beautiful Cuban man.  Our love affair then developed into a relationship, riddled with the difficulties of distant love and stereotype … But can love conquer all?

For a glimpse of my writing style, visit angelinachic.com, where I have released the first three chapters of the book for public viewing.  My goal is to raise the funds necessary to publish my first of what I hope will be many books, as well as cover the costs incurred for everything associated with developing Angelina Chic as an Author, Personality and Brand.

 

"A true story, set in Lovers' Paradise, The Caribbean"

How the $5,000 will be allocated

With the branding of Angelina Chic complete and the new website now up and running, my team and I are focusing our efforts on finding the right Developmental Editor to take Cuban Kisses to the next level and prepare it for publishing.  Please refer to the pie graph below for the costs breakdown.

               

    


Perks! Perks! Perks!

To thank you for your contributions, my team and I will be providing all types of chic, yet practical swag, branded with the Angelina Chic logo!  Wear it, use it, gift it, share it – I encourage you to show it off!  Don’t forget to leave us your email so that when the book is published all contributors will receive their free copy!

**A note for the gentleman out there – Don’t be discouraged by the lady-like Swag Perks, I guarantee they will make great gifts for any and all special ladies in your life!**

 

The Local Impact

As a London woman, born and raised, it is important to me to give back to MY Community.  To show my gratitude, I have chosen to work exclusively with local London businesses and entrepreneurs, many of whom are my personal friends.  By supporting Angelina Chic, you are also supporting local talent who have supported me every step of the way on the road to realizing my dreams:

  • Natalie Mittler, Campaign Manager
  • Melissa Rae Stewart, PR Agent / Publicist
  • Damian Box, Creative Design Consultant
  • Professional Photography by Red Button Photography

Other Ways You Can Help

If your budget will not allow for you to be a financial contributor, that's no trouble at all!  The fact that you're still reading tells me that you too can Become A Life Lover!  If you have the time, I encourage you to:

  • Check out the first three chapters of the manuscript!  Available on my new website angelinachic.com
  • To help spread the word, make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools located beneath the video to share my campaign!
  • Like me on Facebook and follow me on Twitter!
  • Finally and most importantly, please share my story with your friends and family!  The more people that go to the website to read, the better chance I have of gaining the interest of publishing companies and possibly local radio/television shows which will allow me to gain exposure as an Author and Personality!

are focusing our efforts on finding the right Developmental Editor to take
Cuban Kisses to the next level and prepare it for publishing.  Please refer to the pie graph below
for the costs breakdown.                   
Perks! Perks! Perks!
To thank you for your
contributions, my team and I will be providing all types of chic, yet practical swag, branded with the Angelina Chic logo!  Wear it, use it, gift it, share it
– I encourage you to show it off!  Don’t forget to leave us your email so
that when the book is published all contributors will receive their free copy!
**A note
for the gentleman out there – Don’t be discouraged by the lady-like Swag Perks, I guarantee they will make great gifts
for any and all special ladies in your life!**
 
The Local Impact
As a London woman, born and
raised, it is important to me to give back to MY Community.  To show my
gratitude, I have chosen to work exclusively with local London businesses and
entrepreneurs, many of whom are my personal friends.  By supporting Angelina Chic, you are also supporting local talent who have supported me every step of the way on the road to realizing my dreams:


Natalie Mittler, Campaign Manager

Melissa Rae
     Stewart, PR
     Agent / Publicist

Damian Box, Creative Design Consultant
Professional Photography
     by Red Button
     Photography



Other Ways You Can Help
If your budget will not allow for you to be a
financial contributor, that's no trouble at all!  The fact that you're
still reading tells me that you too can Become A Life Lover!  If you have the
time, I encourage you to:

Check out the first three chapters of the manuscript!  Available on my new website angelinachic.com

To help spread the word, make sure to use the Indiegogo share tools located beneath the video to share my campaign!

Like me on Facebook and
     follow me on Twitter!
Finally and most
     importantly, please share my story with your friends and family!  The
     more people that go to the website to read, the better chance I have of
     gaining the interest of publishing companies and possibly local
     radio/television shows which will allow me to gain exposure as an Author and Personality!

story:
Summary

  • The proposed publication comprises more than 180 black-and-white photographs of 27 SIT and HDB estates and precincts that have disappeared from our country.

          

Princess Estate, Blk 39 Forfar House. 2000

  • The film negatives, taken over a period of 25 years, will have to be digitized in high-resolution for print.
  • Albert and Rochore House, Alexandra Estate, Boon Tiong/Tiong Bahru Road, Cantonment Road Estate, Covent Garden Estate, Duchess Estate (Queenstown), East Coast Road, Ellenborough Market/Tew Chew Street, Geylang Serai, Hillview Estate, Kallang Airport Estate, Kampong Silat Estate, Kim Pong Road, Kim Tian Road, Neo Tiew Estate, Outram Hill, Outram Park, Owen Road (Norfolk/Tasek Utara Estate), Pickering Street Estate, Princess Elizabeth Park, Princess Estate (Queenstown), Punggol Road/Buangkok South Farmway 1, Seletar Estate, Seletar West Farmway 6, Stamford Estate, Taman Jurong, Winstedt Court. 
  • Each estate is accompanied by a brief writeup of its history as well as chapter dividers made up of collected postcards, HDB eviction notices, vintage maps and other memorabilia. These are all related to each estate. 
  • Every dollar you contribute is important to the book. We are trying to get the best local designers to depict these architectural scenes in the most aesthetically pleasing way. Early layout pages by Do Not Design: 

What We Need & What You Get

Cost Breakdown: 

  • Design = $SGD 5000 
  • Printing = $SGD 10000 
  • Misc (Shipping/materials) = $SGD 300

​

  • All funds will be directed solely to the creation of this publication and into your hands. 
  • As perks, we will be printing 5R and 8R Silver Gelatin Prints on Ilford Baryta Fibre-based paper. 

Some may call this junk...

  • Though the book is not intended to be an exhaustive pictorial record of the subject, it aims to fill a gap in Singapore’s visual and architectural heritage, specifically in the documentation of vanished public housing estates that have fallen since the mid 1990s. 

  • Some of these estates reveal a particular housing typology like the 3 or 4-storey walk up flat, the 7 or 9-storey high-rise flat and later the (singular) 14-storey Forfar House in Queenstown. Other estates reveal the staid formalism of HDB’s first blocks with common corridors. Though these buildings have a distinct architectural style or visual identity that belong to the past now, the photographs are still a vital window into the receding particulars of a time and place in Singapore.

  • Do help us spread the word! We are not architects or doyens but this small effort represents a salute to our heritage and a paean to home.

Taman Jurong. 1996

Neo Tiew Estate. 1999

Blk 30 Kim Pong Road. 2000

Duchess Estate, Blk 54 Stirling Road. 1994

Kim Pong Road, 彩英电发 Beauty Parlour. 2000

But we call them treasures... 

Straits Times "Home in Focus" feature (240417)

A note about Perks: 

The hand-printed images you'll be receiving as perks are shown in the contact sheets below. There will be a small uniform white border applied to each photograph.

Please support our labour of love!        

 Sample of 8R prints mounted on IKEA RIBBA frame (not included in perks)

story:
Our Story

My name is Otis G. Sanders, I'm a professional photographer, I'm here on IndieGoGo to raise funds to finish my book project entitled: "Always & ForEver, Love" subtitled: "Success Stories of Marriages 20 + Years Strong"

This book project is a celebration of the institution of  traditional marriage. With approx. 50% of all marriages in America ending in divorce there is a desperate need to bring to light the other 50% of marriages that survive where the couples are happy and in love after 20 years or more of marriage. 


"Always&ForEver, Love"  will consist of approx. 50 married couples of different Ethnic groups that have been married not less than 20 years. Different Ethnic groups will be used to demonstrate that there is no difference between the races when it comes to the institution of marriage.  What makes a marriage work for an African American couple is the same for an  Anglo, Hispanic, Bi-racial, or Asian couple.   The selected couples will be interviewed and photographed, each couple will have 2 pages in the book, one page will be highlights of what they have done and continue to do to make their marriage work, and the opposite page will be a full page photograph of the couple.


The Impact

This book, "Always & ForEver, Love" can be used as a reference book for couples that are looking to get married, have a better marriage, already married and want their marriage to last through the good and bad times.  Reading the stories of successful marriages from 20 years to 73 years are examples of what is possible and most couples reading these couples stories will find similarities that are not unlike their own circumstances, thereby giving them them fortitude to forge ahead to build a long standing, successful, happy, marriage til death due they part.


If this campaign falls short of desired funding this book project will still happen as I have used personal funds for all travel, hotels, meals, promotions, and transportation to photograph and interview the couples.  The publication date will be changed as it will take a while long to raise the required funds for printing.




What We Need & What You Get

To complete this project I need to raise $5,000.00 in contributions.  This $5,000.00 will be used along with approx. $3,000.00 (approx. 130 books) I've already raised by selling pre-published copies of the book on my website: http://alwaysandforeverlove.org. to help with printing of the book.  I'm continuing my efforts to raise additional funds for printing.  That effort will continue up to the day this book goes to the printers.  In the unlikely event that I don't raise all the funds needed here on IndieGoGo I will continue my efforts to raise money on my own and use personal resources as they become available.


Below are the ways in which contributors will be repaid and thanked for their generous contributions:


Contribute $1 dollar or more -- contributors will receive a personal Thank You on my blog

Contribute $5 dollars or more -- contributors will receive a post-card mailed to them with the book cover image on the front and promotional message on the back.

Contribute $10 dollars or more -- contributors will receive 1--8x12 photograph of the book cover suitable for framing

Contribute $25.00 dollars or more -- contributors will receive 1---book, fresh off the press, signed 

Contribute $50.00 dollars or more -- contributors will receive 1-- book, signed, numbered, and embossed

Contribute $100.00 dollars or more -- contributors will receive 2--books, signed, numbered, and embossed

Contribute $200.00 dollars or more -- contributors will receive 4--books, signed, numbered, and embossed

Contribute $400.00 dollars or more -- contributors will receive 6-- books, signed, numbered, and embossed, a personal thank you on my blog 

Contribute $500.00 or more -- contributors will receive 10 -- books, signed, numbered, embossed and mailed to 10 people you select.  Contributor will also be listed by name on my website: http://alwaysandforeverlove.org


Other Ways You Can Help

This project has been three years in the making, the completion is near! Please forward this information to anyone you think that might gain from it's completion, or anyone that might want to make a contribution to help make it a reality! 


Please visit my website for the book for additional information regarding the book @ http://alwaysandforevrlove.org

I update my internet community monthly via my blog @ http://seventhson.org/blog (category: always&Forever, love) highlight couples from the book with a sampling of information

for each.  Please visit my facebook, linkedIn, and twitter accounts also

story:
My Story (Pull of An Oar)

The basic idea is about a man who has allowed life to stop... Years have become monotony and he doesn't really care. Fate though, has a way of setting things straight, allowing eyes to be opened, egos to be bruised and wrongs to be righted. I think it's a funny, exciting, true, tragic, redemptive story of a man and a long overdue journey.


My Story (About the Author)

My name is Myles Carter and I am a writer. I do this as a hobby right now because I'm new, I've no experience and I can't eat paper. I need to make a living so I work throughout the day and try to produce 600-1000 words at night in order to keep writing, keep improving and keep attempting to get my work out there.

The idea was that I'd work hard on a book, to send it to a publisher. Once they read it, see if it's the kind of thing that they want to sell to the masses, they may buy it. If they buy it, I would get a cheque and some royalties per book sold. This would be a process that could take years and lots of wasted money and time trying to get agents and editors and publishers to like something that I like, and that I want the world to have a chance to look at. I'd get a small percentage of the books sales and people who buy it would pay too much for an item I just want to put food in my stomach and a roof over my head.

Over the last 2 months though, I've begun to think about the age we live in and the effect that being so connected with other people in an digital world can mean. An idea, while not new, came to me from many different channels. It was the idea that I have a product, and a medium to get that out there. It's called the internet and my words can make their way to others pretty easy. I'll pitch it to the world, see if they like a taste and if they do, they'll get to be part of publishing a book.


After it's finished, end of May, I'm going to podcast chapter by chapter, to allow people a taste of the book. Something they can listen to on the way to work, something they can appreciate. That'll be free, that's my gift to the world and anyone who cares. Then I'll sell the book online, and in print (through the internet) for a price that allows people to read it and take it in. Nothing that will break the bank and no specially costs to sell it to Americans or Canadians or Europeans, one flat price for everyone.


So, I'm going to work in this way, if enough people who like to read want to support me, I'll give them something to read. It'll be shorter, somewhere around 200 - 250 pages, the kind of thing you'd be able to get immersed in on a flight, finish on the beach after two days, or sit down on a rainy morning and finish before bed if all you want to do is read and drink tea.

 

What I Need & What You Get

$7500.00 - It's an arbitrary number, but what it really amounts to is giving me the ability to live, pay rent, operate my lights, get any supplies, buy an ISBN number so I can walk up to apple or amazon and have my book published through their shops. It'll allow me to buy a printer and print the book as is needed. It'll give me levity to bind copies for donors or for bookshops. It'll make sure I can devote days, not hours to a work of love. It'll mean that I scrimp and save, the same as I do now, but provide a product... a piece of art, if you may, to the world.


The perks for donations are always worth greater than their value in donation... at least I believe so. If they aren't, contact me I'd be happy to arrange something. However, each donation level will receive their items services plus those of all levels below (paperbacks are limited to the numer listed on your level).


$ 1.00 - Random fact (or two)

$ 5.00 - E-Copy of the book (Kindle/iBooks) + personally drawn thank you note

$ 10.00 - Shout out on podcast

$ 25.00 - Bound chapter (your choice) signed

$ 50.00 - Copy of book (hardcover), signed

$ 100.00 - Personalized limited edition hard cover-copy of the book, signed

$ 250.00 - Acknowledgement in book, advanced bound chapter of next book

$ 500.00 - Sponsor message on podcast, personal cover art poster, advanced copy of future works


Other Ways You Can Help

Let people know about this project. Tell them to check out our indiegogo page, facebook page, twitter, e-mail,  courier pigeon, whatever... just get people to know that I have a story to tell, I want to write it for me and for them and no one else.

$ 500.00 - Sponsor message on podcast, personal cover art poster, advanced copy of future works



Other Ways You Can Help
Let people know about this project. Tell them to check out our indiegogo page, facebook page, twitter, e-mail,  courier pigeon, whatever... just get people to know that I have a story to tell, I want to write it for me and for them and no one else.

story:
Hello!

My name is Matt. I am a writer — or at least I'm in the early stages of becoming one. I've just recently completed my undergraduate studies at Ithaca College in upstate New York, and now is theoretically the time when I should be joining the 9-to-5 grind. But here's the thing: I'm not quite ready to be pinned down in some newspaper office just yet. There's still some dreams I want to accomplish — and that's where you can help.

For a while now, I've developed two aspirations: to travel and to pursue a serious career in writing. 

Over the past four years my mother has somehow funded most of my education at a private college while also paying for her own master's degree that she wanted to pursue. I'm proud that we're both going to be getting our degrees this winter — and I wouldn't be where I am now without her incredible generosity — but in the meantime my dream of studying abroad had to be put on the back burner. 

Now that I'm done with undergrad, I'd like to go on to pursue an MFA degree in creative writing. But America's best MFA programs are super-competitive (an average of 5-8 accepted students out of 1,000 per school!) and I'd like to accrue some more real-world experience to breathe life into my writing samples. I'm using the next year or two to fully commit myself to developing and improving my writing style so that I can put my best foot forward when it's time to apply to these schools.

So, what would be the best way to combine these two dreams of mine into a tangible, real-life experience? Enter...

The Road Trip

This coming spring, I want to load up my old Ford Focus and set off to discover what the rest of America has to offer. Over the course of a month, I'd like to travel from my home in upstate New York down south through the Bible Belt, the Heartland, and the American southwest until I reach California. Then after a brief stay in the Golden State, I will be heading back for the East Coast through the northern United States.

Along the way, my goal is to meet Americans of all kinds, whether it be in diners and truck stops or square dances and bingo nights. I tend to be a little shy and closed off when I meet people for the first time; this trip is intended to help me get over that shyness. There are millions of interesting stories lying just beneath the surface of this great and expansive country, and I'd like to discover at least some of them for myself.

At the same time, this trip would also serve as a means of self-discovery. From a young age, I've an itching to leave my small unassuming country town and find bigger and better things elsewhere. But I still haven't identified why I have that desire, and whether there truly is something greater on the other side. If this cross-country trip becomes a reality, I will be keeping extensive notes and journal entries that I hope will blossom into a full-length memoir filled with both my experiences on the road and the thoughts running through my head.

And so, this journey would be much more than a joyride across America to shirk adult responsibilities. It's a chance for me to throw myself into new situations and find out more about my own inner desires. And it's also a serious writing project.

Why I Need Your Help

It's fairly simple: By graduating a semester early, I've given myself six months of freedom before student loans kick in (woo-hoo!). Unfortunately, I'm still a broke (now former) college kid. In order to make this trip possible, I need your generous help paying for the following things:

  • Some maintenance tune-ups for my car before I leave (remember, she's old) 
  • Gas
  • A couple nights in motels (when I can no longer stand sleeping in the car)
  • Food

Any donation — even just a couple bucks — would be a substantial boost. There's only so much money I can raise working low-wage jobs in Ithaca. 

What You Get In Return

My eternal gratitude, for starters. But that's a given. If you look on the right, you'll see a number of perks that I'm promising based on how much you decide is worth donating to this project. Keep in mind that I'm a pretty funky dancer (with a proper beat) and that I'm a decent singer (with the proper GarageBand effects). 

And if you can't donate...

That's plenty okay! If you take the time to spread this page through Facebook or Twitter or word-of-mouth I would be just as appreciative :)

Thank you so much in advance. You are all wonderful and beautiful people for even taking the time to read this.

Peace and love,

Matt.

I'm proud that we're both going to be getting our degrees this winter — and I wouldn't be where I am now without her incredible generosity — but in the meantime my dream of studying abroad had to be put on the back burner. Now that I'm done with undergrad, I'd like to go on to pursue an MFA degree in creative writing. But America's best MFA programs are super-competitive (an average of 5-8 accepted students out of 1,000 per school!) and I'd like to accrue some more real-world experience to breathe life into my writing samples. I'm using the next year or two to fully commit myself to developing and improving my writing style so that I can put my best foot forward when it's time to apply to these schools.So, what would be the best way to combine these two dreams of mine into a tangible, real-life experience? Enter...The Road TripThis coming spring, I want to load up my old Ford Focus and set off to discover what the rest of America has to offer. Over the course of a month, I'd like to travel from my home in upstate New York down south through the Bible Belt, the Heartland, and the American southwest until I reach California. Then after a brief stay in the Golden State, I will be heading back for the East Coast through the northern United States.Along the way, my goal is to meet Americans of all kinds, whether it be in diners and truck stops or square dances and bingo nights. I tend to be a little shy and closed off when I meet people for the first time; this trip is intended to help me get over that shyness. There are millions of interesting stories lying just beneath the surface of this great and expansive country, and I'd like to discover at least some of them for myself.At the same time, this trip would also serve as a means of self-discovery. From a young age, I've an itching to leave my small unassuming country town and find bigger and better things elsewhere. But I still haven't identified why I have that desire, and whether there truly is something greater on the other side. If this cross-country trip becomes a reality, I will be keeping extensive notes and journal entries that I hope will blossom into a full-length memoir filled with both my experiences on the road and the thoughts running through my head.And so, this journey would be much more than a joyride across America to shirk adult responsibilities. It's a chance for me to throw myself into new situations and find out more about my own inner desires. And it's also a serious writing project.Why I Need Your HelpIt's fairly simple: By graduating a semester early, I've given myself six months of freedom before student loans kick in (woo-hoo!). Unfortunately, I'm still a broke (now former) college kid. In order to make this trip possible, I need your generous help paying for the following things:
Some maintenance tune-ups for my car before I leave (remember, she's old) 
Gas
A couple nights in motels (when I can no longer stand sleeping in the car)
Food
Any donation — even just a couple bucks — would be a substantial boost. There's only so much money I can raise working low-wage jobs in Ithaca. What You Get In ReturnMy eternal gratitude, for starters. But that's a given. If you look on the right, you'll see a number of perks that I'm promising based on how much you decide is worth donating to this project. Keep in mind that I'm a pretty funky dancer (with a proper beat) and that I'm a decent singer (with the proper GarageBand effects). And if you can't donate...That's plenty okay! If you take the time to spread this page through Facebook or Twitter or word-of-mouth I would be just as appreciative :)Thank you so much in advance. You are all wonderful and beautiful people for even taking the time to read this.Peace and love,Matt.

story:
From the subarctic tundra of northern Labrador, to the scorching heat and searing sun of Bisbee, Arizona, men and women toil every day to extract minerals and drill for oil and harness the power of water and wind, undeterred by the elements.  Copper and gold and iron mines.  Offshore and tar sand and hydraulic fractured oil production.  Hydroelectric plants, mountaintop weather stations and space shuttle operations.  Laborers with strong hands and stronger backs rake blueberries and pick oranges and shake pecans.  All of these jobs come with an inherent amount of risk and danger.  And they're all done by humans.  No matter the advances in technology, a person has to drive the truck or change the fitting or de-ice the equiment.  And humans get hurt.  They get sick.  Som of them have babies and some of the have heart attacks.

So no matter the distance, the darkness, the cold or the terrain, industry's hardest workers sometimes need help.  And there is a cadre of clinicians and first responders who provide that care.  They are often hampered by isolation and weather and limited equipment.  Sometimes, they are simply overwhelmed by volume as the population of a town explodes or a project gets expanded.

I want to find out how it's done.  What works and what doesn't?  Who are the people that choose to practice in such extreme environments and what are their stories?  What is it like from the patient's perspective?

Often, half the challenge is in getting there, or conversely, getting out.  So, to understand it, I'm hitting the road.  A 12,000+ mile roadtrip from Maine to northern Labrador and Quebec, back down to the midwestern US, west to Washington, south to California, east to Texas and northeast to West Virginia.  Alone.

I'll be visiting an arctic hydroelectric plant under construction, a 1970s era self contained and enclosed iron mining town in Quebec, the booming population around "fracking" in the Dakotas, loggers in the Northwest, gold miners returning to California, and itinerant agriculture workers along the Mexican and Canadian borders.  In New Mexico, I'll visit the vestiges of the space race and learn about the highest altitude medicine there is, then a 4-hour drive later, plunge half a mile into the earth at a subterranean geological repository for nuclear waste.  I'll visit an offshore oil rig and a tanker in the gulf of Mexico and find out what the aftermath of the coal mine disaster in West Virginia has meant to primary care providers there.  I'll island hop along the coast of Maine and find out how practitioners there survive both the isolation of winter and the overcrowding of summer.

I'll be driving, camping and writing a series of articles, alone.  All I need is gas in the tank, food in my belly and time.  Time to hear the stories these folks want to tell.  Your donation will go directly to those things.  And studded snow tires.

In return, you can travel with me through my blog and webcam, the "shotgun cam" mounted in the front passenger seat.  For anyone contributing $1,000 or more, I'll hand-pick some carved or woven artwork from each of the Native American or First Nation (Canada) communities I visit and send them to you.  If you contribute $100 or more, you'll get advertising space on my blog and on the "shotgun cam."

The risks of the trip are cold and snow, bear and moose, coyotes and mountain lions, mechanical failures, auto accidents and that most unpredictable of species, humans.  But I'll be as prepared as I always am on these adventures.  This will represent my 12th and 13th trip across the continent, alone.  I've seen all 50 states and every province in Canada, and this trip will allow for a deeper understanding of how these communities, and our nations entirely, are affected by and dependent on the resources found in, on or under our land.  All through the lense of people at their most vulnerable and scared, when they're sick and injured or caring for those who are.

If you can contribute, thank you.  If you can't contribute, please spread the word to those who might.  Every dollar puts more gas in the tank.  And regardless, share your thoughts through my blog.  It'll be a welcome bit of humanity along those 12,000 miles.  Thank you.

Robin Behl

story:
Through this effort, I will demonstrate that there is a market for a reasonable, enlightened, rational, and scientifically-informed approach to political news programming.

Additional Reading:


It's Even Worse Than It Looks: How the American Constitutional System Collided With the New Politics of Extremism
by Thomas E. Mann and Norman J. Ornstein

Thinking, Fast and Slow, by Daniel Kahneman

Expert Political Judgment: How Good Is It? How Can We Know?, 
by Philip E. Tetlock

Let's keep in touch.

Please subscribe to the Beasts & Lunatics Mailing List: The Herdentier.

* indicates required

story:
About the author and book:

Mariam Al-Kalby, storybook writer, poet, blogger, wife, and mother of two girls (ages 3 and 1) has teamed up with Prolance, a full service book publishing organization serving the local community, to bring you a first of its kind children's book series called "The Prophet Says."


This series will be a collection of books dedicated to bringing to life, in an imaginative yet basic way, several different Hadiths (Prophetic sayings and traditions) so that children of all ages can learn from them.


The first one will be named "The Apple Tree," which tells the story of Little Shaima, a young girl who learns the virtues of planting a fruit tree with her dad. When this fruit tree starts to bear fruit, Little Shaima learns the valuable lesson of generosity and giving charity. The story is based on the Hadith:


"When a Muslim plants a tree, whatever is eaten from it is charity from him and whatever is stolen is charity and whatever is subtracted from it is charity" (Sahih Muslim).


The author, resident of Southern California, hopes that this story and the series as a whole will teach Muslim as well as non-Muslim children not only the different Hadiths that exist, but also the numerous life lessons that come from learning them.

She also hopes this series will contribute in adding more fictional books into the market of Islamic literature.

Take a look at these articles expressing the lack of Islamic fictional books:

Article 1

Article 2

Your funds will help achieve:

Mariam is striving to make this project one with a strong sense of quality! She wants to go above and beyond when it comes to the publishing of this book because she feels there is a lack of quality when it comes to Islamic books. That is why she is hoping to collect enough funds to choose state-of-the-art services to produce these books.

Your contribution will help in more ways than one! Funds collected here will go towards three areas:
    •    Hiring very talented and experienced illustrators.
    •    Printing the books at a high-end printer in hardcover.
    •    Distributing the books online and at bookstores worldwide.

Message from the author:

It is important for people to donate to publishing Islamic children’s books like these for many, many reasons. Here are a few:

  • You're helping the Muslim Ummah which will result in you getting Hasanat (reward) for doing so. It can be looked at as a type of charity.
  • You will also be building and creating role models for our children.
  • It will create an Islamic identity for children and youth.
  • You are also supporting Muslims writing their own stories instead of other people writing for us.
  • Books like these will educate our Ummah by building a better understanding of Islam for muslims as well as non-Muslims alike...promoting Dawah and an interfaith initiative of understanding and knowledge.
  • You will also be helping women grow in their careers.
  • You will be supporting a project that celebrates diversity and various cultures under the same umbrella of Islam.
  • Creating more diverse and unique books with a high sense of quality.
  • Sharing Islamic knowledge to correct misconceptions and stereotypes.
  • Promoting Islamic values and ideals that are universal.
  • Bringing more fiction books into the realm of Islamic literature, where there is a big void.


Other ways you can help:
    •    Get the word out - spread to your email lists, facebook friends, etc.

THANK YOU,
Author- Mariam Al-Kalby
Publisher - Angie El Sherif

story:
What is Miracle e-zine?

 

Miracle e-zine is an online literary and artistic magazine featuring writers from various countries, walks of life and levels of writing experience, all united by a love for creative writing.  Founded in June 2012, we have published five issues thus far and we are currently working on our sixth issue.

 

Anyone can submit writing or art to Miracle e-zine as it is a publication that welcomes both emerging and established writers.  In this way, the magazine helps young or reluctant writers gain experience and share their writing with others.  It is difficult to be published and this magazine is a great first step.  This publication is about writing for pleasure as much as showcasing quality writing.  Hundreds of stories, ideas and thoughts from a diversity of individuals combine to form Miracle e-zine.  Whether you are an amateur or a professional, as long as you are a writer, your talent is welcome here.

 

Miracle e-zine features an abundance of genres; poetry, short stories, prose, non-fiction, book reviews, film reviews, interviews, photography, visual art and articles.  It is international and bimonthly, with each issue focused on a different theme, like inspiration.  A different author is featured every month, as well as a different writing website.  We also welcome advertisers.

 

Each issue also includes fun writing tasks for readers to complete.  If you send in your response to the task you could win prizes and a special feature in the next issue of Miracle e-zine.  Miracle e-zine also features a writing workshop, help column and theme column.  

 

The writing workshop offers ideas to improve one’s writing.  In Issue 5 of Miracle e-zine, the writing workshop column featured Marie Lightman, who offered interesting writing prompts for those with writer’s block.

 

Our help column is written by Troy Cabadia and gives writers helpful tips and information about aspects of the writing world.  In Issue 5, Cabadia explored the world of digital publishing and the pros and cons of E-books, making this aspect of literature more straightforward and less intimidating to readers.

 

Finally, the theme column is written by R.G. Summers and consists of an article based on the theme of the issue, often in the form of a short story.  In Issue 5, she wrote a short story about Inspiration, which provided the lesson that even the smallest, most fleeting thoughts can be inspiration for creative writing.

 

Mission

 

Our main goal is to publish new and young writers or introverted writers that are hesitant to share their work.  We aim to feature a variety of writers from all around the world, publishing both quality literary work and new, young and emerging writers.  Miracle e-zine collects intelligent, creative writing from writers with varying levels of skill and experience.

 

Miracle's main aim is to bring all forms of art under one roof for which it is on and off working on many projects, for example, the Young People Project, whose aim is to bring creative young people from around the world together to create something different.

 

Contributors

 

Our editor is Guntaj Arora.  We feature different writers each issue.  So far we have featured Jane Struthers, Anne Caldwell, Ann Wilson, Cath Drake, Wes Brown, Harry Giles, Leeroah Hursky, Kayo Chingonyi and Akash KJ.

 

Each issue contains writing from around fifty different writers.  We have a wide variety of contributors from many different countries and walks of life.  Whether you write only as a hobby and you have never shown your writing to anyone, or you have been published hundreds of times, Miracle e-zine welcomes your talents. We look for all types of writing and art works.

 

Miracle Bond

 

Miracle Bond is an online, interactive community of emerging writers dedicated to improving their writing, associated with Miracle e-zine.  It is completely free to join and since it is an online group it is open to writers from all countries.  

 

The group participates in various activities and interactive sessions in which they discuss and share their work.  Miracle Bond is tailored to writers who want inspiration, advice or feedback on their work.  Every week there are new activities and writers post their work so that the other group members can provide suggestions and constructive criticism.  

 

To join you must fill out an online registration form on the Miracle e-zine website and the group will consider you for membership.  Members are selected based on their desire to develop and improve their writing.

 

How will we use the funding?

 

Our Kickstarter funding will be used to fund the first print edition of Miracle e-zine.  We are a digital magazine and we would like expand our readership by creating print issues as well as digital issues.  Our print edition will come out in August and it will be sold online and at many bookstores around the world. Also, this funding will be used for the Young People Project. Miracle's main goal has always been to promote young people, and these funds will be used in bringing about many creative activities throughout the year!

 

Submissions

 

We are always looking for submissions for our upcoming issues.  If you would like to submit some poetry, short fiction, non-fiction, flash fiction, book reviews, blog posts or art work, feel free to submit your work to Miracle e-zine through our website (http://miracleezine.wix.com/miracle-e-zine) or our email address:miracle.ezine@yahoo.com and make sure that you include a short biography in the third person.  Our editors will try to respond to your submissions within 2-3 weeks and we will let you know whether your work is accepted.

 

There is no preferred genre of writing.  You will find that we welcome most genres.  Works in progress and simultaneous submissions are welcome but they must be marked as such.  

 

Poetry: no more than 3-6 poems

Short stories: limit of 2, no more than 3500 words

 

Make sure that you paste your submission into the email or attach it as a .doc file.

 

 

Rewards

 

If you contribute to our project, there are many wonderful awards available to you.  We are giving away free copies and subscriptions to the digital and print editions of Miracle e-zine.  

 

At the $10 or more level you will be given a membership to Miracle Bond, a special and interactive writing group.  Also available are copies of the anthology for the 2013 Poetry Competition and copies of the first print issue personally autographed by our editor, Guntaj Arora.  Guntaj Arora will also be writing handwritten Thank-You notes to contributors of $200 or more.  Other rewards include a special framed poster by the Miracle e-zine team.  

 

The reward for contributing $500 or more is that you will be able to work with Miracle e-zine on its first print issue.  

 

And finally, if you are the generous being that contributes $600 or more, you will be the featured writer, artist or photographer for the next issue of Miracle e-zine.  If you are an advertiser, we will give you a full-page ad in our magazine.

 

Something to think about: When you pledge more than $10, your reward level includes all of the perks from the earlier levels as well!  Example: if you pledge $50 or more, you receive the awards from the $5 or more, $10 or more, $20 or more and $30 or more levels as well.

And finally, if you are the generous being that contributes $600 or more, you will be the featured writer, artist or photographer for the next issue of Miracle e-zine.  If you are an advertiser, we will give you a full-page ad in our magazine.
 
Something to think about: When you pledge more than $10, your reward level includes all of the perks from the earlier levels as well!  Example: if you pledge $50 or more, you receive the awards from the $5 or more, $10 or more, $20 or more and $30 or more levels as well.

story:
Another world is possible!

If you don't like the way things are in the world today – and probably you don't – let's bring an alternative.

Let's define how we want things to be when it comes to politics, economy, society and environment, with a global perspective.

This is our planet. Everybody's. So pollution in an Asian river is not Asia's problem, it's yours and mine.

And every person should have the same human rights, regardless of the place of birth.

But what exactly is ifw?

The project, named Initiative for the World, is becoming a document and a web site.

  • The document will describe the actual system in which the world could be organised, how to implement it and how it could work in practice.

  • The web site will contain pretty much the same information as the document, but with the possibility for visitors to interact with the project, bringing suggestions and ideas.

So who's behind this?

My name is Robert Carreno, born in Gijón (Spain) in 1968, a visual artist that has lived in several wonderful places in the world.

But I am not doing this alone. I have been working on this project for six years, discussing it with all kinds of people, professionals, PhDs, journalists, artists and hippies.

If I succeed with this campaign, I will gather even more information from experts (political scientists, economists, and sociologists) in universities from different countries.

What are the guidelines?

Very briefly, these are the main points of the project:

  • Global democracy, a new system that will be the same around the planet.

  • More transparency in politics, making politicians accountable, making it easier to remove them from power if they don't do their task properly.

  • Global, democratic institutions to take care of the environment, intervene in case of armed conflicts, and protect human rights everywhere.

What is the money going to be used for?

Research. Contact and cooperation with professionals. Development of the contents, the guidelines and the practical issues of the political and economical programme. Text editing. Translation from Spanish. Creation of an interactive web site. Distribution of the finished document.

* * *

There's a lot more, and obviously there's no room here. If you want more information, please check our blog.

Be part of this project!

Get involved! Get in touch! Thank you for your support, for your ideas and for spreading the word.

story:
DESCRIPCION / DESCRIPTION

Espanol

El PROYECTO CHAPA es una idea que nace a partir de diversas inquietudes:

  • Cómo generar empleo?
  • Cómo hacer que ese empleo involucre a la familia?
  • Cómo hacer para que familias de bajos recursos tuviesen un ingreso extra?
  • Cómo ser innovador?

PROYECTO CHAPA trabaja de la siguiente forma:

  • Reutilizamos las chapas de las latas de bebidas para hacer artesanías y joyas, las cuales son colocadas y vendidas en distintas partes del mundo.
  • Trabajamos con mujeres artesanas de la Isla de Chiloé en la Patagonia Chilena. Damos la oportunidad de tener un ingreso extra sin que altere su vida familiar y actividades del campo o mar.
  • Compramos chapas traidas por las mismas familias con las cuales trabajamos y así extendemos el negocio no solamente a la artesana, involucrando a toda la familia. También les cedemos chapas en el caso de que no cuenten con ellas. Para eso hemos desarrollado un grupo de colaboradores (restaurants, hoteles, bares, etc). También recibimos donaciones en chapas, las cuales se pueden hacer llegar a Chile o Estados Unidos.
  • Damos todo el reconocimiento a la artesana autora de cada pieza, tanto en lo creativo como en las utilidades.

English

The PROYECTO CHAPA is an idea that emerged to address several key social and economic questions: 

  • How do we create employment opportunities?
  • How do we create employment that involves the whole family?
  • How do we help low-income families boost their incomes?
  • How do we encourage innovation?

PROYECTO CHAPA works in the following way: 

  • We reuse the tabs of aluminum cans to make purses, jewelry and other artisanry, with the goal of selling these products in distinct parts of the world.
  • We work with women artisans on the Island of Chiloe in Chilean Patagonia, giving them the opportunity to earn extra income without altering their family,  farming and fishing lifestlye on the Island. 
  • We will purchase the tabs that the families collect and sell to the PROYECTO in order to involve and support the whole family, not just the artisan. We will also collect and donate tabs to the artisans who are unable to collect and sell us tabs on their own. To do this, we have begun to collaborate with restaurants, hotels and bars. We also welcome donations of tabs from other parts of the world that can be sent to Chile.
  • Each piece will include the name of the artisan, and the artisan will receive all remaining profits after we have reinvested a portion towards the sustainability of the PROYECTO. 

¿QUÉ HAREMOS CON EL DINERO? / HOW WILL WE USE YOUR CONTRIBUTION?

Espanol

Buscamos $5,500 para que nos permita poder comprar unos 20 kilos de chapas (aparte de las que juntamos nosotros) para tener materia prima y hacer una buena producción. Además necesitamos contar ya con un sitio web donde podamos difundir nuestras actividades, asociadas, contribuidores, logros, etc

Nuestro plan es tambien usar las contribuciones para poder contratar a las artesanas y sumar a más gente con diversas habilidades, que el beneficio de este negocio crezca hacia los lados y no hacia arriba solamente.

Nuestra meta es ayudar a familias humildes que habitan el fin del mundo a tener un ingreso extra y así lograr sus metas. Quién sabe, en un futuro quizás ellas mismas puedan llevar a cabo emprendimientos como éstos.

English

We are raising $5,500 to be able to purchase 20 kilos of tabs (in addition to the the ones we collect via donations) in order to have the primary material to begin production. Additionally, we will use the funds to develop a website where we can share information about our activities, collaborators, contributors, achievements, etc.

Our plan is to also use the funds to hire the artisans and others with diverse skills so that as the PROYECTO grows, the benefit spreads to include other artisans and other communities.  

Our goal is to help the humble families that live in Chiloe earn extra income to support their goals and livelihood. If we are successful in this initial stage, it is our hope that these artisans will be able to create their own microenterprises to sell their artisanry. 

QUIENES SOMOS? / WHO ARE WE?

Somos Max Vergara G. (chileno y emprendedor) y Jennifer Medina (estadounidense y especialista en políticas públicas).

PROYECTO CHAPA is an idea that Max Vergara, a Chilean entrepreneur, developed with support from Jennifer Medina, a U.S. native who works in public policy.
