story:
Hello! I’m Michael Harris, Founder of ProSeed Books. I am a working professional, artist, musician & writer. Giving back to my community has always been important to me. I am driven to connect with my environment, with the people in my life and those I have yet to meet.  I have always found that artistic expression is one of the most powerful ways to do this; be it with a song, a book, a painting, photography or dance. Communicating the beauty of our human condition is critical and what I am inspired to do.

“A Picture Is Worth...” does this and much more. As a true collaborative multimedia book, it not only brings together the best of photography, music and technology, but it changes what a book can do. 

At the start, ten photographers were asked to submit a series of photos that work loosely to convey a story. These stunning photos were then handed out to ten Singer/Songwriters who were asked to compose and record an original song based on the inspiration gleaned from the photos they received. 

What makes "A Picture is Worth..." stand apart? Each artist has an individual QR code in the book that allows the reader to use their smart phone or tablet to scan the codes to hear the music that goes with each series of photos--and watch the individual artists discuss their part in the book’s creation. 


“A Picture Is Worth...” will also make a difference in the lives of young children in communities in need.  A portion of each book sold will be donated to the Los Angeles branch of Reach Out And Read , a national non-profit children’s literacy organization, that puts books into the hands of parents and young children to develop a culture of reading within the family. So your contribution aids in that endeavor. 

What your contribution goes to:

Your contribution goes to the final production and printing of the limited-edition book and the distribution of the gifts for the various tiers. A portion of each book sold from the ‘Giving Tree’ tier will go to Reach Out And Read. Any remaining funds will be used to seed the next ProSeed Book project. 

Because this is a special limited-edition book, we are only printing a few hundred which we hope to pre-sell during the campaign, allowing us to hit our donation goal to Reach Out And Read. If we do not make our overall campaign goal, books will still be printed and rewards distributed, but the number of books and the amount we can donate will of course be effected. 

As thanks for your kindness!

With attention to detail and quality we have put together a selection of gifts at various contribution tiers. 

  • A bookmark of Cherry wood, hand branded with the ProSeed Books’ pine cone logo.


  • A dark gray, soft cotton t-shirt, silk screened by hand with the ProSeed Books logo and slogan. 


  • A beautiful print of one of the photographs from the book signed by the photographer.
  • A limited-edition copy of “A Picture Is Worth...”, numbered, with an embossed seal and signed by several of the artists.
  • Your name in the book as a special patron to this project.

More than one way to help!

If you are unable to contribute to one of the donation tiers there is more than one way to help us reach our goal. You can use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share our link with family, friends and co-workers. You can post about us on your personal blog, Twitter account,  Facebook or other social media platform.  

For more information:

Please visit the ProSeed Books website at www.proseedbooks.com

From all of us at ProSeed Books, the artists involved in the project and the kids who will benefit - THANK YOU!

story:
Tales from an Israeli Storyteller is a cycle of 20 short stories and novellas born from exploring the most iconic locations in Israel with companions blessed with truly vivid imagination. This is the story of the Israel you don’t hear about on the news – the Israel where an evil rabbi creates a smartass golem that comes back to haunt him during an unholy ceremony on Mount Meron, where talking animals search for justice among the demons and spirits of Ein Gedi, where a Bedouin hero confronts an evil book in the caves of Qumran, and where one clueless efreet keeps losing his wife in the Negev desert.


While some of the characters are hard to meet, all the locations are real and very accessible, making this book a guide to some of the coolest places on the planet as well as an exploration of a modern fantasy setting inspired by the folklore and mythology of one of the oldest (and youngest) countries in the world.


The book will be about 350 pages long and will have 20-25 illustrations, plus a cover and a map.

 

 

We get the coolest tourists around here!

Art by the invincible Hugo Solis.


So, what makes this book different from any other fantasy anthology out there?

1) It’s Levantine Fantasy

Israel is a beautiful and fascinating place. Merely looking out of a car window fills you with four thousand years of wonder, magic, and horror. It is a country of dark contradictions – a land of ancient history that hails to times before the flood, and an all-too-fragile modern civilization. It is a land where you can meet ghouls, golems, genies, talking animals, angels, lilin and other wonderful beings. In short, it is a very cool place.

Besides, why should Greeks and Vikings have all the fun? The Gods and Monsters of the Old Levant want to be heard too...

You can read one such story here.

2) It’s Real Fantasy

Yes, it’s an oxymoron. Allow me to explain. This is more than just a fantasy story cycle one writes as he sits in front of the computer, sipping tea and listening to bands you’ve probably never heard of. This is a nice and accurate guide. These stories are not made up, they are told by the land. I am merely translating them into words and pictures. The land is generous, but it is also harsh – it does not tolerate lying tell-tales, so I oblige it by truly listening to what it has to say.

More to the point, I only write about real places that I really visited and which really inspired me.

You can see some cool places here.

A world where this happens every day
Art by the potent Aviv Itzcovitz


So, where does my money go?

Publishing costs money. There is editing, art, layout, cover design and other boring technical stuff. More importantly, this book is inspired by a real life adventure, and real adventuring costs real money. Gas, food, entrance fees, protection money, blood money, coins tossed down magic wells, sacrifices unto minor spirits and retired deities, that sort of thing. This is more than just a book. This is an expedition, and, like all expeditions, it depends on the patronage of good people.

The more we raise, the more awesome this book will be. It will have more cool art, more fun addendums and more stories full of win
Two classic Levantine animals, facing two classic Levantine demons.

 


I want to help this project, but don’t have money to spare right now. Can I still help?

Certainly! I need the green gold to pay for editing, art, layout and so forth, so contributions will be very welcome. But money is not everything in life (presumably) – drawings, experiences, and even magic stories of your own -- all are welcome!

 

Thank you for your help!

A note regarding the perks – each perk includes all the previous perks. You don’t have to choose – the more you give, the more you get!

 

Reviews by early readers:

Clinton Boomer, author of the Hole behind Midnight, writes:
"There are far too few original voices in fiction. A voice like Uri's – breathtakingly imaginative in flights of fancy, brutally rooted in the horror of the real and blindingly human in even the most alien of moments – may come along only once in a generation."

Torah Cottrill, former Managing Editor in Wizards of the Coast, writes:
"This collection of stories is truly out of the ordinary, a glimpse into the place where the magical and the mundane meet. Creatures of legend still live in the old places of modern Israel, so be warned: the stranger you encounter on the streets of Tel Aviv may be much more than she seems!"

Christine Forshner, blogger and reviewer, writes:
"The tales contained within are varied, and span the breadth of human existence. Some are short, some long, but all have something interesting to say about the people and surroundings. Within these pages you can see the perspective of creatures great and small, from the lives of toys and our four legged friends to the lives of gods and otherworldly beings. The fact that the author has visited these places makes it even more realistic in its bizarre fantasy."

Ty Johnston, author of Ghosts of the Asylum and Demon Chains, writes:
"Past and present, divine and demonic, sacrosanct and secular, all are brought together in this collection to breath life into the hidden world of Israel’s secrets. Here legends of old walk the streets and horrors best left forgotten raise their ugly heads to remind us of the thin veil separating our world from theirs. Uri creates all this not only with his words, but with the images he implants in the readers’ minds of the very land he himself has trod upon."

Scott F. Gray, author of A Prayer for Dead Kings and Other Tales, writes:
"Uri Kurlianchik writes with the voice of a seasoned explorer and the imagination of a master fantasist, crafting wondrous travelogues like some bastard love-child of Lord Dunsany and Paul Theroux. Treading the fabled ground of myth and history, this extraordinary collection of unique tales weaves a tapestry of hope and sadness that literally cannot be put down."

Some are short, some long, but all have something interesting to say about the people and surroundings. Within these pages you can see the perspective of creatures great and small, from the lives of toys and our four legged friends to the lives of gods and otherworldly beings. The fact that the author has visited these places makes it even more realistic in its bizarre fantasy."Ty Johnston, author of Ghosts of the Asylum and Demon Chains, writes:"Past and present, divine and demonic, sacrosanct and secular, all are brought together in this collection to breath life into the hidden world of Israel’s secrets. Here legends of old walk the streets and horrors best left forgotten raise their ugly heads to remind us of the thin veil separating our world from theirs. Uri creates all this not only with his words, but with the images he implants in the readers’ minds of the very land he himself has trod upon."Scott F. Gray, author of A Prayer for Dead Kings and Other Tales, writes:"Uri Kurlianchik writes with the voice of a seasoned explorer and the imagination of a master fantasist, crafting wondrous travelogues like some bastard love-child of Lord Dunsany and Paul Theroux. Treading the fabled ground of myth and history, this extraordinary collection of unique tales weaves a tapestry of hope and sadness that literally cannot be put down."

story:
“The peculiar grace of a shaker chair is due to the fact that it was made by someone capable of believing that an angel might come and sit on it.” – Thomas Merton, Trappist Monk and Philosopher

I am a mortgage broker.  I rent money. I don’t build enduring, simply elegant furniture.  But the sentiment behind this Thomas Merton quote has always resonated deeply with my belief system.  What if my next client actually was an angel?  A celestial spirit sent down from above? 

What would I do differently than I have done before? 

What would I need to learn in order to be worthy of the business?

What skills would I need to improve in order to give advice better than ever before?

What resources would I need to gather?

And who is to say that my next client is not, indeed, an angel?

These are the questions that keep me up at night; how can I achieve constant, never-ending improvement in how I serve my clients?

What does that have to do with this book? 

In 2008 our industry collapsed and took the economy of the entire country, maybe even the world, with it.  The collapse of the industry came about, in my opinion, because of a convergence of three trends:

  • Investment banks, with loosened regulatory guidelines, discovered that they could create highly profitable, exotic loan products that sold very well.

  • Mortgage originators (those who worked for brokers or banks) found they could make a great deal more money on the exotic products than on conventional products and went crazy selling them.

  • Potential homebuyers who were not able to buy homes with conventional financing jumped on the opportunities afforded by the exotic products, sometimes having been duped into accepting onerous terms, and sometimes knowingly.

This was our fault as an industry; we are responsible to see that it doesn’t happen again

I believe that the primary reason we as an industry were able to sell such toxic products and cause the Great Recession was because many originators (not all) were completely disconnected from their clients, and many clients (not all) were so uninformed they had no chance to protect themselves.

As I sat thinking in 2008 how we could change the industry so that such a debacle never happened again, I knew that I could not change the industry.  There has been a valiant attempt through the new regulation, but the best they can hope for is to control the bad players through strict oversight and clean up messes through enforcement.  They will always be battling corruption and greed.

I can, however, educate the consumer.  That is the purpose of The Loan Guide: How to Get the Best Possible Mortgage. 

Why Educating the Consumer Matters

If you, the consumer, are educated about all the ins and outs of the mortgage you are considering, you will know when your mortgage advisor is not acting in your best interest.  You will be able to make informed, confident decisions, and you will get the best possible mortgage.

This is just a book, but the message, the information and the guidance in the book are important.  The book empowers consumers to manage the mortgage process by giving them a peak behind the industry curtain, guidance as to whether they should or should not proceed with their current plans, and financial tools to back up their decisions with solid data.

There has been no other book on mortgages written since the collapse of the business

Everything about mortgage lending has changed since 2008, but there hasn’t been a book written for the consumer since before the collapse.  There simply is no unbiased source of information for the consumer today.  The Loan Guide is badly needed.

The book is done.  Your contributions will be used to promote this important message

The book is written, edited by a team of writers and mortgage professionals, laid out, and ready to publish.  But in order for this message and these tools to reach as many people as possible, a robust promotional campaign has to be launched.

What we need and how it will be used

The funds raised by this campaign will be used for the following:

  • Create a professional book cover design.

  • Flesh out the website www.loanguide.com to sell the books and provide easy access to the Excel-based tools which are used throughout the book.

  • Host a book launch event for influential industry leaders who will help market the book.

  • Offer the tools in the book through consumer counseling agencies.

  • Create educational events with real estate agents to deliver the message and promote the book.

  • Reach out to local corporations to deliver the message as an employee benefit.

  • Distribute the book through financial planners and their professional organizations.

  • Advertise on Facebook and Linkedin to create a viral sales channel

  • Order the first 500 copies to use for promotional meetings

To accomplish all of this will take a minimum of $18,500. If we get to $27,300, we’ll also be able to create a couple of professional-quality promotional videos, have an e-book version layout created professionally, and create a series of lectures that can be used to educate consumers to make informed, confident decisions about buying their next home.

I’ve created some nifty perks as a gift of gratitude for your support.  Especially if your business is helping families with their real estate or financing needs, you’ll find perks that can bring a great deal of value to your clients and help you build your business at the same time.  I’m very grateful for your support, and I want to show it.

The important message in The Loan Guide will be worthless if it is not read.  Your contribution will not only help me as an author, but will help the thousands of folks who need this book today.  You will be helping to educate consumers so that they can help themselves by making informed, confident decisions about the largest debt they’ll ever have.

Finally, I realize not everyone can contribute and some of the perks won’t be meaningful to everyone.  Whatever amount you can contribute is appreciated, and even if you can’t contribute you can provide very valuable support by passing this campaign on to anyone who is looking for a mortgage or who works with homeowners in any capacity. 

Real estate agents, financial advisors, asset managers, credit counselors, accountants, and others can use this book to help educate their clients and the perks I’ve offered can help them build their business.  Please pass this on to those you know.

Thank you for your support!

The Loan Guide Chapters

  • Your Grandparent’s Mortgage

  • Where Things Went Wrong

  • Where Should You Go For a Mortgage?

  • Should You Even Get a Mortgage?

  • Should You Buy a Home?

  • Should You Refinance?

  • Should You Buy an Investment Property?

  • Should You Get a Reverse Mortgage?

  • Types of Mortgages

  • Conforming and Non-Conforming Loans

  • Reverse Mortgages

  • Fixed-Rate Mortgages

  • Adjustable-Rate Mortgages

  • Interest-Only Loans

  • Option ARMs

  • Private Money

  • Second Mortgages

  • Equity Lines

  • Other Considerations

  • Money-Saving Strategies

  • Reading the Disclosures

  • Common Marketing Gimmicks

story:
Short Summary

Voices of Hellenism literary journal is a San Francisco Bay Area-based nonprofit Hellenic literary journal and a product of the Voices of Hellenism Literary Society, a global Hellenic organization that strives to promote Modern Greek Literature, idiosyncratic community building through writing, and historical preservation through literature and the written word. The journal began as a dream and was started by Annamarie Buonocore in 2011. The publication is annual and will come out in December of each year. Submissions are accepted on a rolling basis and peer reviewed by an editorial board. Submissions of poetry, fiction, creative nonfiction, and scholarly, academic essays are accepted for consideration. Submissions come from, Greek-Americans, Greeks, and Philhellenes from throughout the world. In addition to the various literary works we publish, we also publish artworks that are often avant garde in nature. We are a progressive, avant garde organization and publication that strives to bridge the gaps and disparities between Modern Greek academia and the modern-day Greek communities. The publication strives to educate future generations as well as the general public beyond the Hellenic world, so that the Hellenic experience and the stories of the Greek Diaspora are heard. These are the voices of a people not fully accepted as white yet not fully embraced as people of color. We are strengtheing and bringing together Hellenes and Philhellenes throughout the world. 

Born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area, Annamarie Buonocore is a proud Greek-American who wants to progressively give back to her community and help fellow Greek-Americans, Greeks, and Philhellenes explore the joys of writing and publish their writing in a community publication. She sees that the community needs a literary journal that will feature works of fiction and poetry along with scholarly essays and avant garde artworks. A life-long poet and writer with a strong family background in journalism and publishing, she explored her passion for literature and developed her own publishing company, Nine Muses Press. It all began when she was in the church choir and became inspired by the hymnology and music of the Greek Orthodox Church. She heard stories and voices that needed to be heard and attempted to execute the project through a small Hellenic museum in the same city as her church that is operated by a fellow parishioner. When ideas took different paths and economic times became more difficult, Annamarie continued the project as an independent publication and organization and developed a publishing company that places Greeks and Greek-Americans at the forefront of its mission. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are glad you stopped by. Any small amount will help this exciting project, so please consider a donation today. For just $10.00 you can help publish somebody's words from the heart. 

Voices of Hellenism Literary Journal and Literary Society is seeking $5,000 to help with graphic design and printing costs. While we have a solid advertising line, we also feel it is important to solicit donationas as a nonprofit organization through an online platform. Funds will also help us sponsor literary events, such as poetry readings and youth spelling bees that promote literacy and writing in the community. We believe that this journal belongs to all of us. All of our voices and stories should be heard, and all of our words matter. Please consider helping today. 

Donating to our cause can be very rewarding. Any donor who makes a donation of $50.00 or more will be listed on our supporters page within Issue I, Volume I of the journal. Donors with donations of $100.00 or more will get a free subscription. Subscriptions last for three years, so he or she will receive a free copy of the annual journal for three years. 

If we do not reach our goal, funds will be used for printing and put to good use. As a literary society, we are always striving to purchase more books to expand our community library. 

The Impact

We all know that donating makes a difference, and that making a difference in the community feels good. 

Voices of Hellenism is a valuable niche publication in the Hellenic community. We have many newspapers and magazines that are more than willing to inform us about economic problems in Greece and the rest of the world, but there are poets, fiction writers, artists of the avant garde that should also be seen and heard. While we incorporate articles that share world news, culture, and the current state of our mother country, we also foster and encourage creative expression and the cultivation of individual passion. Literary journals fulfill an imporant niche in every community. They bring life, passion, humor, and creativity to the mundane. The written word is truly empowering and inspiring, and Voices of Hellenism is a community publication that believes in every writer and every person's story. All members of our community are welcome to submit their work, volunteer and participate in this exciting community project. 

While Voices of Hellenism is a new startup publication, we have had a successful track record of rallying community support. We are up to 477 "likes" on the popular social networking website, Facebook and we have a dedicated and brilliant editorial board consisting of experienced and scholarly community leaders. Annamarie Buonocore has been working in her family's publishing company since age 14, assisting with the publication of two niche magazines, several newspapers, and a book. Her work has included ad sales, production, editing, and writing. She has also written for and volunteered for various online and in-print literary journals in the community and through colleges, universities, and high schools. She has judged writing and speech contests, has extensive experience with the Greek-American community, and is a freelance writer and editor. She is also a writing tutor and has experience with young writers. 

We hope you will take interest in our cause and consider a donation of any size today. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of us just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean we can’t help:

Please consider volunteering with our organization as an editorial board member or consider joining our board of directors. These opportunities provide excellent opportunities for leadership, community development, and social comraderie. In most cases, a two-year term is required. 

Please spread the word about this campaign. Share it here online, talk about it on social networking sites, or simply tell your friends, neighbors, and family members. 

Please also consider submitting your work. We are nearly full for this issue, but please do consider submitting works of poetry, fiction, creative nonfiction, family stories, biographies, artworks, and scholarly essays. It is our pleasure to work with all of you. If you have questions regarging this campaign, please contact Annamarie Buonocore at abuonocore@vhpprojec.org or 650-504-8549. Also, visit our official website at www.voicesofhellenism.org

story:
THE MANUAL is an inspirational memoir of positive change. A man's journey of life lessons. Sean M. Flynn chronicles his experiences from a streetwise, adventurous adolescent on the vivid streets of South Side Chicago to a doting son, devoted father, committed brother, uncle, and God-fearing Christian. THE MANUAL identifies the key attributes that every minority male must balance in order to become a REAL man. Its a very honest and relatable story that accurately depicts life in the harsh inner city. THE MANUAL narrates that manhood is not about the conquest of women, producing babies, or even making a lot of money. THE MANUAL teaches everyone--regardless of age, gender or race--that REAL manhood is first and foremost about seeking a perfect union with God and living one's life in accordance with Godly principles. THE MANUAL is a blueprint for living a life of peace and prosperity for one's self, one's family,  and one's community. Its an essential guideline for growing from a boy to a man.

THE MANUAL was initially just a thought bore out of Sean M. Flynn’s concern for the tragedies befalling young minority males growing up in Chicago. By working with the youth for several years, Mr. Flynn discovered that many of the hardships and difficulties most of those children faced were similar to adversities he’d overcome in his own life. The main difference was that while Mr. Flynn had maintained the hope that life can and will get better in the midst of difficulties, the young men he encountered didn’t believe that faith in better days was a practical reality for them.

Understandably, these actualities lead Mr. Flynn to begin writing his memoir in March 2013. By May 2013, the preliminary version of THE MANUAL was born. From June 2013 to December 2013, several versions of THE MANUAL were created. From then until January 2014, the book has been fully edited, crafted, and designed in its entirety.

As of February 2014, the only thing that still needs to be accomplished in order to bring THE MANUAL to the masses of youth who need it is funding to support the mass production of hard copies of the book for retail distribution, to pay for promotional costs, and to cover expenses that are necessary to provide supplemental male mentoring to various urban communities. The total funding needed to materialize THE MANUAL is an estimated $65,000. A local printing manufacturer, has offered Mr. Flynn an estimated quote and turnaround time of 5-7 days for the completion of hard copies of THE MANUAL. Provided Mr. Flynn’s goal amount is reached and funds are disbursed timely, production for THE MANUAL can begin immediately and, by April 2014, THE MANUAL can be circulated amongst online and retail bookstores nationwide.

The purpose of THE MANUAL is to affect positive change in a young minority male's life. In Chicago, hundreds of minority male's are killed year after year succumbing to street violence, death, jail or drugs. The skyrocketing violence amongst the youth has been well publicized  on CNN this past summer. There is a real need for for action to be taken in the city. Lots of adolescents lose their way navigating through their young adult lives due to lack of guidance. This is where THE MANUAL comes in. The book, in and of itself can be a help to a young man, but also its principles serves as the core curriculum taught in the Male Mentor Program sponsored by Standing in the Gap Foundation, LLC. Its imperative that such a tool is made available to at risk teens in need of it the most. If you really want to make a difference, if you really want to affect change in someone's life, if you really want to save a poor soul that is drowning, make it possible for young males in Chicago to receive beneficial guidance from someone who's been there and done that.

book for retail distribution, to pay for promotional costs, and to cover
 expenses that are necessary to provide supplemental male mentoring to 
various urban communities. The total funding needed to materialize THE 
MANUAL is an estimated $65,000. A local printing manufacturer, has 
offered Mr. Flynn an estimated quote and turnaround time of 5-7 days for
 the completion of hard copies of THE MANUAL. Provided Mr. Flynn’s goal 
amount is reached and funds are disbursed timely, production for THE 
MANUAL can begin immediately and, by April 2014, THE MANUAL can be 
circulated amongst online and retail bookstores nationwide.

The purpose of THE MANUAL is to affect positive change in a
 young minority male's life. In Chicago, hundreds of minority male's are
 killed year after year succumbing to street violence, death, jail or 
drugs. The skyrocketing violence amongst the youth has been well 
publicized  on CNN this past summer. There is a real need for for action
 to be taken in the city. Lots of adolescents lose their way navigating 
through their young adult lives due to lack of guidance. This is where 
THE MANUAL comes in. The book, in and of itself can be a help to a young
 man, but also its principles serves as the core curriculum taught in 
the Male Mentor Program sponsored by Standing in the Gap Foundation, 
LLC. Its imperative that such a tool is made available to at risk teens 
in need of it the most. If you really want to make a difference, if you 
really want to affect change in someone's life, if you really want to 
save a poor soul that is drowning, make it possible for young males in 
Chicago to receive beneficial guidance from someone who's been there and
 done that.

story:
Hi.  I’m Craig Comess, and, as shocking as this may seem, I don’t believe that politicians and bureaucrats in Washington can fix our problems.  At this point, I don’t even think the current cast of characters we elected can fix the government’s problems.

  Here’s the good news.  It’s our fault.  Politicians can’t fix our problems because they’re not supposed to.  We’re supposed to fix our problems.  Us.  Ordinary citizens.  You.  Me.  That guy over there wearing that shirt and those pants.  Politicians and bureaucrats can’t fix the economy; we can.  They don’t reduce crime; we can.  They can’t improve our health care system; we can. 

  That’s why I wrote Power to the People (Really). I want to remind Americans that we live in a self-governing republic.  That means that we govern our own behavior and we govern the country.  We don’t vote god-like geniuses into office who “run the country” and “take care of us.”  Their inability to do so should be quite apparent by now.

  Here’s where you come in.  The deal I’ve got with my publisher, Dietz Press in Petersburg, Virginia, is that I bring the book to him professionally copy-edited, laid out and with a cover design, and he’ll publish it and get it into some bookstores around Richmond, Virginia, where I live.  I also need to get a certain number of pre-sales before he’ll print the book.  No, this is not a vanity publisher; it's a legitimate small publisher who hasn't published a book like mine before. 

  I’ve gotten estimates from recommended professionals.  The copy editing comes in at about $1200, the layout at $600, and the cover design at $700.  The grand total is $2500.  In the interests of transparency, I added some money to their estimates because things happen and turn out more expensive than planned.  I’ll use any extra funds for marketing the book.  I will post the financial records for this project on the website power2thepeoplebookc.ipage.com.

  If you want to find out more about me and the book, check out the website at http://power2thepeoplebookc.ipage.com.  You can also check out my blog Everybody Has a Right to My Opinion to see read some sample chapters.  They are embedded in the post “Power to the People.”  You could also google “Craig Comess” and Richmond Times-Dispatch to see some newspaper columns I’ve written.       

   Incidentally, I'm embedding the original PowerPoint in my blog under "Power to the People II" so that you can see what it is supposed to look like.  When the PowerPoint was converted to video and then put on Vimeo, the slides started to bleed into each other.  I'm not very experienced at working with video.

story:
BREAKING NEWS!

This isn't specifically about my upcoming project, but it is great news for me as a writer. My book that came out this spring, "The World Was My Oyster But I Didn't Know How to Cook," has just been awarded the Princeton Literary Review's Gold Standard for Literary Excellence. I'm so thrilled! Now I'm diving back into my new book with more energy than ever.

ANOTHER UPDATE!

I've officially started writing this and the storyline is really coming together. In a few days I'll share a little bit about it. Not a lot because I've already told you how superstitious I am when it comes to talking about what I'm writing while it's still so new. When I do that, I starting messing it all up and then I write less and less until finally all I do is lay in my bed and complain. And that's not good for anyone.

But I did want to report back that now that I have the plot laid out, things are starting to rocket right along. It's contemporary and will probably be a little controversial. Gotta love a little literary controversy!

Claim your perk on the right of this page and help get this project off the ground!

 

UPDATE!

The first few days of this campaign have been great! I'm so thankful to those who have contributed, or have started helping me spread the word. I know there are many good causes out there you could spend your money or your time on, and I'm grateful to know that so many people are willing to put their support behind an independent writer like me. Supporting the arts will always come back to you in ways you'd never expect. So from the bottom of my heart, thank you for the support you've given so far. I'm looking forward to the rest of the campaign and I hope you are too.

 

Who I Am

My name is Christy Potter. I have been a journalist for the past 23 years, but after watching my chosen field change so much, I decided it's finally time to fulfill my lifelong dream of writing the Great American Novel. Well, okay, the Really Good American Novel. I'll let the critics upgrade me if they think I deserve it.

I've written two books over the past several years, but I recently stepped down from my full-time journalism job in order to fully focus on my next project. This is the book I've been carrying around in my head for a long time. This is the book that will get me noticed, make my name recognized, and help me achieve the goal I set long ago: to win a major book award before I turn 50.

Please forgive me, but I am not ready to talk publicly about the plot of the novel. This is one of my writer quirks - I can't do it until I'm substantially further along in the writing. Talking about it too soon changes my focus and changes my writing and then things start going downhill and then I get all stressed out and start writing about the Communist plot that keeps me from being able to buy vodka at 9 a.m. on a Sunday. I'm kidding. (Mostly.) But I really can't tell you right now what my book is about. I will tell you this, though: there's a reason my greatest role models are Philip Roth, John Updike, and Jonathan Franzen.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I've published two smaller books over the past few years, so I have a solid idea of the cost to self publish. I'll have to pay an editor, and have a cover designed, plus printing, promotion, shipping, and the day-to-day expenses of taking time out from everything else in order to write and do research.

That said, I know it is a leap of financial faith to back a writer. In my case, you can rest assured that I'm the real thing. Check my blog, www.ChristytheWriter.com, or search my name on Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and iTunes. I'm not a bored housewife who wants to write a book because she has nothing else to do. I'm not someone who bought book-writing software and thinks I might just take a crack at it, what the heck. I'm an award-winning writer with many publishing credits to my name. Book writing, while my first love and true passion, doesn't make many of us filthy rich. A financial boost from you would enable me to focus fully on what I know will be my breakout novel.

What you get in return is explained in more detail below. But the one thing that everyone who donates, or helps spread the word about my campaign, will get is the knowledge that you're supporting an artist, helping a writer realize her true potential, giving an independent author a little boost. You're helping to bring another book into the world. As the saying goes, the earth without art is just "eh."

And perhaps most importantly, when I've reached the heights to which I'm aiming, the first thing I will do is reach my hand out to help give other writers the same kind of boost. That's just how it should work.

 

What if Money is Just Too Tight?

You may not be in a position to help me financially, and believe me, I understand. You can still help support my project by telling your friends and colleagues about what I'm doing. Give them a link to this page so they can see for themselves. Anything you can do to help me spread the word would be greatly appreciated. Indiegogo has some share tools available for you to use.

Thank you, everyone who is still reading, for taking the time to get to know me and hear about my dreams. Since the day I self-published and Crayon-illustrated the book in my campaign photo, I've been nurturing this dream. Now, with your help, I can make it come true.

"Writing and reading decrease our sense of isolation. They deepen and widen and expand our sense of life: they feed the soul." Anne Lamott

story:
Nine years ago my efforts kept a corner of a public historic park from being given to and developed by the Catholic Church. I think The Great Creator was preparing me for more which came in the form of keeping the historic Sharkey Building from demolition. Miracles followed and I went on to get several buildings listed beyond local registers as well as undertake other political and legal conflicts for historic preservation in the town that Joe DiMaggio was born and John Muir died. 

"I Will Miss The Sky" is my last attempt--in an election year--to share with the citizens of Martinez the meaning of their historic resources, the historic preservation process as undertaken by the rest of the world, Martinez's local political processes, and an inside look on this rare journey I have coined "The Celtic Spaghetti Knot of Martinez". It is an e-book that also includes some of my images and research documents of Martinez. Please be aware that I will be describing, in a factual tone, some of the unethical occurences in Martinez's politics. Your contribution will remain anonymous unless you indicate otherwise.

$500 is not that much money. By allowing others to invest, it will increase ownership and understanding of Martinez's built environment, local government, and that which is noble about life. I hope to finish this by New Years 2014 (in a couple months).

story:
“This book is ½ manual, ½ sex, drugs, and rock n' roll story, and ½ choose your own adventure...Yeah, I know: it's 3/2's for the price of 2. And it’s that last half that's most valuable.” ~Justin

As those of you who have taken an Outlaw Yoga class can attest, we have stumbled on to something pretty fun here. What started off as a new way to practice a new way of being in a fun and LOUD environment, has since grown into a revolution of contemporary yoga.

A yoga that challenges us to stop making excuses, that empowers us to go beyond the physical and take our practice off of the mat, one that allows opportunity for real connection at so many levels. A practice, sometimes on our mats, that gives us a reason to step up...either that, or a moment to step out.

My experiences in life have been interesting to say the least. From fucking everything that moves, to working with gang members in war zones, my life has been chance after chance for me to fuck up...to fall...and to get back up. In publishing a measure of my story alongside some of the experiments and lessons that I have encountered along the way, I hope only to demonstrate that more is always possible, that whether it is on the mat or off, in the cage or in the kitchen, anyone has the power within to take a look, take ownership, and to take action in the story of their lives.

There were a couple of options to publish this book, but I thought the most interesting one would be to allow the community to decide whether they wanted it or not. Community being a big thing for us at Outlaw Yoga. Walking our talk, so to speak, and offering you the chance to choose if this sounds like something you might be interested in.

That said, there are 4 levels of support you can provide to help us publish this book.

What it gets you:

Level 1 supporters – autographed advance copy of Outlaw Protocol and an Outlaw yoga sticker. - $15

Level 2 supporters – autographed advance copy of Outlaw Protocol, Outlaw Yoga sticker, AND limited edition Outlaw Yoga Book T-shirt. - $35

Level 3 supporters – autographed advance copy of Outlaw Protocol, Outlaw Yoga sticker, limited edition Outlaw Yoga Book T-shirt, AND admission to private release party May 30th at Kindness Yoga Broadway featuring a LIVE music yoga class with Justin and KenK, reading, and beers and refreshments to follow. - $50

Level 4 supporters – Accelerate the Revolution Group Starter Kit - The ARGS Kit comes with 15 OUTLAW Yoga stickers, 15 autographed advance copies of the book, AND 1 limited edition OUTLAW Yoga t-shirt

What your support supports:

Limited edition Outlaw Yoga book T-shirts for Level 2 and 3 supporter    $1,500

Indiegogo has gots to get a cut: 4%/transaction IF we meet our goal  $500

  (plus credit card transaction fees cause they want a piece of our ass too) 

Book typesetting and formatting support  $300

Editorial fee AND Indiegogo campaign support  $500

The addition of a barcode to the back jacket    $20

Promotion materials and pitch work for the IGG campaign  $80

And of course, printing 1,000 copies of Outlaw Protocol (including shipping)  $5870 – 5999

  ______

  Our goal is  $9,000


Whether you’re a yogi or shmogi, buy this book. It may change your life. It may also not change your life. But I've happily pissed away way more than $15 on way worse odds than these. $35 dollars at least gets you a bad-ass T-shirt, and if you spend the $50 I will personally guarantee you will get your beer's worth at the reading if nothing else.

Through the filter of the five foundational pillars of Outlaw Yoga, and his own story of sex, drugs, and rock n roll, renowned yoga teacher Justin Kaliszewski will challenge you to take a look at how you live your life, empower you to take ownership of the choices that have led you to where you are, and give you the tools to take action on and off the mat. Outlaw Protocol: how to life your life as an outlaw without becoming a criminal is not just a book for yogis, but for all who would dare to make more than a habit out of life.

“Outlaws do what's right, not what's popular.” ~Justin

story:
As you are all aware, the Class of 1991 is holding a memorial service to honor the life of our classmate and dear friend Melat WoldeAregay on Saturday, December 14, 2013; at Peace Lutheran Church in Alexandria, Virginia.  While nothing pains us more than organizing an event where Melat, who is always the life of any gathering,  will not be present among her friends and classmates,  we must come together to celebrate and honor her life.

Many of you in the area as well as across north America has expressed your grief and inquired on how you can contribute financially towards this memorial service.

We have set up this site as an easy way for anyone from our class to make a donation. Please know that your donation made through this site will be primarily used to cover expenses related to her memorial service, such as hall rental, food catering, audio/video support, and printing of agenda and bookmarks for guests and friends. We expect 50 to 100 people to attend the service.

Any fund left over will be applied to the long term project that the Class of 1991 is preparing in memory of Melat (stay tuned as more information will be sent out about the long term project immediately after the memorial service).

Those of you who are unable to attend the memorial service can receive the agenda/booklet from the service as well as a bookmark that will help you to keep Melat's family in your prayers

story:
How many times have you had a restless night dreading having to wake up the next morning only to drive to a job that you know isn't purposeful or utilizing your full potential? I experienced this weekly in a previous corporate job...and here is my story of how I feared mediocrity, took meaningful action, and created the life I always dreamed of.

Why write this book and how is it unique?

Through all of my experiences in entrepreneurship, family business, and large corporations, I was very fortunate to discover my life’s calling at a young age. Couple that realization with considerable amounts of research:

- Gallup found that less than 30% of people are engaged in their work

- Albert Mehrabian’s research shows that only 7% of a person’s message to another person is verbal

- Daniel Pink found that people are motivated by autonomy, mastery, and purpose

- Only 25% of jobs are available online, 75% are discovered via personal referrals

- According to LinkedIn, 85% of jobs come from a person’s 2nd level connections

- The unemployment rate still hovers around 8% nationally, yet there are only 3.6 million jobs available

…and it is becoming increasingly difficult to find work that matters to the individual and society and allows you to live your passion. I started to see a shift in the executives that I work with…one group simply wanted me to do the work…the other desperately wanted a step-by-step process that would allow them to:

- understand themselves…their natural communication and behavioral styles

- understand how to read others and be able to adjust communication to meet the other person’s

- discover their personal brand through a defined process

- include what makes them unique in resumes, cover letters, LinkedIn, when networking and in interviews

- learn best practices for using LinkedIn to find new clients or new jobs

- establish personal advisory boards to foster continual growth, learning, and renewal 

What will I learn?

The book is a manual/blue print/step-by-step process for taking the DISC assessment, incorporating the knowledge learned throughout the career transition process, and sharing career development best practices.

In the book, the reader is given an access code to the DISC assessment (the same process as StrengthsFinder 2.0), provided a portal to take the assessment online, walked through the different sections of the DISC, asked for additional insights via self-assessment and the identification of work priorities, and then uses that to create guiding statements (i.e. personal mission or vision statements). From there, I show the reader how to write meaningful accomplishment development statements (resume bullet points) and filter those throughout their resume, cover letter, 30-second commercial, and LinkedIn (ensuring that DISC content is included throughout).

I then give tactical advice on how to incorporate the DISC into and live one’s personal brand in person and online filtering it throughout the networking process, general communication tips, and when interviewing. Because the job search never ends, I’ve also developed best practices to foster continual growth and learning via the 70 / 20 / 10 principle, formal education, certifications, and the adoption of a personal advisory board.

In short, the book is a how-to guide for the major components of career transition full of incredible resources, templates, and ideas that readers can use to unlock their own potential.

Why are you the right person to write this book?

My career coaching experiences include:

- I KNOW MY LIFE'S CALLING IS THIS WORK; my personal mission statement is to “unlock human potential through the development of personal and professional well being” and much of my time is in the service of and to generate value for people

- I KNOW THE JOB SEEKER SIDE; working in the career centers of the Thunderbird School of Global Management and the W. P. Carey School of Business at Arizona State University where I have helped hundreds of students from over 55 countries

- I KNOW THE EMPLOYER/RECRUITER SIDE; working in large corporations recruiting top talent, working in organizational development, and also helping hundreds of clinical and administrative professionals affected by reductions in force (RIF) go through transition

- I KNOW AND LOVE THE PHILANTHROPIC SIDE; donating my time to and teaching career development classes for Junior Achievement, and serving as the Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors for the Phoenix Workforce Connection

- I KNOW THE "HUMAN" SIDE; being a Certified Professional Behavioral Analyst (CPBA) who is trained in the DISC assessment and the variety of ways to use it; I also use the Myers Briggs, StrengthsFinder 2.0, and CareerLeader daily

- I KNOW THE BUSINESS SIDE; running my own entrepreneurial venture, securing clients and driving profit in year one…and am on pace to double that profit in year two

…so my experiences are very diverse, and through significant trial and error, I have developed the skills, passion for and desire to unlock human potential.

Why do you need $10,000?

While writing the book and testing the ideas on clients has been free, the costs of publishing add up rapidly. I am paying artists, editors, website developers and other professionals at market rates to ensure that readers get a 5 Diamond experience with the interactive website and the paperback copy of the book. Your contributions will go directly toward estimated production costs of editing, design, and illustrations ($3,500); website development ($3,250); marketing and publicity ($2,500); and printing costs for the first run of the book ($750).

When will I get the book?

A draft of the book is written and in the hands of a small group of testers (15 people with diverse backgrounds who also believe in the process and who want to give back to society as well) who are vetting the process. After I make their suggested enhancements, it will go to a publisher for editing. The website developers will begin working and by December 2013, the new book should be available. If the publishing process begins to drag out, I promise to keep contributors up to date.

Beginnings…to Today

Upon moving to Phoenix, AZ nearly ten years ago, I spent the first four years here in the hospitality industry meeting celebrities at the Four Seasons Resort and learned how to anticipate needs and provide 5 Diamond service. As the economy began to crumble in 2008, I started the full-time MBA program at the Thunderbird School of Global Management. Attending classes with students from over 50 countries completely changed my life. As a student, I discovered my interest in helping others while working in the Career Management Center and quickly found work at a top ten healthcare organization, Banner Health, post graduation.

While working in the sourcing and recruiting function, I was also tasked with running an outplacement department that found new jobs for displaced workers whose jobs were eliminated. As I dove into the work, I realized that I wasn’t meant to be a corporate citizen…I was put on earth to UNLOCK HUMAN POTENTIAL. I started my career coaching business in early 2011 as a way to test the ideas in my head. After a few months of receiving positive feedback and having my process validated, I decided to leave my corporate position and follow my passion for entrepreneurship, teaching at the collegiate level, and helping others discover their personal brand and land intrinsically motivating work.

I currently work as a career coach in the W. P. Carey School of Business at Arizona State University and serve a consistent stable of clients through my own career coaching business. Regardless of the population of people that I serve, I absolutely love what I do and often wake up at 2:00AM and work 18-hour days to help people discover their life’s calling.

Gratitude

From the entirety of my heart, please understand how grateful I am for your support in this project. Being a member of an international community that comes together to help one another unlock potential and live the lives of their dreams means so much to me! I can’t wait to grow my level of engagement in helping others achieve their dreams through crowdfunding sources and communities of like-minded people.
story_txt:
How many times have you had a restless night dreading having to wake up the next morning only to drive to a job that you know isn't purposeful or utilizing your full potential? I experienced this weekly in a previous corporate job...and here is my story of how I feared mediocrity, took meaningful action, and created the life I always dreamed of.
Why write this book and how is it unique?
Through all of my experiences in entrepreneurship, family business, and large corporations, I was very fortunate to discover my life’s calling at a young age. Couple that realization with considerable amounts of research:
- Gallup found that less than 30% of people are engaged in their work
- Albert Mehrabian’s research shows that only 7% of a person’s message to another person is verbal
- Daniel Pink found that people are motivated by autonomy, mastery, and purpose
- Only 25% of jobs are available online, 75% are discovered via personal referrals
- According to LinkedIn, 85% of jobs come from a person’s 2nd level connections
- The unemployment rate still hovers around 8% nationally, yet there are only 3.6 million jobs available
…and it is becoming increasingly difficult to find work that matters to the individual and society and allows you to live your passion. story:
I am Casey Rocheteau. I am a working class, mixed race, poet, historian and activist. I am trying to get to Bread Loaf Writer's Conference in Sicily, Italy in late September 2014. You can find out more about the prestigious Bread Loaf Writers' Conference here: Bread Loaf in Sicily

I need to get this money to Bread Loaf by July 7th, which is very short notice. I was recently informed a spot opened up for me, and I was pulled from the wait list. In order to get there, I'm going to need your help. It is essential that working class/poor writers of color have access to these kinds of spaces, but it's not always immediately feasible. What you are contributing is not simply about fulfilling dreams but also equity in artistic spaces.

What I Need 

Cost of attendance for Bread Loaf in Sicily is $2790, which does not include airfare. I have already raised $2200 through indiegogo towards this goal in less than two weeks!

However, I still need to fundraise for the full amount of attendance as well as
airfare from New York City to Palermo, Italy will be an additional $1400.

What You Get

A $5 or $10 donation will get you a personalized, Casey-designed postcard from Sicily from Casey with a poem just for you!

A $25 donation will get you a personalized postcard and a signed copy of Casey's one of Casey's two albums (your choice) with the Whitehaus Family Record.

A $50 donation will get you a personalized postcard, a signed copy of one of Casey's two albums (your choice), and a signed copy of Knocked Up On Yes, Casey's 2012 book on Sargent Press.

A $100 donation will get you a signed copy of Knocked Up On Yes, and a 90 minute American history or poetry writing workshop, via Skype (or in person if feasible) with Casey based on your interests.

A $250 donation will get you a signed copy of Knocked Up On Yes, and two 60 minute American history or poetry writing workshops, via Skype (or in person if feasible) with Casey based on your interests.

A $500 donation will get you three 60 minute American history or poetry writing workshops via Skype or in person, a small glass jar filled with tears of gratitude or a tarot reading by Casey, and a poem written for you by Casey, the subject of which you can request.

A $1000 donation will get you the entire Casey Rocheteau Library (4 chapbooks, one book, two CDs), three 90 minute American history or poetry writing workshops via Skype or in person, a small glass jar filled with tears of gratitude or a tarot reading by Casey a poem written for you by Casey, the subject of which you can request, a personalized care package of baked goods and a piece of visual poetic artwork just for you!

Dependent upon how much money is raised in the next few weeks, I may not hit my immediate goal. Bread Loaf is working with me to split payments for the conference, but I need $1395 by July 7th, and another $1395 by July 31st. I am working on pulling money from other resources, but if I make anywhere near the goal of $3750, the funds will still go towards paying for and traveling to Bread Loaf in Sicily. If there are not enough funds to travel to Bread Loaf, the money will be set aside and will go towards the travel and costs of another writing workshop or fellowship, such as returning to Cave Canem.

Impact, Risks & Challenges

While this is certainly about equity for one individual, there is a great significance in financially supporting a working-class woman of color in the writing world. As an activist and teacher, I have worked within the slam poetry community, academia, public schools and currently at a girl's leadership summer camp to work towards building more anti-oppressive, equitable communities. This is an opportunity to grow as an individual and as a writer in a space that is otherwise financially inaccessible to myself and other writers with similar identities. If the Vida Count is any indicator, it is essential to support women writers in publishing, fellowships, workshops and conferences. You don't need more stats to understand that queer, working-class women of color face added challenges in addition to gender bias.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please just share the link to the campaign! It helps just as much as donating!

story:
¿Qué?

Cinco semanas y un día es una mordaz crítica contra el sistema político y los medios de (des)información.

Un empresario corrupto y cacique se presenta a las elecciones generales como presidente de gobierno. Como su imagen pública es terrible, contrata a un guionista de un programa cutre de humor para que lo asesore y le escriba sus discursos. Durante cinco semanas y un día vivirán una campaña y precampaña electoral difícil de olvidar.

Cinco semanas y un día se adentra en el mundo de la política española y los medios de comunicación actuales desde un punto de vista ácido y satírico. La historia cuenta con la presencia de varios personajes conocidos del mundo de la política y los medios de comunicación que aportan valor y verosimilitud a la narración de los acontecimientos.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Javiér López Martín.

Según fuentes fidedignas aprendió a leer a los cuatro años y escribió esta novela a los cinco, aunque esperó más de dos décadas a publicarla hasta que España estuvo preparada. Como estudiante se ha dado paseos por varios centros educativos acumulando títulos de esos que no sirven para nada.

Como escritor ha trabajado (o trabaja, quién sabe) en varias productoras de prestigio, donde es el encargado de redactar el menú diario del comedor. Tiene varios premios literarios en su cuarto que ha ido recolectando por papeleras.


Javier López Martín ha venido para quedarse.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 850€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Cinco semanas y un día que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Javier López Martín vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Amigos, tengo una gran noticia:
Dos trabajos fotográficos míos, Takanakuy Los Peleadores Andinos y Refugio del Alma han sido seleccionados para las proyecciones de este año del Visa Pour L'Image en Perpignan, en septiembre, el más importante evento de fotoperiodismo mundial anual. Sería un gran honor estar allí en persona y compartir las historias detrás de este proyecto a una audiencia global y futuros editores

 Visa Pour L'Image NO CUBRE MIS GASTOS DE VIAJE

El Proyecto:

Refugio del Alma, es mi trabajo sobre la peregrinación del Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca en Piura, trabajo fotográfico que vengo haciendo desde el año 2008 y con el que he obtenido reconocimientos internacionales tales como Picture of the Year 2013, Picture of the Year 2014, Internacional Photography Award 2014 y Picture of the Year Latinoamérica 2015. Además de exposiciones en la II Bienal de Fotografía de Lima y LimaPhoto, como parte de mi proyecto Cautivos.

Takanakuy, Los Peleadores Andinos, es un trabajo realizado en diciembre del 2014 en Chumbivilcas, Cusco, El takanakuy es un festival anual celebrado en diversos pueblos de la provincia cusqueña de Chumbivilcas, generalmente el 25 de diciembre, y que tiene como foco una suma de peleas entre parejas de individuos. Además de preparativos vinculados a grupos de parentesco y de un complejo proceso festivo, que tiene un carácter marcadamente colectivo, el takanakuy concreta en decenas o centenares de peleas, espontáneas o previamente pactadas. El nombre evidencia esta centralidad: “Taka” es “trompada” o “puñete”, “takay” es “golpear”, “trompear”, y “nakuy” es “hacerse mutuamente algo”.

¿Por qué la campaña de crowdfunding para ir a Perpignan?

Mis viajes fotográficos a Haití, Cuba, Líbano, Siria, Irak, Guatemala, Colombia y en el Perú así como los gastos en mi exposición Cautivos son financiados por mi y casi nunca se recuperan los gastos, por eso es que en esta ocasión estoy utilizando una campaña de crowdfunding para llegar a Perpignan.

Asistir al festival Visa Pour L'Image presentar Takanakuy y Refugio del Alma en persona es tanto una cuestión personal y un momento clave en mi desarrollo profesional como fotoperiodista freelance. Voy a tener la oportunidad de mostrar mi trabajo a docenas de más importantes curadores, críticos, editores y especialmente del mundo que se espera que puedan elegir de publicar este u otros trabajos previos y / o asignarme con nuevos proyectos.
Por lo tanto, le pido su apoyo para ayudarme a tomar ese paso importante 

LAS FOTOS LAS PUEDEN ELEGIR DE MI PAGINA WEB Y DE PDFs DE FOTOS QUE ENVIARE A QUIENES ESTEN INTERESADOS, PUEDEN ESCRIBIRME A 
scv5@hotmail.com o llamarme al 951724344 


http://www.sebastiancastaneda.com


Muchas gracias por tu apoyo!

-Sebastian Castañeda
story_txt: Amigos, tengo una gran noticia: Dos trabajos fotográficos míos, Takanakuy Los Peleadores Andinos y Refugio del Alma han sido seleccionados para las proyecciones de este año del Visa  Pour L'Image en Perpignan, en septiembre, el más importante evento de fotoperiodismo mundial anual. Sería un gran honor estar allí en persona y compartir las historias detrás de este proyecto a una audiencia global y futuros editores  Visa Pour L'Image NO CUBRE MIS GASTOS DE VIAJEEl Proyecto:Refugio del Alma, es mi trabajo sobre la peregrinación del Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca en Piura, trabajo fotográfico que vengo haciendo desde el año 2008 y con el que he obtenido reconocimientos internacionales tales como Picture of the Year  2013, Picture of the Year 2014, Internacional Photography Award 2014 y Picture of the Year Latinoamérica 2015. Además de exposiciones en la II Bienal de Fotografía de Lima y LimaPhoto, como parte de mi proyecto Cautivos.Takanakuy, Los Peleadores Andinos, es un trabajo realizado en diciembre del 2014 en Chumbivilcas, Cusco, El takanakuy es un festival anual celebrado en diversos pueblos de la provincia cusqueña de Chumbivilcas, generalmente el 25 de diciembre, y que tiene como foco una suma de peleas entre parejas de individuos. Además de preparativos vinculados a grupos de parentesco y de un complejo proceso festivo, que tiene un carácter marcadamente colectivo, el takanakuy concreta en decenas o centenares de peleas, espontáneas o previamente pactadas. El nombre evidencia esta centralidad: “Taka” es “trompada” o “puñete”, “takay” es “golpear”, “trompear”, y “nakuy” es “hacerse mutuamente algo”.¿Por qué la campaña de crowdfunding para ir a Perpignan?Mis viajes fotográficos a Haití, Cuba, Líbano, Siria, Irak, Guatemala, Colombia y en el Perú  así como los gastos en mi exposición Cautivos son financiados por mi y casi nunca  se recuperan los gastos, por eso es que en esta ocasión estoy utilizando una campaña de crowdfunding para llegar a Perpignan. Asistir al festival Visa Pour L'Image presentar Takanakuy y Refugio del Alma en persona es tanto una cuestión personal y un momento clave en mi desarrollo profesional como fotoperiodista freelance. Voy a tener la oportunidad de mostrar mi trabajo a docenas de más importantes curadores, críticos, editores y especialmente del mundo que se espera que puedan elegir de publicar este u otros trabajos previos y / o asignarme con nuevos proyectos. Por lo tanto, le pido su apoyo para ayudarme a tomar ese paso importante LAS FOTOS LAS PUEDEN ELEGIR DE MI PAGINA WEB Y DE PDFs DE FOTOS QUE ENVIARE A QUIENES ESTEN INTERESADOS, PUEDEN ESCRIBIRME A scv5@hotmail.com o llamarme al 951724344 http://www.sebastiancastaneda.comMuchas gracias por tu apoyo!-Sebastian Castañeda

story:
Dear Friends and Family~

I am very excited to announce my book is finished and will be out soon! It's been about 3 years of writing...and that following 17 years of journaling. Don't worry, I didn't include ALL of that! Writing was therapeutic, but somewhere along the way, I learned that many of you related to my story with your own brokenness and heartache. This IS my story, but it's also much more. Woven in with the tears and laughter is God's redeeming grace, even while feeling He had abandoned me or didn't care. He is Sovereign, and He is Good. Wow! It's taken time for those words to come and be truly from my heart. I healed as I wrote. I pray you will heal as you read. Thank you and blessings! Sara
  

What I Need and What You Get

Based on my contract and my best research efforts, I've come up with the following budget. Take advantage of the Perks, or donate any amount by hitting the "Contribute Now" button. If you come up with another Perk idea, let me know via email and I'll do what I can! (saragraph918@gmail.com)

Here's how your money will be spent:

* Editing:  $1,760.00

* Typesetting:  $877.00

* Barcode & ISBN:  $200.00

* Cover:  $500.00

* E-Book Formatting:  $400.00

* Printing 1,000 copies:  $1,700.00

* Shipping costs:  $1,000  (approx.)

* Indiegogo Fees:  $650

TOTAL  $7,087.00

The goal of $7,000.00 should completely fund the publication and printing of my book! A website would be beneficial for future ministry opportunities and further book distribution, but that is not the first priority. IF the goal is exceeded, that is how the extra money will be spent!
I am expecting to reach the goal; however, there is always a chance that I won't. SO, since I am already committed to many of the above fees, the only viable option for reducing the budget would be cutting the printed book. In that event, everyone will receive just the E-book. :-(
  

Other Ways You Can Help

PRAY!!!  And please share my Indiegogo campaign with your friends!

story:
THE STORY OF MY BOOK

My name is Emily Cole and I am the author of AthlEATS! I am so excited to finally share this labor of love with you all. I wrote this book because I wanted to create the foundational guide to sports nutrition for athletes that I wish had existed for me. Learning how to fuel myself properly is the main reason I was able to earn my spot on the track and cross country teams at Duke University, but when I was first trying out new foods and recipes, the information I could find on what athletes should and shouldn't eat was overwhelming and confusing. With AthlEATS, I create a unique guide to this complicated topic by including exclusive interviews with olympians, world series champions, and registered dietitians on their experiences learning to fuel at an elite level. In addition to sharing stories from these experts and tying them into foundational nutrition topics, I’ve added easy recipes for you to put each chapter’s recommendations into practice.

After two years as a Division one athlete, I have learned from multiple sports dietitians and understand even more about the complexities and best practices when it comes to fueling. I hope to provide a base for athletes to not only understand the huge impact eating well will have on their performance, but also the understanding that a great diet doesn’t mean obsessing over protein and calories - and looks different for everyone. Just as an Olympic marathoner will have a different diet than an NFL quarterback, the way YOU fuel yourself and your goals should be personally tailored to what makes you feel and perform your best. I’m not saying this is easy to find; patience will be key while you experiment and search for what works the best for you. But I promise it will be worth it.

Although I will certainly share tips tailored to athletes who expend thousands of calories a day, this book is for everyone. Whether you are looking to stop feeling tired all day, see more time on the field, or see more gains in the weight room, the stories and information I share will help you take your happiness and health to the next level by providing you with a deep understanding of what your body needs and when. My ultimate hope is that after reading AthlEATS, you will be three things: aware of the importance of nutrition, equipped with recipes to level up your game, and fully confident and guilt-free when indulging in the occasional burger and fries.
 

THE BOOK BREAKDOWN - AthlEATS

The book is written in 2 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters [1-7]. This first section aims to educate you on the fundamental concepts within sports nutrition. I interview registered dietitian and Olympic trials qualifier Maddie Alm about the important role of proper fuel in an athlete’s training, then dive into what proper fuel actually means and how you can achieve it.

Part 2 contains chapters [8-12]. In these final chapters, I focus on how to balance eating whole foods that fuel your body with delicious foods that fuel your soul. With exclusive interviews from athletes like Olympic medalist April Ross and Ironman champion Jesse Thomas, I share how elite athletes themselves still eat pizza and ice-cream, and have learned to deal with the pressure society puts on athletes to eat perfectly and look a certain way.
 

WHAT I NEED & WHAT YOU'LL GET

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.

The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

CAMPAIGN GOALS

Tier 1: Hit $5,000 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,000 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,000 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Emily Cole is a division 1 track & field and cross country athlete at Duke University. She was a part of the team that won the 2021 ACC track and field championship, and is the Texas state record holder in the 2000m steeplechase. Her passion for healthy eating stemmed from seeing how it completely changed her trajectory as an athlete and helped her be able to compete at the level she does today.

Although she is still nailing down how to make the perfect PB&J, she knows well the importance of the carbs and protein it will provide to power you through your next workout. Whether you are trying to nail down your pre-workout fuel or understand what to eat to sleep better at night, she combines all the most recent research and elite athlete’s perspectives as well as her own experiences to teach you all of these important concepts within sports nutrition.

For more information, you can connect with Emily Cole at ecduke23@gmail.com and @eemilycolee on Instagram and tiktok.
 

INTERNATIONAL PREORDERS

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form [https://forms.gle/sThkp53qcSc17c1H7] to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit! )

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #AthlEATS and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instagram - @Eemilycolee / @newdegreepress
Tiktok - @eemilycolee
Facebook - Emily Cole / @NewDegreePress
Twitter - @eemilycolee / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

~ Emily
