story:
Short Summary

6,834: What a nightly ‘I love you’ taught me about life, leadership, and the pursuit of happiness is the story of growing up with an entrepreneurial mom and how that influenced every aspect of my life, from dating to my career. I retell the story of my relationship with my mom and how her entrepreneurial spirit inspired my own journey.

My name is Olivia McDonnell and I am the author of 6,834: What a nightly ‘I love you’ taught me about life, leadership, and the pursuit of happiness. I wrote this book because the greatest gift my mom ever gave me was the confidence to walk into any room that I earned a spot in.  

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the profound power of love between a mother and daughter while inspiring the next generation of women to see themselves in executive roles. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to escape from the status quo and join our journey of a few laughs, and a few tears, both in and outside of the boardroom.

6,834: What a nightly ‘I love you’ taught me about life, leadership, and the pursuit of happiness speaks to moms and young women, who grapple with imposter syndrome and challenging the status quo in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that this book inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How does having an entrepreneurial role model impact the life of a young girl?
  • How can we shatter the glass ceiling through having more female role models?
  • How do women overcome imposter syndrome within their career or at home?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing female entrepreneurship will change us all for the better.

About The Author

Olivia McDonnell is an author and entrepreneur with nine years of experience successfully climbing the ranks of Wall Street before pursuing her MBA at the University of Southern California Marshall School of Business.

Never someone to accept the status quo, Olivia decided to write this book when she realized how growing up with an entrepreneurial mom gave her a unique perspective on life. Understanding that entrepreneurship is the backbone to achieving the American Dream, Olivia is passionate about empowering disruptors and innovators.  

An avid music lover and aspiring beach bum, you’re most likely to find Olivia driving the PCH with her sunglasses on, hair blowing in the wind, and singing along with the radio.

For more information, you can connect with Olivia McDonnell at OliviaMcDonnell.Author@gmail.com and at @OliviaMcDonnell_author.

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #6834Book and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Olivia McDonnell

story:
Als je wil kan je dagelijks wel een petitie tekenen om de Belgische politiek aan te sporen om meer te doen aan de huidige vluchtelingencrisis. Het zijn echter vrijblijvende petities: je naam, je e-mailadres en een klik. De impact van dergelijke petities is navenant.

Put your money where your mouth is 

Ook deze petitie heeft als doel om de Belgische politiek aan te sporen om meer vluchtelingen toe te laten. Maar deze petitie is niet vrijblijvend. Deze onderteken je met een donatie. 5 euro of 100 euro: het bedrag maakt minder uit dan het feit dát je tekent. 

Het Duits model

Met de opvang van 100.000 vluchtelingen zal België het voorbeeld van Duitsland volgen, dat ongeveer 800.000 vluchtelingen zal opnemen. Gezien België ongeveer 8 keer minder inwoners telt, is 100.000 het doel.

100.000 vluchtelingen = 1% van Belgische bevolking

100.000 vluchtelingen: dat komt overeen met 1% van de totale Belgische bevolking. Dat is goed doenbaar. Deze mensen komen uit relatief goed ontwikkelde gebieden en hebben vaak een opleiding. Het komt er dan aan om die talenten zo snel mogelijk te activeren. 

De opbrengst van deze niet-vrijblijvende petitie gaat naar Vluchtelingenwerk.


Heb je nog vragen, neem dan contact via
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/andreastirez
E-mail: mailto:andreas.tirez@gmail.com

story:
**Excerpt (Prologue) from After The Fires Went Out: Coyote**

 

I've almost finished the first novel in my post-apocalyptic series, After The Fires Went Out. I'm going to self-publish it later this year, but I want to make sure that the finished product is done right. This means editing, both critique and copy.

These services will cost between $1000 and $3000. Funds above that would go toward edits on the second book in the series.

I'd consider $1000 to be a rip-roaring success. Everything above that is tasty, tasty gravy. Please see below for "stretch goals" if I make it over $1000.

Because my wife won't let me use the kids' Christmas present budget on novel editing for some strange reason, I'm hoping that random Internet lurkers will pay for it instead.

The world will be a much happier place if this novel is put together properly. And a successful novel launch will distract me from writing more stories about gnome sex (don't ask).


What's The Novel About?

After years of climate catastrophes and economic strife, society was on the brink of collapse. When the news came in that a extinction-level comet was on a collision course with Eastern North America, the panic spread quickly throughout the world. For Robert Jeanbaptiste, being stranded away from his wife and daughter means that he doesn't know what happened to them when the city of Toronto tore itself apart. But after the comet came and set the forest and fields alight, he finds himself with someone new to care for, a teenaged girl who's lost everything, too. Now he's made a promise to protect her from the chaos, but with food and fuel running out in a world without rules he'll soon realize just how hard it is to keep it.

You can download a free short story set in the same world on the GALLERY page. Or grab it from Smashwords.

But What About those Strech Goals?

"Oh, yes, you need to have stretch goals. That's what crowdfunding is all about, son."

If I hit $1000, I'll include a new short story set in the same world as After The Fires Went Out. (this will be sent to all backers)

If I hit $2500, I'll include a second short story set in the same world. (all backers)

If I hit $4000, I'll get started on the second installment of After The Fires Went Out (actually, I'll be doing that either way), but the difference is that I'll send an advance copy to all backers once it's ready.

story:
En Resumen:

Durante los pasados 13 años muchos de ustedes me han conocido como astrologo, motivador, “Coach” y hasta como autor de mi pasado libro, “Tomando Control de tu Destino.”  Ahora regreso nuevamente como autor de una novela que tiene que ver con la recopilación de mis experiencias que he tenido con mucho de ustedes.

Esta novela representa mucho para mí, pues se convierte en una herramienta que aportara a otras miles de personas que seguramente necesitan entender las tribulaciones que ocasiones pasamos y no entendemos el porqué.

Hoy quiero hacerlos participe de esa contribución que podemos aportar todos, a la vez que ustedes me estarían ayudando en la publicación de un libro que servirá a muchas personas que así lo necesitan. Convirtiéndote en ese amigo especial del “Alquimista.”

Qué es lo que necesito y daré a cambio:

Durante las próximas semanas necesito levantar la cantidad de $8,000.00 dólares. Con el grupo de amigos de FaceBook, eso no debería ser difícil. Con más de 5 mil amigos, la contribución de 800 amigos donando $10 dólares cada uno, estaría llegando a la meta deseada.

Ese dinero estará destinado de la siguiente manera:

  • El arte de la portada
  • La edición.
  • Subirlo a Ebook y OnDemand Printing
  • Impresión del libro para distribución en Puerto Rico.

A cambio de esa contribución de $10 dólares, cada contribuyente estaría en las páginas de libro, “El Alquimista del Espíritu” identificado como; “Los Amigos del Alquimista” Esto se hará solamente en la primera edición del libro. ¡Imaginate! Tú nombre registrado en el libro e identificado como ese amigo especial del alquimista.

Existen otras maneras de contribuir:

1.  El Libro El Alquimista del Espíritu autografiado.

2.  Amigo El Alquimista Gold

3.  Seminario: Despertando el Alquimista en Ti

No importa lo que se recoja, el compromiso es que el libro saldrá a finales de octubre, listo para ser entregado como regalo a esa persona tan especial.

El Impacto que tendrá “El Alquimista del Espíritu”

Quizás lo más fascinante de este libro es que nos presenta unos temas sumamente revelador, por ejemplo;

  • Toca el tema de la muerte de una manera muy hermosa. Tanto para aquellos que temen a la muerte o aquellos que han perdido a alguien, aquí encontraran en este libro una luz de esperanza con un encuentro asegurado,

  • Presenta de manera viable en como todos podemos alcanzar un crecimiento espiritual, logrando acceso a ese cambio alquimista que hay en nosotros.

  • Nos permite ver y adentrarnos a un mundo espiritual realmente esperanzador.

Durante años he estado contribuyendo al bienestar del prójimo, el pasado libro fue un éxito y los próximos libros que saldrán serán igualmente significativos para el continuo crecimiento de las personas. ¡Ahora tú puedes formal parte de esa contribución!

El Reto:

El único reto que tengo es levantar los fondos, y sé que eso no será difícil con el apoyo de todos ustedes.

Otra manera de ayudar:

Si estás en esa posición económica que realmente no puedes contribuir, existen otras maneras en que puedes ayudar. ¿Cómo?

o  Comparte con tus amigos de Facebook el enlace, dile porque es importante que contribuyan,

o  Consigue 10 personas que contribuyan los $10.00 y automáticamente formaras parte de “Los Amigos del Alquimista”

Desde ahora te extiendo mi mayor gratitud, deseándote muchas bendiciones por tu contribución.

“Que sea tu espíritu el que ilumine tu camino siempre”

story:
The Plan

I am a writer with an MA in Professional Writing from Falmouth University. I write on a freelance basis and I currently run my own website. This I do for free and it is for all intents and purposes a labour of love.

For the last year I have been publishing film and TV reviews at andymckendry.com. I've written over 70 feature articles and I now want to make something tangible, something that you can physically own.

I've been developing a magazine layout (24 page spread) with ten articles containing both film and TV review. I want to self publish this and share the artifact with my readers.

Publishing has always been a writer's dream and now with the advent of social media, better marketing options, and the ability to just do it yourself (professionally) it seems like a good idea to develop my existing work into a real and tangible object.

I've been writing the articles for free and have not had any sort of financial objective in mind. Now, I would like to commemorate a very busy year and do so in print.

If you would like to be involved then please don't hesitate. It's always been for the audience and the magazine is ideally another iteration of that desire. 

This will be a DIY publication, one that is a unique artifact containing original writing, and the magazine will be as rare as we make it - the more contributions, the more copies that exist.

Where do we go from here?

The contributions will go on printing costs - it really is that simple. The more money contributed, the more magazines developed, and the more readers with a printed and original magazine to own.

The magazines will be available for purchase on my website in February and the price will be determined by how much is raised on here.

Any contributions over £8 will receive a copy of the magazine in the post.

The Impact

It's been great fun writing for my website but it is relatively limiting. I have always appreciated a good physical copy of a magazine and I would love to develop my work further. This is certainly an experiment but if it works it could translate into a more frequent publication.

Risks & Challenges

It's not an especially difficult proposal and really I'm simply wanting to translate the work that I have already done into something tangible. I want to present my readers (both current and future) with something real, something that you can hold onto, and something that showcases my work too - it's not purely altruistic.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially I completely understand. I'm not particularly well off myself. However if you are skilled with InDesign then you could help me with the layout of the magazine itself. I'm learning how to use this software but I have no idea when it comes to the more complex options like developing a digital responsive copy.

Thanks for reading and I hope that we can make something tangible together. This is a personal project and one that I will keep developing and working on. There are plenty more film reviews in the pipeline and I will keep posting them on andymckendry.com (for free and for you, the reader).

story:
We are Leading Leaders for Peace, a joint grassroots group of Israelis and Palestinians who are united under the single resolution of having our leaders meet and work together towards a just solution to the conflict of our region. We need your support!

The Time is Now

With the current peace negotiations fluctuating, it is vitally important that our leaders and the world see their people - on the ground - coming together to support the peace process. 

What are we doing about the situation?

For over 2 years, we have been organizing non-violent events across Israel and Palestine to demonstrate our support for the peace negotiations and reaching a peaceful and just solution for all.

Besides marching, we have sent a letter to our leaders urging them to move ahead with the peace negotiations. We delivered these letters - together - in person to the Israeli Prime Minister's Office in Jerusalem and the Palestinian Muqata in Ramallah.

We partner up with other non-violent Israeli and Palestinian peace groups because we believe our voice is much stronger when we are standing together. 

Our movement has grown from a few dozen to literally thousands of participants and supporters from our region and around the world.


Make Our Monthly Peace Marches a Reality!

We proudly held our 6th peace march on Friday, March 28th. Hundreds of Israelis and Palestinians from the West Bank came together and walked in a beautiful crowd of white Peace shirts and banners across the port of Tel Aviv. Read about the event in the Times of Israel here.

But, this is still only the beginning. Our goal is to have a joint march every month - that grows bigger and stronger with every passing event.

We are already planning ahead to our next march in May, but we want to ideally hold events like these much more often!

In order to push forward and keep up with our monthly events and growing popularity, we are are continually looking for volunteers, partners, and contributors. For this coming event and many other initiatives in the near future, we need your support! 

  1. Contribute to the cause! Every bit counts for us and we appreciate it. Your contributions will go directly towards making our next towards the full range of our logistics and activities, including transportation, getting permits, t-shirts, signs, flyers, snacks, and more!
  2. Spread the word! People and our leaders need to know we exist and we are not backing down. Please email, facebook share, tweet, and tell others about our campaign and project. 
  3. Become our partners for peace! We regularly join forces with other non-profit and non-violent peace groups in our region and throughout the world. 

With your help, the funds will go towards making our monthly peace marches a reality!

You Can Help, More Than You Know!

There are Israelis and Palestinians who are working together, hand-in-hand, in order to change our reality for the better. Why isn't this on the news more often? Why haven't people around the world heard about us? You can help us more than you know ...

1) Connect with us on Facebook please! https://www.facebook.com/LeadingLeadersForPeace

2) We just started a Twitter account - find us here: https://twitter.com/Leaders4Peace

3) Share our message, add comments, tell others we exist! Visit us at http://www.leadingleadersforpeace.com/

Thank you,

Yoav, Ali, and everyone at Leading Leaders for Peace

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Hi, wir snd Laura und Christian und Mitglieder bei attac Bremen. Wir haben die Bremer attac-Pfingstakademie mit initiiert. Vom 6. bis 8. Juni gibt es im Kulturzentrum Lagerhaus spannende Podien und Workshops zu Globalisierung, Freihandelsabkommen, solidarische Ökonomie, Grundeinkommen und ein Fest zur Griechenland-Solidarität. Werner Rätz (attac), Hanna Poddig (Aktivistin) und Constanze Kurz (Chaos Computer Club-Sprecherin) kommen auch.

Mit dem Geld aus der Crowdfundiung-Kampagne möchten wir die Pfingstakademie noch bekannter machen - durch eine Beilage des Flyers in der "taz" (tageszeitung).

Was wir brauchen & Was man bekommt

214,- Euro für die taz-Beilage gehen an die taz. Der Druck der 2.000 Flyer dafür kostet 200,- Euro. Zusätzlich wollen wir noch für 86,- Euro Plakate drucken - zusammen sind das 500,- Euro.

Als Dankeschön (perk) gibt es schöne Buttons zur Pfingstakademie.

Wenn das Ziel nicht erreicht wird, gibt es keine taz-Beilage, und ihr bekommt das Geld zurück (die Pfingstakademie findet aber in jedem Fall statt).

Die Auswirkung

Die taz-Beilage macht die Pfingstakademie deutlich bekannter, als wenn wir nur so Flyer verteilen würden. Mit der taz-Beilage erreichen wir auf einen Schlag 2.000 Leute, von denen nicht wenige die Pfingstakademie interessant finden werden. Ich habe vor ein paar Jahren gute Erfahrungen mit einer taz-Beilage zum Bremer Sozialforum gemacht - es kamen 500 Leute.

Attac ist ein globalisierungskritisches Netzwerk, das weltweit aktiv ist. attac macht Bildungsarbeit und Aktionen zu den Problemen der neoliberalen Globalisierung und stellt Alternativen dazu vor. Siehe auch attac-bremen.de.

Die attac-Pfingstakademie wird diese Aktivitäten einer größeren Öffentlichkeit vorstellen und zu weiteren Aktivitäten innerhalb von attac und darüber hinaus führen.

Eine andere Welt ist möglich!

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Du kannst auch anders helfen: verteile Flyer der attac-Pfingstakademie (die bekommst du hier: Zentrum für solidarische Ökonomie, Bauernstr. 2 (Di., Do., So. 18-22h), oder Villa Ichon, Goetheplatz 4 (Mo.-Fr. 11-20h und Sa. 11-13h, Flyer liegen links auf der Fensterbank), oder Uni-Glashalle), komme zur Akademie, und/oder erzähl deinen Freunden davon.

Globalisierung, Freihandelsabkommen, solidarische Ökonomie,
Grundeinkommen und ein Fest zur Griechenland-Solidarität. Werner
Rätz (attac), Hanna Poddig (Aktivistin) und Constanze Kurz (Chaos
Computer Club-Sprecherin) kommen auch. 

Mit dem Geld aus der
Crowdfundiung-Kampagne möchten wir die Pfingstakademie noch bekannter
machen - durch eine Beilage des Flyers in der "taz"
(tageszeitung).

Was wir brauchen & Was man bekommt
214,- Euro für die taz-Beilage gehen an die taz. Der Druck der
2.000 Flyer dafür kostet 200,- Euro. Zusätzlich wollen wir noch für
86,- Euro Plakate drucken - zusammen sind das 500,- Euro.
Als Dankeschön (perk) gibt es schöne Buttons zur Pfingstakademie.
Wenn das Ziel nicht erreicht wird, gibt es keine taz-Beilage, und
ihr bekommt das Geld zurück (die Pfingstakademie findet aber in
jedem Fall statt).
Die Auswirkung
Die taz-Beilage macht die Pfingstakademie deutlich bekannter, als
wenn wir nur so Flyer verteilen würden. Mit der taz-Beilage
erreichen wir auf einen Schlag 2.000 Leute, von denen nicht wenige
die Pfingstakademie interessant finden werden. Ich habe vor ein paar
Jahren gute Erfahrungen mit einer taz-Beilage zum Bremer Sozialforum
gemacht - es kamen 500 Leute.

Attac ist ein globalisierungskritisches
Netzwerk, das weltweit aktiv ist. attac macht Bildungsarbeit und
Aktionen zu den Problemen der neoliberalen Globalisierung und stellt
Alternativen dazu vor. Siehe auch attac-bremen.de.

Die attac-Pfingstakademie wird diese Aktivitäten einer größeren
Öffentlichkeit vorstellen und zu weiteren Aktivitäten innerhalb von attac und darüber hinaus führen.
Eine andere Welt ist möglich!
Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann
Du kannst auch anders helfen: verteile Flyer der
attac-Pfingstakademie (die bekommst du hier: Zentrum für solidarische Ökonomie, Bauernstr. 2 (Di., Do., So. 18-22h), oder Villa Ichon, Goetheplatz 4 (Mo.-Fr. 11-20h und Sa. 11-13h, Flyer liegen links auf der Fensterbank), oder Uni-Glashalle), komme zur
Akademie, und/oder erzähl deinen Freunden davon.

story:
Dear Friends,

After years of traveling and sharing spoken word poetry, this book is my offering of prayers, lessons, memories, culture, testimony, medicine, and magic for the betterment of our world. I speak as a child of indigenous and Latin American diaspora, and as a young queer woman of color activist.

Why This Book Matters

  •  Because I'm one of few Latina/Mestiza young women committed and dedicated to sharing their truth out loud through poetry in community.
  • Because the book gives voice to a queer woman of color, and shares herstory, a story that is often made invisible or oversimplified by mainstream culture.
  •  Because it speaks openly about mestizaje, queerness, spirituality, and activism
  •  Because it brings healing and connection
  •  Because it invites a new generation of women's voices to be affirmed and not shamed and silenced

What Will Be in the Book

New poems that share the lived realities and perspectives of women of color on topics like:

  • Diaspora
  • Equal pay
  • Reproductive rights
  • Response to sexual assault
  • Love
  • Hoodology
  • Music
  • Moon Time
  • Loving Man
  • Loving Woman
  • Colonialism
  • Theology
  • Culture
  • Purpose
  • etc

As well as:

  • Poems presented at the 2014 Texas Democratic Convention, TEDxUrsulineCollege, The Dallas Museum of Art, The Prindle Institute for Ethics, Boston University, etc.
  • A sampling of my most popular spoken word pieces, including: In the Grey, Music 101, and Where I'm From

Why I Am Self-Publishing

  • Learning to control forms of production for myself and my community is a sustainable cultural investment
  • It's a way to share my community's voice that has historically been excluded from mainstream production
  • To carve out new spaces for alternative voices to be heard
  • To empower my community to collaborate in my creating
  • Because collective production builds strong communities of solidarity

How I Arrived at My Financial Goal

$2000 = 6-8 Weeks writing hiatus with limited paid engagements

$500 = Off site writing retreat

$1000 = Editing services

$600 = Publishing Support (Copy right, ISBN, etc)

$650 = Book Cover Design and Layout

$500 = Media Marketing

$500 = Initial Print-on-Demand Run

$250 = Miscellaneous

All contributions will be reciprocated by heartfelt gratitude and perks like handwritten thank you notes, previews of the manuscript, special performances, and even shout outs in the book! Read more on the perks section of this page!

In the event that this project gets oversubscribed - and I will be humbled if it does - extra funds will go to the translation of the book from English to Spanish.

How Else You Can Help

Although financial contribution is vital for the production of this project, it is not the only way you can help! If you are wanting to be involved in a different way or If you find that your not in a position to help me with financial support, here are some other things you can do to support me and this project:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!
  • Reach out to me and show some love through words or any other ways you might express love! Prayers, food, medicina, and art are all accepted!
  • Contact me if you have talents or resources that might help the production of this project and are interested in collaborating!

Risks and Challenges

This will be my first self-published book. No doubt I will encounter many unfamiliar elements including collaborating with other artists and making sure I produce the highest quality of work within the timeline set. I plan to have a fairly quick turn around and have the book published by February 2015. Consequently, I have surrounded myself with talented and well-versed culture creators and have no doubt that with every teacher will come a lesson and with every lesson will come something powerful to share! Finally, I am more than confident that if this project is funded, I will honor and draw inspiration from the trust and accountability given to me by those who believe in this work.

Please consider making a financial contribution to fund this publication.

Thank you!

Erica

story:
Short Summary

Sass & Balderdash is a humor and opinion blog I created in September 2012. Since its creation, Sass & Balderdash has grown to over 5,500 followers and has been included in WordPress.com's list of recommended humor blogs. It's a space to laugh at everyday life, pop culture, and - perhaps most importantly - yourself.

Who Am I?

I'm Katie Hoffman, and aside from the occasional guest post, I create all the content on Sass & Balderdash. Sass & Balderdash is near to my heart because I started writing it at a time in my life when a lot of things were changing. In September 2012, I had lost about 100 pounds over the course of the prior year, and I was struggling to find a full-time job after graduating in May. This has been my first experiment with both blogging and humor writing, and I'm really proud of my little corner of the Internet.

What I Need & What You Get

Web design, web design, web design. I plan on moving self-hosting Sass & Balderdash soon, and I have a very specific vision for how the page will look--it just so happens that vision is expensive. I want it to look more professional, be responsive across devices, and maybe even generate an oooh-aaah or two.

The Impact

When I started writing this blog, I never anticipated anyone would read it. It seemed like one of those whims I decided to act on that wouldn't stick like so many diets and fashion trends I've experimented with in the past. As a writer, I feel like I've really grown up with this blog, and having the resources to make it into a more professional, functional, beautiful space feels like the next step to growing it even more.

Risks & Challenges

I know $1250 is a lot of money, but I don't want you to donate all that--unless you're Diddy. I just need 250 people to skip their $5 coffee in favor of using the Keurig at home one morning. If it's a generous crowd, 125 people could skip lunch at Corner Bakery and contribute $10.

I don't make any money from my blog, but I put time, thought, and effort into it as if it were another full-time job. I know we all have bills to pay, but if you happen to have any loose change you could spare from your couch cushions, I'd appreciate it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page! Twitter, Facebook, email, anything. Even if you can't donate anything, I'll still love you for sharing this. Also, if you happen to know any web designers with serious skills who wouldn't mind dealing with a low-key controlling blogger, pass their information along.

story:
Hey, Sam Peterson here. I wrote a book about being a transgender guy on the men's ward in a North Carolina rehab.  "Trunky (transgender junky)" is my story.

...after 10 years sober and on the verge of artistic success a transguy finds himself secretly depressed. A relapse with pain killers moves quickly to heroin; terrified, he signs up for treatment in the state of North Carolina's industrial rehabilitation complex in Butner. There, 2 weeks after having a hysterectomy, he finds himself on the men's ward of RJ Blackley, trying desperately to pass and not be outed, among a diverse group of criminals, white supremacists, business men, and dopers, some of whom are also trying to get sober. Surprisingly funny, tragi-comic, and brutally honest...

It's going to publication! And The Manuscript needs a final shaping.

Transgress Press--publishers of the amazing "Queer Rock Love" and "Manning Up"--want to put this book on your bedside table. 

Max Wolf Valerio, poet, editor, and author of "The Testosterone Files" has championed my manuscript, and has agreed to edit it! 

Gotta get it to the publishers by May. Here's how YOU come in!

To pay Max for editing time, and to take time off from work to shape the manuscript into book-ready form means monaaay. 

  • Whatever gets raised will go to support this manuscript and its publication. Any excess will be put in an account to support sales and advertising, including travel, printing, and general hoofing.
Here's My Bona Fides and important things!
  • I've got a history of project success--my show workshopped in NYC's 3Legged Dog theater; I've already been published (Gender Outlaws: The Next Generation; Fashionably Late); F to M to Octopus won several grants and even the Independent's Best Original Play. 
  • North Carolina needs more loud voices! Like many other states in America, people have to wait weeks and even months to get treatment for addiction--some of us don't make it. 
  • Thoughtful, provocative, challenging literature from a unique perspective gives us a different lens through which to view the Whole Damn Thing.

NOT JUST A TRANS THING!

The men I met in Butner, NC were all suffering from the impact of gender trauma. To a man they had experienced some form of radical violence, alienation, isolation; most had prison and/or jail time; all of us suffered the self-imposed loathing from the shame of not being able to live up to a construct no-one can embody without causing a deep soul-shattering  divide. Add drug and alcohol addiction to those conditions, and it's a miracle any of us recover.

  • You Can Help With Your Big Ol' Social Network
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Trumpet the cause on ya Book of Face, ya email, ya landline even!
  • Keep your mind and your heart open--there's more going on for any of us than meets the eye.

Thank you for everything you do and all you mean to me.

story:
It All Began with a VOW...

In November 2012, my father passed away due to stomach cancer. Before he was laid to his final resting place, I was standing in front of his casket when I made a vow to myself that "I will do whatever it takes so that no other son would bear the same pain of losing his father to cancer."

I knew from then on that life would take me to a different path. I had long been an advocate of natural healing having myself recovered from a chronic illness after being diagnosed with Hyperthyroidism in 2007. But it wasn't until the passing of my father (the "wake-up call") when I fully embraced my calling to help people deal with their health challenges.


The Calling...

Heeding the call, the idea of a building a place where people can find true healing and transformation dawned on me. The goal seemed so far-fetched and I had no clear picture yet of how it's going to happen. Still, I had to do something with what I know and what I have. Thus began the journey of chasing the Im-possible dream and fulfilling the vow.

In the following year, I founded Friggies, a social enterprise based here in the Philippines whose mission is to instill a healthy lifestyle through its products that are mainly fresh fruit and vegetable drinks.

In one of our early planning stages, my business partner Joey Lee -- a friend, colleague, and who eventually became the co-founder -- once asked me, "Bro, you've got to show me the BIG PICTURE of your plan so I know where we're headed and we can find ways to get there."


The BIG PICTURE

It has been the wallpaper on my laptop for more than a year now, which serves as my dream vision board that helps me visualize and manifest my goals. 

The Great Calling refers to the place for healing, which I call “The Ark of Awesomeness” (inspired by Noah’s Ark). I envision it to be a place where people can experience love, peace, joy, and somewhat similar to X-men Xavier’s School where each and every one can harness their Awesomeness – the gifts, skills and talents we can use to heal the world and make it a better place.

The vow I took 3 years ago has led me to founding Friggies and writing The Path to Awesomeness, both of which leads to ultimately building The Ark. It’s a long stretch from here, but it’s not impossible. I have my entire lifetime to fulfill this lifelong mission.

This is what has brought me here now, inviting you to take this journey with me on The Path to Awesomeness. I need all the help I can get in order to publish the book and share my message to the world.


JUMP IN!

The book deal is already underway. It’s with Balboa Press, a division and the self-publishing arm of Hay House that offers a full suite of services that can help The Path to Awesomeness reach as many people as possible.

Your contribution will proceed to the funds to cover the following:

  • Editorial services
  • Design services (front and back cover, and interior book design)
  • Formatting (E-book, paperback, hardcover)
  • Registration (ISBN, copyright, Library of Congress control number)
  • Distribution services (worldwide book distribution)
  • Marketing and Promotion services (press release, website setup, and other promotional materials)

FALL IN LOVE...

You're going to fall in love not only with The Path to Awesomeness, but also with the perks that come with it.  As a sign of my gratitude and appreciation, you will also receive additional perks, which may include the following based on your contribution:

  • Limited copy of the hardcover edition of the book, with a personal dedication
  • Fan sign posted on social media pages
  • Your name posted on the “Wall of Awesomeness” of the website
  • Online Date!... Have an exclusive interview with me
  • Poem Poster... signed and framed
    (My original poems have been published in two volumes of anthology book of poetry... AWESOME sentimental value!)
  • 1-on-1 FREE online coaching session
    (Before becoming an author, I've been and still conducting juice demos and health talks... PLUS exclusive mentoring on Abundance for your spiritual and financial growth.. Oh yes! It's all-encompassing AWESOMENESS!) 







* NOTE: Images are just mock-up and not the actual material.
Wait 'til you hear me sing LIVE!!! "OMMMMM..."


BE AWESOME!

The Path to Awesomeness will take about 3 – 4 months before it can get published, but don't fret, I’ll give you a sneak peek of the book:


* NOTE: Images are just mock-up and not the actual material.
Stay tuned for updates!


Spread the AWESOMENESS!

Tell your family, relatives, friends, neighbors, office mates, your crush and the whole world about this AWESOME campaign! Check-out the links located below and at the upper left-hand corner of this page. Post and share them on your own social media networks.

There's nothing too little that you can do to help. Even the smallest act can go a long way and you have my BIGGEST THANK YOU!

...and HUGE smiles from my Heart :)))


LET'S DO THIS!

This is just the beginning of our journey...

To LOVE, LIGHT and AWESOMENESS!

FREDERICK ESPIRITU

story:
10-julio-2015. Actualización 4.1.

Atención, primicia del episodio de anoche, TODOS los mecenas que pillen un pack que incluya recompensas, se llevarán además la mini de Monje de MoM Miniaturas! No podemos editar los pledges, pero lo añadimos en su descripción aquí mismo más abajo.


Gracias Manu! ;)

09-julio-2015. Actualización 4.

La actualización de hoy trae las suficientes novedades como para que alteremos la apariencia habitual de esta página.

Hemos añadido nuevas opciones de aportación. Hay disponible un nuevo pack que lleva camiseta en vez de taza, con los mismos extras y opciones. La camiseta será en color negro con esta ilustración, cortesía de Bad Roll Games:

Además, metemos como añadidos las opciones de camiseta y taza. Vamos, que te has comprado la taza y quieres la camiseta? Pues 10€ tienen la culpa... Que quieres añadir más tazas a tu pledge? Pues 10€ tienen la culpa... 

"Oye, pero yo os di pasta de más y ahora me molaría camiseta..." No pasa nada, escríbenos a la dirección de correo de siempre, nos lo cuentas y lo apañamos...

"Bueno, me mola mazo la camiseta y paso de la taza..." Idem... ;)

Obviamente así no recaudaremos más, pero entendemos que a estas alturas hacer esta modificación puede ser un fastidio para vosotros... Ya os contamos en la pasada actualización que nos había costado MUCHO decidir qué hacíamos con la imagen en cuestión... ;)

Además, todos los pledges se llevarán un nuevo añadido, que NO puede meter en las descripciones, porque la plataforma no está preparada para meter tantas cosas, pero que SÍ actualizaré aquí, en la historia de la campaña.

Cortesía del Museo de L'Iber, Museo de los Soldaditos de Plomo, de aquí de Valencia, os llevaréis un descuento del 50% en la próxima entrada que vayáis a comprar para visitar sus instalaciones. Os dejamos aquí un enlace a su web para que pichoneéis un poco ;)

http://www.museoliber.org
Lo dicho, gracias por vuestras aportaciones, y a ver si en estos días de final de campaña conseguimos entre todos pegar un último empujón y sacarla adelante! ;)

Turno Cu4tro es un podcast extremadamente gamberro dedicado a tratar temas de actualidad, y no tan actualidad, en el mundillo de las miniaturas y los wargames.


Tras 3 temporadas de podcast y varias incursiones en el mundillo de los vídeos en youtube, el equipo que utilizamos se nos ha quedado corto para hacer las cosas que queremos ofrecer a nuestro público habitual.

El equipo del podcast dispone de recursos MUY LIMITADOS, ya que no contamos con el patrocinio económico ni el apoyo de marcas ni particulares, por lo que llegar a reunir el monto económico suficiente para comprar el material que necesitamos nos llevaría al menos otra temporada y media... demasiado tiempo para nosotros y esperamos que para vosotros ;)

Con este nuevo equipo mejoraría notablemente la calidad técnica de nuestro podcast y la producción de los vídeos que hemos vuelto a grabar. Principalmente lograremos una mejor calidad de sonido en todo lo que hagamos y no se nos volverá a extraviar un episodio por un fallo de la plataforma.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos, en principio, algo más de 600€ para material, básicamente una mesa de mezclas, una grabadora digital, micros, antorcha, pie basculante, etc...


Pensamos que para conmemorar vuestra ayuda a la compra del material queríamos que os llevaseis un recuerdo, algo físico que pudieseis utilizar. Qué mejor que una taza con nuestro logo? XD


Las tazas son a prueba de microondas, lavavajillas y, de momento, parece que de frikazos como nosotros... XD


Pero no os lleváis sólo la taza! Gracias a los compis, y no tan compis, que tenemos repartidos a día de hoy por este mundillo, también os lleváis, según la recompensa que escojáis, 3 dados de placaje de Willy Miniatures o una mini de Willy Miniatures, un vale de descuento del 15% en Willy Miniatures, una mini de Resina Planet para Euphoria, un reglamento licenciado de Dadi&Piombo, una lámina conmemorativa de Jordi Bayarri, etc... material valorado en más de 40€ sin contar la taza en sí!


Qué recompensas hay disponibles?

LOS GASTOS DE ENVÍO ESTÁN INCLUIDOS

* CON DADOS - 16€:
Con esta aportación te llevas, además de la TAZA GAMBERRA:
- PDF licenciado a tu nombre de Smooth&Rifled en español.
- Lámina de Jordi Bayarri
- Set de 3 dados de placaje de Willy Miniatures
- Vale 15% descuento en tu próxima compra en Willy Miniatures
- Benkei Error de Clonación de Resina Planet para Euphoria
- Vale 15% descuento en tu próxima compra en Bad Roll Games
- Vale 15% descuento en tu próxima compra en Avalon Catarroja
- Orco de HeroQuest 25 Aniversario cortesía de GameZone
- Vale 50% descuento en tu próxima entrada de L'Iber.
- Miniatura Monje de MoM Miniaturas.


* CON MINI - 16€:
Con esta aportación te llevas, además de la TAZA GAMBERRA:
- PDF licenciado a tu nombre de Smooth&Rifled en español.
- Lámina de Jordi Bayarri

- Orco de HeroQuest 25 Aniversario cortesía de GameZone
- Vale 50% descuento en tu próxima entrada de L'Iber.
- Miniatura de Monje de MoM Miniaturas.


* CAMISETA CON MINI - 16€:
Con esta aportación te llevas, además de la CAMISETA:
- PDF licenciado a tu nombre de Smooth&Rifled en español.
- Lámina de Jordi Bayarri
- Sara Star Player de Willy Miniatures
- Vale 15% descuento en tu próxima compra en Willy Miniatures
- Benkei Error de Clonación de Resina Planet para Euphoria- Vale 15% descuento en tu próxima compra en Bad Roll Games
- Vale 15% descuento en tu próxima compra en Avalon Catarroja
- Orco de HeroQuest 25 Aniversario cortesía de GameZone
- Vale 50% descuento en tu próxima entrada de L'Iber.
- Miniatura de Monje de MoM Miniaturas.
* CAMISETA CON DADOS - 16€:
Con esta aportación te llevas, además de la CAMISETA:
- PDF licenciado a tu nombre de Smooth&Rifled en español.
- Lámina de Jordi Bayarri
- Set de 3 dados de placaje de Willy Miniatures
- Vale 15% descuento en tu próxima compra en Willy Miniatures
- Benkei Error de Clonación de Resina Planet para Euphoria- Vale 15% descuento en tu próxima compra en Bad Roll Games
- Vale 15% descuento en tu próxima compra en Avalon Catarroja
- Orco de HeroQuest 25 Aniversario cortesía de GameZone
- Vale 50% descuento en tu próxima entrada de L'Iber.
- Miniatura de Monje de MoM Miniaturas
* AÑADIDO TAZA -10€
Añade una Taza Gamberra a tu pedido por 10€. NO incluye ningún extra adicional.
* AÑADIDO CAMISETA -10€
Añade una Camiseta a tu pedido por 10€. NO incluye ningún extra adicional.

A dónde va a parar mi pasta?

Por si os preguntáis a dónde va exactamente vuestra pasta, aquí os lo detallamos:

- El coste de taza y envío es de poco más de 10€

- El coste de reproducción de las láminas es de 0,18€

- Indiegogo se lleva su pellizquito, que viene a ser unos 0,64€

- Paypal se lleva otro pellizquito de unos 0,77€

Por tanto, unos 11,68€ se van en pagar la taza, la reproducción de la lámina, comisiones varias y los gastos de envío... lo que nos deja que de cada aportación nos quedan algo más de 4€ para material.

Una vez finalizada la campaña, y contando con que lleguemos a alcanzar su mínimo, os iremos informando puntualmente de las compras que vayamos realizando, de manera que sepáis exactamente en qué hemos invertido vuestro dinero ;)


Riesgos y desafíos

El material que depende directamente de nuestras gestiones es tazas y láminas, cuyos diseños se encuentran listos. El tiempo necesario para su producción es mínimo en principio, por lo que las únicas posibles demoras las tendríamos en el envío por parte de las marcas que han decidido colaborar con nosotros en este proyecto puntual y en el reencajado de todo para enviároslo a vosotros. En el plazo que hemos marcado ya lo hemos tenido presente, pero como humanos que somos aunque no lo parezca en ocasiones, pudieran darse circunstancias personales que derivasen en alguna pequeña demora... os tendremos informados.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Os agradeceríamos que, además de soltarnos toda la pasta que podáis, corrieseis la voz y compartieseis la campaña para que llegue a la mayor cantidad de gente posible... que también nos suelte toda la pasta que pueda y a su vez siga corriendo la voz... XD

A ver si logramos alcanzar el mínimo de la campaña ;P


Agradecimientos:

Este equipo de monguers quiere agradecer su colaboración desinteresada a:


Willy Miniatures - Willy Miniatures

Resina Planet - Euphoria Miniatures

Dadi & Piombo - Smooth & Rifled

Jordi Bayarri - Anillo de Sirio

Dionisio Rubio - GameZone Miniatures

Bad Roll Games - Punkapocalyptic

Avalon Catarroja

Alejandro Noguera - Museo L'Iber

Manuel Olmedo - MoM Miniaturas

story:
HEY. HI. HELLO.

pizza pi press is a small press & literary umbrella based in Boston. We love poetry and we love visual art. We love putting them together and watching something colorful and annihilating happen. PLASTIC PÀJAROS is just that. Pre-order it today and keep following pizza pi press for more titles.

  • Melissa Lozada-Oliva is a nationally recognized spoken word poet living in Boston. She's part of the 2015 National Poetry Slam championship winning team. Part poet, part bookseller, all bruja. Find her on button poetry, the guardian, and facebook.
  • Tiffany Mallery received her BFA in Illustration at Lesley University College of Art & Design. She resides several hours outside of Chicago and while not freelancing, she can be found making coffee at her barista gig. She illustrated one day i will be louder than the bruises on your knees and her work has been recognized by the Society of American Illustration.
  • If you pre-order via this indiegogo campaign, you ensure that this chapbook reaches the amount of people it deserves to reach, and then some. Order for yourself, for your mom, your grandma, your dentist, your local zine library. Do it do it do it, and help pizza pi press continue to push the art of badass humans into the world.

what we need & what you get


  • Raising $600 would mean we would be able to print chapbooks for everyone who pre-orders, as well as copies for the artists themselves. Leftover books would be sold at local zinefests, comic expos, and on hand for further orders. if we exceed our goal, great! More books! All money from this campaign goes straight into printing and reprinting pizza pi press titles, as well mailing them out. This is a press we run purely because we love it. Our reward is the success of the artists we publish.

other projects under the pizza pi press umbrella

you can also support pizza pi press and its artists by checking out Maps for Teeth, and our store.

  • Share this please! We love you. Pizza loves you. Love love love.

story:
MY STORY

I’m the author of the nonfiction book, Writing and the Spiritual Life: Finding Your Voice Within, from McGraw-Hill. My first collection of poetry, Territory of Wind, came out from Many Names Press, in 1998. About that book, poet Al Young said, “Vecchione’s compass of feeling, thought and memory point forever towards ‘the hum and buzz of the inner hive,’ where everything starts out sacred and stays that way.” Since the publication of Territory of Wind, I’ve been writing poems and storing them in that inner hive. Now is the time to bring them into the light. My forthcoming book, The Knot Untied, is the culmination of these years of writing.

The publishing world has become an extremely difficult one, based significantly on the bottom line. Rather than enter that fray, I’d like The Knot Untied to be published by the community of people who want to read it. This project is a first venture in what I’m calling Community Publishing. Purchase your copy of the book in advance, or give one as a gift, and support its publication. Contribute at a higher level and your name will be included in the book’s acknowledgements. Perhaps you’d care to opt for a perk that entitles you to a reading and workshop in your home for a group of your friends.

The Knot Untied will be published in the spring of 2013. The first two events have just been scheduled: a reading/signing at Bookshop Santa Cruz and one at The Steinbeck Center in Salinas, California.

  

THE IMPACT

Have you always dreamed of being a book publisher? Now’s your chance! Your support will make it possible for these poems to live in the pages of a book, to be read by others. Even if being a publisher isn’t on your bucket-list, a love of reading poetry is reason enough to join in. Poetry can shorten the divide between people. It shows us how connected we are to each other and lights a path through the forest.

  

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU WILL GET

The amount needed to produce The Knot Untied is $5,500. Lucky for me, graphic designer, Jerry Takigawa, and I are trading services, so that significant part of the project is covered, and it ensures a gorgeous-looking book. The cover art is my own.

Everyone who contributes $25 or more will receive a signed copy of the book, approximately 80 pages.

Those who contribute $75 or more will also have their name included in the book’s acknowledgements.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Help me untie this knot by spreading the word! Tell your poetry-loving friends about this project and encourage them to participate.

Suggest this title to your local bookstore.

Organize a reading in your community.

  

A SELECTION OF POEMS FROM THE KNOT UNITED

 

SING FOR YOUR SUPPER

What if singing

was how you earned your living—

each day, year after year.

The sky above you is blue.

Clouds billow like white dresses.

They are yours

though you do not own them.

Your voice flickers

like a pinwheel of color.

Old uncle has his tune,

as do your sisters and cousins.

Every answer has its question.

Songs, little melodies,

are your job,

for which you never

earn any money.

You live in a house

in a tree.

Rarely do your feet

touch the ground.

Imagine!

 

MY FRIEND MEMORIZES HER GRANDSON’S FACE

In the kitchen, with the summer party going on outside,

you say, “When the baby was sick,

I climbed in bed beside him,

because it is too easy to forget,

and I want to remember.”

 

You remember the furrowed brow in sleep,

flushed cheeks, the unrehearsed perfection of his mouth,

the jewel box of a little fevered face.

 

What will you keep in your purse,

in the zippered clutch of memory?

 

Everything changes.

And too soon,

too soon.

 

CLIMB

Once we crossed Broadway at 153rd St. there was the A & P,

the shopping carts glaring in the summer sun, lined up

at the ready like a parade before the start whistle.

And beyond that there was the big hill.

Even at five, I didn’t like exertion,

especially because the top of the hill hadn’t  much to offer,

except the cool interior of the big, stone church

that I preferred to the heat of city sunlight.

 

For a moment I’d be relieved to be inside, happy even.

The cool darkness made me so, and the surprise, each time,

though I always knew what was coming,

when I dipped my fingertips in the holy water

and the chill startled my forehead awake

and made me forget about outside, the climb

that had tired me and quickened my breath.

After blessing myself, not that I ever felt blessed,

my hand would fall back inside my mother’s hand,

clasping it,, the way one holds something

she’s afraid of losing.

 

Of course I couldn’t have foreseen a loss of innocence,

but I did sense change was on the horizon

like cats know an earthquake’s coming and prick up their ears

before the ground’s slightest tremor, and I knew I would endure.

I would not blot out like my vision did for a moment

upon entering the dark sanctuary from the glare

of shopping carts, the sharpness of the sun.

 

But something in me would want to shut, would be inclined to,

like the bold  church doors, heavy on their hinges,

a compelling desire, to not have to keep standing and shining

as I was driven to by the slight but insistent push of my mother’s hand 

on my back as I approached the altar of my life.
story_txt:
MY STORY
I’m the author of the nonfiction book, Writing and the Spiritual Life: Finding Your Voice Within, from McGraw-Hill. My first collection of poetry, Territory of Wind, came out from Many Names Press, in 1998. About that book, poet Al Young said, “Vecchione’s compass of feeling, thought and memory point forever towards ‘the hum and buzz of the inner hive,’ where everything starts out sacred and stays that way.” Since the publication of Territory of Wind, I’ve been writing poems and storing them in that inner hive. Now is the time to bring them into the light. My forthcoming book, The Knot Untied, is the culmination of these years of writing.
The publishing world has become an extremely difficult one, based significantly on the bottom line. Rather than enter that fray, I’d like The Knot Untied to be published by the community of people who want to read it. This project is a first venture in what I’m calling Community Publishing. Purchase your copy of the book in advance, or give one as a gift, and support its publication. Contribute at a higher level and your name will be included in the book’s acknowledgements. Perhaps you’d care to opt for a perk that entitles you to a reading and workshop in your home for a group of your friends.
The Knot Untied will be published in the spring of 2013. The first two events have just been scheduled: a reading/signing at Bookshop Santa Cruz and one at The Steinbeck Center in Salinas, California.
  
THE IMPACT
Have you always dreamed of being a book publisher? Now’s your chance! Your support will make it possible for these poems to live in the pages of a book, to be read by others. Even if being a publisher isn’t on your bucket-list, a love of reading poetry is reason enough to join in. Poetry can shorten the divide between people. It shows us how connected we are to each other and lights a path through the forest.
  
WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU WILL GET
The amount needed to produce The Knot Untied is $5,500. Lucky for me, graphic designer, Jerry Takigawa, and I are trading services, so that significant part of the project is covered, and it ensures a gorgeous-looking book. The cover art is my own.
Everyone who contributes $25 or more will receive a signed copy of the book, approximately 80 pages.
Those who contribute $75 or more will also have their name included in the book’s acknowledgements.
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Help me untie this knot by spreading the word! Tell your poetry-loving friends about this project and encourage them to participate.
Suggest this title to your local bookstore.
Organize a reading in your community.
  
A SELECTION OF POEMS FROM THE KNOT UNITED
 
SING FOR YOUR SUPPER
What if singing
was how you earned your living—
each day, year after year.
The sky above you is blue.
Clouds billow like white dresses.
They are yours
though you do not own them.
Your voice flickers
like a pinwheel of color.
Old uncle has his tune,
as do your sisters and cousins.
Every answer has its question.
Songs, little melodies,
are your job,
for which you never
earn any money.
You live in a house
in a tree.
Rarely do your feet
touch the ground.
Imagine!
 
MY FRIEND MEMORIZES HER GRANDSON’S FACE
In the kitchen, with the summer party going on outside,
you say, “When the baby was sick,
I climbed in bed beside him,
because it is too easy to forget,
and I want to remember.”
 
You remember the furrowed brow in sleep,
flushed cheeks, the unrehearsed perfection of his mouth,
the jewel box of a little fevered face.
 
What will you keep in your purse,
in the zippered clutch of memory?
 
Everything changes.
And too soon,
too soon.
 
CLIMB
Once we crossed Broadway at 153rd St. there was the A & P,
the shopping carts glaring in the summer sun, lined up
at the ready like a parade before the start whistle.
And beyond that there was the big hill.
Even at five, I didn’t like exertion,
especially because the top of the hill hadn’t  much to offer,
except the cool interior of the big, stone church
that I preferred to the heat of city sunlight.
 
For a moment I’d be relieved to be inside, happy even.
The cool darkness made me so, and the surprise, each time,
though I always knew what was coming,
when I dipped my fingertips in the holy water
and the chill startled my forehead awake
and made me forget about outside, the climb
that had tired me and quickened my breath.
After blessing myself, not that I ever felt blessed,
my hand would fall back inside my mother’s hand,
clasping it,, the way one holds something
she’s afraid of losing.
 
Of course I couldn’t have foreseen a loss of innocence,
but I did sense change was on the horizon
like cats know an earthquake’s coming and prick up their ears
before the ground’s slightest tremor, and I knew I would endure.
I would not blot out like my vision did for a moment
upon entering the dark sanctuary from the glare
of shopping carts, the sharpness of the sun.
 
But something in me would want to shut, would be inclined to,
like the bold  church doors, heavy on their hinges,
a compelling desire, to not have to keep standing and shining
as I was driven to by the slight but insistent push of my mother’s hand 
on my back as I approached the altar of my life.

story:
The Red Dragon, or the Grand Grimoire, is a black magic grimoire that claims to date back some time around the early 1800's. This little book contains instructions purported to summon Lucifuge Rofocale, for the purpose of forming a Deal with the Devil. The work has been regarded as one of the more atrocious grimoires.

Several versions of Il Drago Rosso exist with minor or significant differences. We did extensive research and translation work, to create a new and more complete Italian version. We intend to produce a new faithful english translation of this title. Special care will be taken to ensure that the original intent is maintained.
 

THE MANUFACTURING

• ​Hardcover bound in red Textile
• Measures 100x160 mm
• 120 gram black Endpapers
• 115 gram premium cream Paper
• Sewn book block
• Bookmark and Headbands finished in black silk
• gold foil lettering on the front and spine

Our edition will be strictly limited to 333 hand numbered copies.
 

ABOUT US

BLACK LETTER PRESS is a small, independent publisher based in Turin, Italy, found by Alice Winkler and Claudio Rocchetti.

We specialize on the revive of unusual, old and rare books on a broad range of topics, like the sciences and the history of science, poetry, occult philosophy, art, curious and peculiar novels and more.

We produce limited editions whose design, typography and illustrations are always carefully chosen and reflect the quality and elegance of old times.

Visit www.BLACKLETTER-PRESS.com to learn more about our work.

story:
My name is Michael S. Wilson and I’m the editor of Modern Success magazine.  We are located in beautiful downtown Madison, Wisconsin, which you might remember was the scene of a massive months-long protest and occupation of the capital about a year ago which became the template for the larger Occupy movement.

Here, just off the University of Wisconsin - Madison campus, is where Modern Success is made.  Our audience is the student body and faculty of the UW.  We seek to publish a thoughtful, insightful magazine for the students at the U, one which will hopefully get them thinking about how they will be successful in the future, especially when faced with such difficult hinderances as skyrocketing tuition, massive debt encumbrance after school, poor preparation for an insecure job market and economy, and the over-arching threat of fossil-fuel-based climate change.  

While these obstacles are daunting, they open an opportunity for the students to question the old-guard definitions of success:  money, shiny cars, a big house, loads of consumer products, etc etc etc.  It is our belief that such narrow values have largely gotten us to where we are today, and so we find that this time is a great opportunity for students to re-think those value systems.  While we feel it is important to challenge the mainstream constructs of ‘success’, we feel it is equally important for students to come to their own conclusions, and as such, we constantly encourage them throughout the magazine to research these topics for themselves.

To help the students with these questions, we have assembled some of the great thinkers and artists of our time to fill the magazine with highly valuable (and relatively unknown) information.  Because we feel the information is so important, the magazine is free for students and staff at the University.

You can help us bring thoughtful articles and ideas to the students at the University of Wisconsin by donating today.  Here are our goals:

Printing:  $5,500 (About 4,000 copies at around 60% color; yes, printing is that expensive.) 
Distribution and mailing costs:  $350
Any extra funds will be re-invested directly into the business and/or used to print out more copies of the magazine for the students.  

Check out the shwag you can pick up by donating to us! ———>>

We are also teaming up with Rainbow Bookstore for a special advertising co-fundraiser.  See below.*

We at the magazine hope you will donate to this important project today.  By doing so, you will be helping students consider new ways of attaining success in our modern world, something students are desperately seeking.  I wish you great success in your own future as well.

Sincerely,
Michael S. Wilson
www.modernsuccess.org
2013/ Focal Point Media Group, LLC

shwag
 $10.   Next issue of magazine
 $20.   Comic by Minka Stoyanova (signed)**
 $30.   Comic and mag
 $50.   One year Rainbow Bookstore membership and mag (locals only)*
    -or-
           One year subscription to MS (2013/14 academic year) + next issue

$150.  "Gold Star Donor" mention +

An original signed print by Minka Stoyanova* from the series “Things Might Be True” which was on exposition at the Glasgow-Berlin Edition Exposition in Berlin, 2012.
    +
One year subscription

*RAINBOW AD FUNDER!  If you wish to further support Rainbow Bookstore Co-operative, you can do so by earmarking your donation as "RAINBOW" and that money will be used to get an advertisement for Rainbow in the magazine.  $270 raised:  1/8 page color ad;  $480:  1/4 page;  $790:  1/2 page; $1200:  full page!


**NOTE:  All donors, no matter amount, will be named in the magazine; you can choose an alias or initials if you prefer to remain anonymous.  Minka will receive some of the donation for her work; Rainbow Bookstore will receive part of the donation for the membership.

story:
Hi! My name is Mary Metcalfe. I am a professional writer/editor who has completed the third novel in a series set near Boston, Massachusetts. In Road to Tomorrow, I explore Traumatic Brain Injuries (TBI) and its effects on a young military family.

The RAND Corporation, a highly-respected international research organization, estimates that 300,000 returning American military personnel have varying degrees of TBI. Only in recent years has funding and support been made available to these 'walking wounded'. Spousal abuse is common as are divorces among these victims.

TBIs occur through any trauma to the head, meaning that literally millions of people around the world are dealing with the aftermath of TBIs. For example, a concussion is a TBI.One concussion may heal completely. Multiple concussions? Probably not. Many amateur and professional athletes see their careers end as TBI symptoms worsen over time.

There are many causes: sports injuries, car accidents, falls, blasts - any hit to the head, whatever the cause, results in TBI.

My only aunt saw her successful writing career end abruptly after she suffered TBIs following being hit by a car. I know now that my father came home from World War II with TBI. In my research for Road to Tomorrow, I have met others online who are estranged from their families and struggle with day-to-day living including so many things we take for granted like walking, gardening, reading, writing.

The publication of Road to Tomorrow this fall is my way of helping to bring TBI into mainstream awareness in a way that will shed light on the problem and encourage those suffering with TBI to seek the help and support that could improve their lives.

My Budget

$140             Cover design and layout – print, ebook, banner, web

                   (Probookcovers.com)

$500             Professional copy edit/proofing (Darkwateredit.com)

$200             Typesetting

$105             Ingram account set up

$249            eBook file conversions and accounts set up

                   (Kindle, Nook, Sony Reader, Kobo, iBookstore, Copia, Gardners,

                   Baker & Taylor, and eBookPie)

$300            Management fee (Jason Rutherford, Publishing coach)

$160           Printing of 40 review copies

$800            Video book trailer, promotion (COS Productions)

$495            Blog tour set-up

$ 99             Promotion to reviewers, book clubs, etc. (Jason Rutherford)

$400            Mail-out of 40 review copies

$300            Indiegogo and PayPal fees

­­­­

$3,748         TOTAL

 

Make a Difference!
 
People with traumatic brain injuries come from all walks of life and every country in the world. Any traumatic injury to the head can result in TBI. TBI symptoms include dizziness, headaches, poor eyesight, difficulty controlling emotions, depression, trouble walking. The list goes on.
 
Although this is a fiction novel, the situations described are happening every day in families where one or more members have TBI. TBI is treatable but each person's situation is unique and requires personalized care.
 
Please spread the word into your networks. The next person you help could be a family member or friend. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Story of My Book

Separated: An Owner’s Guide — This book highlights the process of dealing with shoulder injuries through several lenses including the US healthcare system, technology, and genetics.

My name is Trevor Lee and I am the author of Separated: An Owner’s Guide. I wrote this book because there are enthralling, emerging initiatives that improve the prevention and recovery process of shoulder injuries. I want to see the next young swimmer or basketball player keenly protect their health while enjoying and dominating their sport.

My aim is that, in reading this book, you will better appreciate your shoulder and the people who have or are helping you take care of it. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the shoulder and its intersections in other subject matters in you. Ultimately, I want you to see the ideas in the book as tools to enhance your shoulder and wellbeing.

In this book, you'll learn about shoulder injuries and emerging innovations:
  • Drew Brees’ miraculous surgery and rise after Hurricane Katrina
  • The financial hardships endured by a former football player
  • How technologies like VR can directly shape health outcomes
  • And countless other topics
You will love this book if you or someone that you know has experienced a shoulder problem.

Separated: An Owner’s Guide is a non-fiction book that speaks to athletes, weekend warriors, and patients with shoulder problems who are looking at the shoulder and associated diseases for the first time.
 

The Book - Separated: An Owner’s Guide

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-4. The basic framework is established, where we venture through the anatomy and physiology of the shoulder, symptoms of various disorders, and the origin stories of shoulder treatments. We don’t necessarily value or know the name of every single blood vessel in our shoulder, but the design and functionality of our anatomy is climacteric to our wellbeing.

Part 2 contains Chapters 5-8. An assorted collection of innovations and perspectives — gene therapy, new technologies, and more — are explored. For instance, the exciting prospect of stem cells and 3D printing represents scientific advancement and increased accessibility to medical care. It’s incredible to hear about these developments and their impact on our future.

Part 3 contains Chapters 9-13. After learning broad yet relevant subjects to the shoulder, we start to conclude our journey with practical and appropriate measures for the audience to take advantage of. It continues a theme of restoring functionality and introduces prevention measures. Examples of topics include exercises and routines, kinds of foods, and surgical options.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
 
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Trevor Lee has volunteered with Brigham and Women’s Hospital and the food pantry at Brandeis University. In college, he was involved with Asian Baptist Student Koinonia (a Christian fellowship) and worked at the Health Center on campus. He swam competitively for a decade before college.

After unintentionally noticing peers with shoulder injuries and reading countless stories about swimmers battling shoulder problems — in particular Missy Franklin — Trevor took his passion for swimming and combined it with a new passion for improving the health outcomes of all athletes and individuals.

In his personal life, Trevor is a huge NPR podcast (and YouTube) nerd. He plays everything on 2x and can’t go back.

For more information you can connect with Trevor at trevorelee123@brandeis.edu, Twitter (https://twitter.com/tleeswims), & LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/trevorlee19).
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Shoulder2020 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

With gratitude,
Trevor Lee

In college, he was involved with Asian Baptist Student Koinonia (a Christian fellowship) and worked at the Health Center on campus. He swam competitively for a decade before college.After unintentionally noticing peers with shoulder injuries and reading countless stories about swimmers battling shoulder problems — in particular Missy Franklin — Trevor took his passion for swimming and combined it with a new passion for improving the health outcomes of all athletes and individuals.In his personal life, Trevor is a huge NPR podcast (and YouTube) nerd. He plays everything on 2x and can’t go back.For more information you can connect with Trevor at trevorelee123@brandeis.edu, Twitter (https://twitter.com/tleeswims), & LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/trevorlee19). Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Shoulder2020 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!With gratitude,Trevor Lee

story:
*** Please go to our new campaign for March ***

Help us raise enough each month to fund a central campaign headquarters and intensive canvassing. 

The Westminster constituency of Glasgow South West stretches from the Clyde at Govan to the city boundaries at the south and west. It comprises all of the Greater Pollok and Craigton wards and part of the Govan ward. 

The current MP is Ian Davidson but having secured a majority Yes vote across Glasgow, not least in the Glasgow Pollok and Glasgow Southside Scottish Parliamentary constituencies, we intend to unseat him and elect an SNP representative.

Please give what you can to fund our campaigning & then share across your networks. If you'd prefer to give direct then please send to the SNP Pollok Constituency Association 80-07-67 00743206.
